title: Wonderful!
text: Wonderful stay.  We moved out of a Marriott brand hotel as we were very unhappy with the quality/location and moved here.  Rooms were very nice, clean and quiet.  Front desk was friendly and very accommodating.  Beds were fantastic and we got some of the best rest we have had in a long time.   Perfect location with access to multiple subway lines.  Our only regret is that we didn’t start our vacation here.  We strongly recommend.  Thank you!

title: The best hotel in NYC!
text:
We have stayed at 5-star luxury hotels in NYC before but this 4-star hotel (how it couldn't be a 5-star is beyond me) is so much better and more value for the buck! A fantastic hotel and staff at the perfect spot in TriBeca, just next to subway 123, a block away from ACE and just a little bit further from 6 and R.

 We will come back! They made our anniversary very memorable bringing us champagne and red roses to our room <3 

What a amazing staff and the rooms are great and very modern!

We first stayed at room 604 but a plumbing leak issue made us to change rooms and the staff gave us a luxury suite instead (room 910). The suite had an amazing terrace with views over both World Trade One and the Empire State Building <3 Amazing handling from the staffs side!

Kind regards, Elebring family <3

title: Wonderful experience!
text: Everyone we met was exceptionally pleasant and helpful, even going so far as to find a scale for us to weigh our luggage! The room was tidy and roomy, the beds cozy, and the location extremely convenient. They also pay attention to the little details, such as including a hair tie with the shower cap. They made our trip especially memorable by greeting us with champagne and leaving cookies in the room to celebrate our special occasion. They kept in touch via text during our stay to ensure we had everything we needed and even reached out after checkout about an item we left behind. Our stay was delightful! The only suggestion I have is to add a few more hooks in the bathroom for hanging towels.

title: Great discovery in Tribeca
text: Great bed and linens, loved the bathroom finishes and ample size for a NYC hotel room. Wonderful light in the rooms and there is very little street noise for NYC. Fun neighborhood to explore and very convenient walk to Wallstreet or Soho.  Friendly staff. Will certainly stay here again.

title: Good Value for Money
text: Very good room overall. The location of the hotel was great considering that we were in a conference (near by). The check-in was fantastic - we arrived earlier and were allowed to enter the room -that´s a very special gift considering we came from an international flight.

title: It was great!
text: Great experience from beginning till end! People at the front desk are nice and very accommodating, the car service was great, room was beautiful, I highly recommend it. We will be staying here whenever we go back into NYC. Thank you to the staff for making it such a great trip

title: We will definitely be back.
text: Room was amazingly clean.   I slept great. The noise could not even be heard from the streets which is rare in New York. Very close to breakfast spots.  Location was fabulous right by a subway station and super close to World Trade Center. The staff was amazing and very helpful.

title: Great location awesome staff
text: Staff so helpful and friendly. Special note to Mario and Abdul’s amazing customer service. They were both so accommodating on a few special requests, thank you so very much. Overall the hotel room was enormous for NY, great location. Restaurant underneath was excellent. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Celebrated a birthday!
text:
Luis was awesome! Great staff and beautiful place in the heart of NYC!
10 minute walk from Brooklyn Bridge and 8min walk to 9/11 memorial site . Also the views are spectacular from the room . The chef is incredibly talented, best food around town !

title: A vogue jewel in Tribeca.
text: Kudos to The Smyth Tribeca. As a native New Yorker who just moved away in 2021 The Smyth is a gem, a jewel. This boutique hotel is modern, chic and sophisticated. Centrally located with the subway steps away you can be anywhere in Manhattan in minutes. The staff....professional, courteous and makes you feel like they really want you there. Kenya, Abdul, outstanding. I reunited with so many  friends in the lounge and restaurant on several evenings. Impeccable service with a romantic vibe. Fireplace! Rooms are clean and modern. Outlets for iphones are located just where you want them. All the amenities you would expect are included. Tribeca is the new vogue Columbus Circe - Upper west side. Good Vibes.

title: First time New York visit of senior couple from Hawaii
text:
We’re a senior couple from Hawaii and came to New York for my birthday with my wife for our first time. We arrived by cab, driver pulled over double parked in front of hotel, a porter came right out to assist our luggage and helped check in smoothly. 
Super friendly and polite first class service. 

The hotel is brand new, super clean room, super clean bath, super clean toilet, has all amenities. Hotel team is super and keeps in touch by texting to ensure we’re doing fine and helps how to get back to hotel safety. 
Nice cafe and bar restaurant on site, Starbucks across the street, Whole Foods, CVS right around the corner, subway station right infront. 
Slept well in super comfortable bed, super quiet during the night. 

All my worries (heard from my friends?) about staying in New York, Manhattan, downtown were unnecessary. 
Because I was so lucky to stayed in Smyth Tribeca. 

Big Mahalo to the Smyth Tribeca super team

title: Fabulous drinks in a lush atmosphere, wish we had stayed here too
text: We went here for drinks and loved it. We arrived and the lobby bar was the one that was open so we went there first. The atmosphere was lovely, bright and buzzing without being overwhelming or too loud, the staff friendly and helpful, and drinks were fab - my parter said his G&T was one of the best he ever had, and bring British, he's had his fair share. I had two of their specialities which were both delicious. Being a bit of a hotel fanatic, I asked if we could have a show round, and the hotel manager, Pere, was kind enough to show us around. The rooms are lush - they look well kept, with big cosy beds and wonderful bathroom amenities, and as a massive bonus, the rooms are quite large for NYC! Would love to stay here at my next visit to the city. After being shown around we popped in to the lounge for another round of drinks and had a wonderful time there too. The atmosphere in here was great too, more dimmed lights, candles and private. We sat at the bar and it was a joy to sit here and watch the bar manager perform his craft - and the cocktails were perfection! We had a brilliant time at The Smyth Tribeca, Pere and his team looked after us so well and we felt incredibly welcome. The hotel also smells fantastic, and they even sell their signature scent in candles and a room spray - I treated myself to a candle which I love lighting here at home. Wish we had stayed here too, hopefully next time!

title: 5/5 Stars
text: Smyth Tribeca was nothing short of exceptional. It was spacious, impeccably clean, and beautifully decorated. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the amenities provided were top-notch, I felt right at home during my entire stay. The service was truly outstanding. The staff went above and beyond and were friendly, accommodating, and exceeded my expectations in every way.

title: A great place to stay in a great location
text: This is a great hotel with spacious rooms (rare in NYC) that are stylish and chic. Free wifi in rooms makes working very convenient. The location of the hotel is ideal for work and tourism with great subway links in walking distance.

title: Poor Service and Tired Room in an Amazing Location
text: Amazing location in historic Tribeca, but the service and room quality did not live up to the neighborhood standard (or the price!). Our family stayed in one of the suites last month, and unfortunately didn't have a great experience. Room Issues: Heat didn't work, Dining table surface was scratched, Floor was worn, and Couch was stained. Service: Despite requesting an early check-in, we had to wait 3 hours after the room was vacated to get access. There is only a single staff member at the front desk, and I had to wait 15min. for her at 10PM. Even the security guard was shocked at how long she was gone. Wish we could recommend the hotel to friends, but until they upgrade the rooms and staff I think we'll have to send people elsewhere.

title: Offhand service and request a printed invoice to review at checkout!
text:
I have stayed at the Smyth on three occasions and sadly I would say the experience has deteriorated each time. 

As a regular business traveler to New York, I have stayed at many hotels in the city and was delighted on my first visit with both the room, which had a balcony, and the service which was attentive and friendly. 

On my most recent stay, I found the service to be considerably off-hand and the overall experience was no longer amongst the best in New York. 

My journey to the hotel was rather unfortunate, as I was involved in a serious accident on the Van Wyck and so arrived rather shaken. However, when I checked in there was none of the usual greeting of "how was your trip",  just the desk receptionist complaining to me about the guest who had been on the phone! And very hurried in his service as a large group came in behind me. 

The room itself was fine, larger than standard NY hotel rooms, but with very basic decor, which was considerably different from my first stay where the room had a wow factor.  

Overall the hotel location is good for accessing the financial district. There is a gym in the building which is also sufficient. The reception area is very chic, but perhaps out of sync with some of the rooms which require refurbishment. 

I held a team dinner in the restaurant, which has lovely decor and ambiance. Although the food was underwhelming, which was a surprise given it was restaurant week in New York. A colleague had duck which was not to his liking and another colleague and I had seafood pasta which was overly rich to the extent it was hard to digest. The service was quite peculiar, including a waiter pouring water into a colleague's tequila. Fortunately, this was replaced, and placed in a different type of glass to the water glass (which seemed like an obvious thing to do in the first place). 

My major disappointment with the hotel began at checkout. I had used the minibar and wanted to place those costs on my personal card vs corporate card. I listed the items that I had consumed for my entire stay and was told they would appear as a separate bill beneath the room bill. Unlike normal procedures at hotels, I was not shown what was listed on the screen - nor given a printout - I was told it would be emailed. I checked that the hotel had my correct email address, and given there was a queue and yet again the reception desk seemed hurried, I accepted that it would be emailed immediately for my review. Also given I had explicitly listed my minibar items with reception, I had assumed there would be no issues. 

I did not receive the bill via email and due to a hectic work schedule only realized this once I needed to do my expenses several weeks later. Once I was sent the invoice, I realized that there were minibar expenses included in the invoice for the room and the amount I had paid on my card was just deducted from this part of the room invoice. An additional invoice for the mini bar was then listed below, which had been charged to my corporate card and was for a significant amount of money. I do not believe this to be correct given I had noted and explicitly listed what I had consumed for my entire stay at checkout.  In addition, I had also been charged for "donations" which I had not approved. 

On raising these issues with the hotel, the response fell very short of acceptable service. No apology or explanation for charging the donation fee without permission (the invoice was reissued with it removed on my request, although I have yet to confirm it has been refunded). No explanation as to why the reception desk did not show me the minibar charges at checkout. No apology for not sending the invoice. No explanation why additional minibar charges were made to my corporate card - and no note to state they were going to be made in advance -  or any clear proof they were in fact correct, just refusal to refund them!

I do hope the hotel takes this feedback seriously as it was amongst my favorite New York hotels, although unfortunately given this experience I will not be returning to assess whether any actions have been made to improve. In the first instance, showing the guest charges to be made when they checkout is important and getting explicit approval for items like donations is a must.  If additional charges are being made to a guest's card, then advising that via email is needed. Ensuring an invoice is actually provided should also be a priority. And responding to guest requests with a helpful tone would also improve the experience.

title: My Fave Spot
text: My absolute favorite hotel in NYC. Amazing staff. Big, quiet rooms.  Lovely location.   I stay here multiple times a year and just love it. So many hotel are loud and noisy in NYC (looking at you Public) but this place actually lets you unwind.  Pretty solid restaurant and bar on the ground floor as well.

title: Horrible
text: The room was small and the bathroom light kept turning on and off. There was an order in the room and there were clothes thrown outside the window like a homeless shelter. The room was not as advertised.

title: Expensive and poor service
text: Breakfast at the restaurant is average and even though they are not busy the service is not great including filling half a plate with salad when you ask for two eggs any style.  Even though I spelt out my email address clearly and checked with the lady that she understood, they have not emailed me a receipt for my stay as promised.  I should not be surprised as I overheard the gentleman checking out before me who stated they didnt' send him a receipt last time.  They refused to give him a paper copy this time and assured him he'd get an email.  Yeah, right.

title: Top notch hotel
text: The room was very clean and spacious! Front desk staff was helpful and the front doorman (Xavier) was extremely friendly! I would stay here every time I go to NYC...great location! The fact that is was steps away from the subway and a five minute walk to the 911 Memorial area, was perfect for anyone travelling on vacation too.

title: THE Best Hotel Customer Service
text: I recently stayed at Smyth Tribeca-originally planned to stay one night, but in the middle of the night my husband had a health issue that caused him to be rushed to the hospital. The staff went above and beyond to make sure to handle the logistics of extending my stay for an extra night and that we were taken care of. Because of the medical issue, all of my focus was directed to my husband, and every single hotel employee made sure that I didn't need to worry about anything about lodging. Gabriel, Nick, Angela (apologies that I can't remember the doorman's name) made us feel like family, not just customers and I am eternally grateful for their help in making our stay a wonderful experience. From this point forward, I will only stay here whenever I'm in New York, and highly recommend you do the same.

title: If you are looking for a place to stay this is the place.
text: I don’t usually rate my dining and hotel experiences  but this time I was taking names. Let me start with my first encounter at the Smyth with the bellman Xavier greeting us at the door like we were  V.I.P.’s. The front desk managers Louis and Abdul were obviously well trained in customer satisfaction and service (with a smile). Edgar at the desk at night was equally customer focused. If their aim is to exceed customer satisfaction they certainly did with flying colors. After dinner the night bellman Mario greeted us the door like we were entering his home. We asked about the lounge and in proceeded to escort us in and made sure we were seated at a prime location. Ana the room attendant was so accommodating and ensured we had every thing we needed. I can’t say enough about the positive experience me and my wife had other than adding that we will be back. Judging from the Smyth team that I did meet I am certain that the rest of the staff is equally dedicated in guaranteeing a memorable stay.

title: an incredible place and very well located💯
text: We traveled in January 2024 and had an incredible experience. Customer service is very friendly, respectful and effective, everything looks very elegant and clean. The room was perfect and the hotel is perfectly located. 100% recommended

title: Lovely hotel and great location
text:
I really enjoyed my stay. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and cared about the details. 
The room was modern and clean. It’s in a fun location with lots to do but still easy to go around from the subway right outside the door. Will absolutely come back!

title: What a lovely stay
text: We just stayed at Smyth Tribeca for two nights and we felt so well taken care off. Hotel staff are lovely, the room was very spacious and clean, and the location is perfect for visiting Manhattan. Fully recommend it, we will be staying again.

title: Stop scrolling and start picking —- The Smyth! Almost as hot (and sweet) as Samantha’s boyfriend on “Sex in The City”
text: From the second we arrived at this luxurious boutique hotel in Tribeca, we have been overwhelmed by the service. From Mario at the curb to Abdul, Luis and Yube at the front desk, my daughter and I are spoiled now for any other hotel in NYC. I travel here bi-monthly for work and usually stay uptown but this may become a new favorite.  Rooms are spacious for NY and the Rat Pack decor sexy plus they have a cool lounge and trendy, delicious restaurant.

title: Nice staff but Dirty Old Room
text:
We stayed in room#801. Perhaps it's a superior Room, so it's not as well maintained. So, if you want to try out this hotel, you might want to reserve a higher-grade room and see for yourself. The carpet is dark but the stains showed through. There is long collecting dust along the walls and around the furniture. The mattress is old and lots its comfort. The bedsheets and towel are old and overused. There is brown molding around the bathroom's floor and in the shower...etc. 
However, the staff are very helpful and nice. The breakfast is good and again, the staff is exceptional, especially, Xavier at the front door is very attentive. Great job on all the staff but need an overhaul on maintenance.

title: Exceptional Service and Hospitality: A Memorable Stay Experience
text:
I want to express my sincere thanks for the outstanding service during my recent stay. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, especially with the parking for my car. Keeping it parked upfront until I left in the evening made my stay much easier.

I'm really impressed by the team's attention to detail and their professionalism in meeting guests' needs. Based on this fantastic experience, I'd happily stay here again in the future. Thanks for making my visit enjoyable and memorable.
xoxo

title: 3 night stay with family (6 people) at Christmas
text:
Enjoy your family stay over the Christmas holidays
Convenient area, the Metro is at the foot of the hotel, quiet, comfortable hotel
Small downside: the cleaning employee forgot to clean our room on the 3 nights spent without any objective reason (room vacated at 10 a.m. due to an external excursion and we had not left a do not disturb sign )

title: 4.5 stars
text:
4.5 stars. I stayed here for 4 nights in October for work, and it was great. The location was close to our office but also close to many good restaurants and bars (my favorite was Holy Water, two blocks away).

Rooms are quite spacious by Manhattan standards, and were recently upgraded (bathrooms are light and roomy). Prices are also pretty reasonable.

title: Conquering the city with your family
text: Very good city hotel with everything you need and comparably large rooms. Very nice bar and breakfast restaurants downstairs. Very nice personell and a perfect location to conquer the city. Suites are suitable for a family with two kids (:-)

title: Excellent location, stylish hotel but rooms dated
text:
I loved the location of this hotel it was in the heart of TriBeCa with Chambers Street subway right outside the entrance making travelling around the city so easy.
The hotel lobby was extremely stylish and set high expectations for the rooms. 
We booked a superior room however I was somewhat disappointed upon exiting the elevator on the 5th floor as it did not meet with the standard set by the lobby. The carpets were stained and dated and the walls and doors grubby and tarnished. I felt like I’d steeped into a different hotel it was so different from the lobby and looked like a very old apartment complex.
The room itself was spacious and well equipped however again the carpets were stained and the room as a whole grubby and not well maintained. 
The bathroom was well stocked with all the essentials but again wasn’t the cleanest and had mildew around the bottom of the shower screen and on the floor.
It looks as though a lot of care and attention has been spent making the lobby, lounge and tavern look so modern and exquisite but the rooms could do with the same care and attention to bring them up to the standards of the rest of the hotel.
I loved the downstairs lobby, bar and lounge they were amazing and staff so friendly and helpful. 
Location is excellent with a Starbucks across the street and plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. 
I wish the rooms could be renovated in line with the rest of the hotel.

title: Feels like home
text:
From the minute I stepped out of the car, after a 30 hour journey across the globe I was made to feel welcome and a part of something special in the lost unassuming way 
 Absolutely loved my time there.

title: Excellent
text:
When you are tired after a long day full of business meetings, some warm and caring person greeting you with a big smile and offering you water makes you feel very good!
The rooms were very clean, even the temperature felt great. The minute you walk in the door you feel the cleanliness. You see the details in making you feel home.  Personal care items in the bathroom. I loved it! Excellent stay!

title: Smyth Tribeca - excellent location
text: Well-run and comfortable Hotel with unbeatable location, if you want to move around Manhattan by subway. In close proximity to the Financial District, the Hudson Piers, World-trade cneter, Midtown and express and local subway lines. Bright and clean rooms, impeccable house-keeping, smart staff. Plenty of good restaurants nearby.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This is our second stay in 4 months at the Smyth and it will continue to be our go to when we are back in the city. The rooms are sized well and the beds are comfortable. Both visits we were treated above and beyond by the team at the Smyth. There is a beautiful tavern connected and the 1,2,3 trains are just outside the door and the 4,5,6 are a few blocks away. Location cannot be beat and is a nice alternative to noisy midtown or Times Square. I highly recommend!

title: Awesome boutique hotel in Tribeca
text: While overwatering restaurant several times, this was my first time staying in the hotel. The room was lovely, bed extremely comfortable and staff exceedingly accommodating, professional and friendly.

title: Terrible experience, fraudulent charges received
text:
There were two managers (or hosts?) I encountered, one who was extremely skilled with customer service, and one who was not. I will call them Person1 (skilled) and Person2 (not so skilled). 

The PROS:

- Walking distance to my work
- Great neighborhood, as I used to live in the area
- Very friendly front desk staff
- Very Reasonable room rates
- Very Reasonable valet parking rates

The CONS:

1. 1 Hour Late Check: Our room was 1 hour late from check in time because the staff had to clean up extra from the previous guest. That was fine with me, I was okay to wait. Person1 was extremely compassionate and offered us a $75 voucher for the bar or Smyth Tavern. I was pleasantly surprised and appreciative. 3 of my friends came to meet me at the hotel (as I was expecting to be ready to head out for dinner by then), and I asked Person2 (Person1 had stepped away) if we could grab $75 worth of drinks at the Tavern while we waited for the room. Person2 said "No, there are too many of you, plus your friends are not guests of the hotel. We can give you a glass of champagne each instead." I completely understood we weren't entitled to anything at all, so I said "Okay thank you." But I still don't understand why Person2 was so exasperated, as I knew the comp was limited to $75. Even if it went above $75, they could have charged the extra to my room. Instead the group of us had to stand awkwardly at the front desk while this strange exchange happened...  

2. Dirty Room: The trash from the previous guest was not emptied, and was filled over the brim. The corner of the closet door was broken off, and there was a strange brown streak on the wall of the bathroom. 

3. Malfunctioning Bedroom door: We stayed in a suite where there was a bedroom door. When my husband shut the door to the bedroom from the outside, we were locked out of the bedroom. We went to the front desk and they called the hotel "engineer" (similar to a super?) to fix it. He did a great job, and we were thankful. 

4. $1100+ bill from the Hotel (!!): After we checked out, I was extremely dissatisfied and confused to receive a bill for $1100+. I called the Hotel and thankfully Person1 answered. He apologized for all of the inconveniences I experienced, and corrected the mistaken charges to $300+ (which was accurate for parking and hotel fees). He even took off one of the fees because of the trash that was not emptied from the previous guest. I was extremely grateful for the ease of this conversation.

5. The $65 straw that broke the camel's back: 2+ weeks later, I received yet another charge on my card for $65 from the hotel. My stay was already over 3 weeks ago. This is why I am writing this review, this is completely unacceptable and borderline-fraudulent behavior from whoever is approving and executing these charges at the hotel. No matter how convenient and great the location, how great SOME of the staff are, I will never stay at this hotel again.

title: A friendly and hip little spot!
text: What a great staff at this Tribeca gem. Everyone was super but in particular, Xavier at the door gave me great daily walks and always greeted me with a welcoming smile. Such a great spot- highly recommend

title: Stay in Tribeca
text: Have stayed at the Smyth a number of times and it has always been a pleasant experience. The location is key. It’s not overly crowded and it is in close proximity to SoHo and The Village which is where we like to go. The price is reasonable compared to other quality hotels. Rooms are nice and a decent size for NYC standards. The lobby sitting area/bar has been renovated with velvet seating and gas fireplaces which we found to be quite nice for a respite during the day and a cocktail at night.

title: Nice Hotel, could use updated electrical for devices and a coffee maker
text:
Positives: the location is great, the hotel was nice, staff helpful, and the bed comfortable.
Negatives: for a hotel of this price, there should be a coffee/tea maker in the room!  Instead they have lots of expensive snacks laid out to buy in the room.  Didn’t like that one bit.  Also, no coffee in the lobby.  You have to buy it or go out to Starbucks. Big negative was also the lack of set up for working on computer devices.  We couldn’t even find a plug that we could use that had room!  They sent up a very nice man and he put in two extension cords.  So we had a surge protector with all kinds of our plugs and cords on it on the desk area.  Which is blocked by a mini fridge full of stuff to buy.  They need to re-design this aspect.

title: A wonderful stay at Smyth Tribeca
text: Our stay at The Smith was magical! We’re local NYCers but stayed at The Smyth for our wedding ceremony. Yube at the front desk was wonderful and arranged a beautiful welcome gift making the entire stay feel special. We also upgraded our room at a reasonable and fair price on last minute notice. It was a wonderful area in Tribeca, as well convenient to many public transportation hubs and easily accessible by Uber/Lyft/Taxis. Could not recommend the Smyth highly enough. We also had an amazing dinner at the attached restaurant where the staff was kind, polite, and responsive. The food was amazing as well!

title: Staycation
text:
Going to keep it simple. Pros:
Location, Staff, spacious rooms, quaint, sexy lounge with fireplace, restaurant, ambiance, great music, diverse/sophisticated

Cons: Mattresses (not the best quality, but I had a restful sleep), windows are not sound proof (the sounds of the city did not bother me, but may bother others), updated, but still somewhat tired.

Overall, an excellent stay, especially in New York City. Big bang for your buck.

title: The staff are the true gems here
text:
This hotel has the most absurdly friendly staff, which is a double surprise given typical NYC hotels. Every single person we interacted with was friendly and went out of their way to help us. The room itself was decent — way above average for nyc on size and cleanliness, but the reason we’ll be returning is the staff. Special shoutout to Edgar and Yube, and the two wonderful concierges/valets whose names I didn’t catch. Also — the air conditioning works and respects your temperature wishes!

Pro tip: we intended to use SpotHero for overnight parking, and the nearest garages were $80+ for the night, but valeting with the hotel was just about $60. Pretty good deal for NYC and the convenience.

Only minor gripe: the pillows are sort of bad/overly soft and collapse in on themselves over the night.

title: Favorite hotel in Manhattan! Staff is amazing.
text: Such a fan of the Smyth. I used to live in the neighborhood and since moving away this is the only place I stay when I am back in NYC. Great location, clean rooms and the very best staff. Since I've stayed there many many times the past few years I know the staff well now and they are all lovely. Xavier, Nick, Mario, Bart, Abdul, Gabriel, Diana and many more always go out of their way to make you feel welcomed at the Smyth. Xavier especially goes above and beyond to make sure my stay is always the best it can be - I often have boxes I send to the hotel prior to my arrival and Xavier makes sure they are in my room waiting for me when I get there. He's incredibly kind, helpful and professional. He's helped me on past trips with any special requests I've had as well and always does it with a smile on his face. The hotel is also pet-friendly which is nice because I always travel with my dog - who the staff now know and love to see. The Smyth also makes their own dog treats now and my dog loves them. The Smyth is our home away from home and I can't recommend it enough!! Thank you everyone at the Smyth.

title: Solo stay - NYC October 2023
text: Had a quick and well attended arrival. Rooms are comfortable and neatly taken care of. Fitness center was perfect for my needs and hotel location is safe. Restaurant at lobby had great food selection and the bar at night was very lively. Enjoyed my conversation with the staff and team - Pere was very knowledgeable and exhibited great hospitality during my stay. Will return.

title: Great experience
text: My experience has been great so far. Abdul was very helpful with my check -in experience. He demonstrated white glove service. Also, Gabriel was very helpful and kind. Miguel and Stephanie provided great service each time I frequented the restaurant.

title: So comfortable and gracious!
text: My night at the Smyth Tribeca was wonderful. From the moment I pulled up in my car, I knew I was in good hands. The kind man who valeted my car offered to help me unload and then took care to park the car off site. My checkin was flawless, with a welcoming greeting from the man behind the desk. The manager was also helpful and helped direct me to my room. The room was VERY comfortable, well appointed with a fantastic bathroom. Despite the busy corner the hotel is on, the room was extremely quiet, the view stunning. The coffee in the morning was perfect to get me on my way. The morning man behind the desk was so very pleasant, my car was retrieved and off I went with many good memories of my night in NYC. Thank you!!

title: Great location in NYC
text: Close to many attractions and in an area of “old New York”, smaller scale buildings with much more character and history.  I had a meeting nearby that I could to from.  Nearby bakery is fantastic and good selection of restaurants and bars within a short walk.

title: Great Hotel for Business Travel
text:
I came in town for work and was booked at Smyth Tribeca. From arrival to departure, the staff was amazing. Enjoyed happy hour with live music in Gallerie Bar. Guest room was in great shape with the necessary amenities. Also had time to visit the gym, which is better than most hotels I’m booked at. 

This will definitely be my go to NYC hotel.

title: Loved Our Stay!!!
text: The Smyth is a lovely hotel in a great neighborhood, and the bar has delicious drinks; try the Violet Beauregard. That said, the absolute best thing about the hotel was the staff! I was there for a family trip and when I said we were celebrating a birthday, they immediately brought a gift to our room-Xavier was so thoughtful and made us feel like family. We truly felt cared for and taken care of! Special thanks to Xavier, Mario, and Gabriel for being very warm, welcoming, and just the best!!! I will be back!

title: Best in New York!!!
text: The concierge staff was freaking amazing!!! The young men at the door and the desk, so very attentive and made our trip so so so special!!! The genuine kindness and sincere manner from Nick, Gabriel, Mario Xavier!!! The umbrellas!! The best bartender ever!! He made the absolute best violet Beauregard and Girl with the pearl earring!!! We will come back!!!

title: Great stay in Tribeca
text: The hotel was awesome! It was located in a very accessible area, and the service was top notch. Special shout out to Mario, Gabriel and Xavier who made our stay extra special. We would come back to this hotel specifically because of the special attention and treatment we received. Thanks so much!!

title: AMAZING!
text: Smyth Tribeca was the host hotel for our daughter’s wedding. We could not have asked for a better experience! The staff, lodging, food at Smyth Tavern, the bar — all were EXCEPTIONAL!!!! Smyth Tribeca made a special weekend SPECTACULAR!

title: 5 stars!
text:
Fabulous stay all around and I can't wait for my next trip to New York! The entire staff was so helpful and I looked forward to seeing their smiling faces after a long hard day of work.  Rooms are spacious, especially for New York and the bar and lounge are two great options to unwind without going far. The surrounding restaurants are also wonderful.  If you've never stayed in Tribeca before, I highly recommend the neighborhood - it's my favorite in the city!  

Will be back at the Smythe again, hopefully soon.

title: Our stay at the Smyth Tribeca
text: The best thing about our stay at the Smyth was Mario and the gang at the front desk and door. It made our visit very special. Mario helped us in so many ways getting Ubers and drivers to the airport and giving us directions. We had lots of laughs.

title: First NY trip
text: Mario was an amazing host. All of our accommodations were met and just the small talk he made with us made us feel welcome to New York.  The room was amazing for me and my wife and I truly couldn’t ask for a better experience.

title: Excellent customer service
text: Excellent customer service, great location, best ambiance. They communicate with me in advance to know about my requirements. They follow up after my stay to get feedback. Will stay there again next time in NYC

title: Sweet spot in a primo location
text: Great location, amenities, staff & style. Our room was fresh, quiet, comfortable & spacious, with an unusually good TV channel selection (PBS, MSNBC!) A special shout-out for your doorman, Xavier,  who was consistently helpful & friendly. Thank you for a perfect stay.

title: Cancelled Booking & No Customer Service
text: Disclosure as I didn’t actually get to stay at the Smyth: my booking was cancelled due to incorrect pricing at the hotel’s end - no fault of my own - and when I tried to discuss this with management, I received no reply; certainly not something I expected from a four-star hotel.

title: Second time at Smyth Tribeca
text: This was my 2nd stay at Smyth Tribeca and will not be my last. Love the location of the hotel. Appreciate the calm, quieter neighborhood after a long day of sight seeing.. The property is sophisticated and elevated. The staff are highly professional and extremely helpful.  Edgar was available to assist us throughout our entire stay.  He checked in with us regularly and made our visit memorable. I look forward to coming back next year. Thank you Smyth Tribeca and the entire team on the property.

title: Simply perfect!
text:
Perfect location, just in front of metro station in Tribeca. Really nice interiors and the room with king size bed was incredibly big and perfectly clean. The staff is super kind and nice.
We had also a nice dinner in the tavern.
And the price is just perfect!
Definately we will come back here and I will suggest it to all of my friends.

title: Le parfait hotel pour visiter South Manhattan
text: Un hôtel parfait pour visiter le sud de Manhattan. Les chambres sont grandes (37 m2 pour la notre) ce qui est parfait pour une famille de 4. La réception est accueillante et serviable. La bartender fait des cocktails originaux dans un cadre chaleureux et design. Mention spéciale au doorman Mario, que nous n'avons pas pu remercier au départ mais qui nous a donné des adresses excellentes, de l'eau quand nous arrivions epuisés et un grand sourire... Thanks Mario!!

title: Great staff, convenient location
text: This is the first time I have stayed in Tribeca and it was perfectly located near the subway and within walkable distance to excellent restaurants and the lovely Battery Park. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms are not 100% sound proof, so there was a bit of hallway and ambulance noise - normal in NYC - and the mattresses are not the best I have ever had at a hotel, which kept me from giving a 5 star review, but other than that this was a great stay, and I would absolutely stay again.

title: Confused!!
text:
So I love this place.  Rooms are always great. Location is spot in for my office and cost is comparable.  

I have never not been happy until this evening when the nice refurbished bar closed about 2 hours earlier than normal and no one could explain why. 

As a patron I wanted to sit with friends but the hotel were not interested in listening.

Unfortunately tonight will be my last night in this hotel and myself and my team who use the Smyth regularly will be moving our business elsewhere.

Unfortunate and unnecessary situation’

title: Amazing Stay!!
text:
The staff were incredibly detailed, friendly, and knowledgeable during my stay. I was visiting for a special birthday celebration and staff left no details behind in making my stay special. In particular, Diana’s hospitality made our visit go from good to perfect! She provided us a beautiful room,  gave wonderful concierge recommendations, and made my celebration fail to go unnoticed. I was very impressed with Dale from the beginning in how quickly he responded to my emails and then further impressed when I arrived to my room with a beautiful card and amenity. 

Even my brunch on Sunday at Smyth Tavern was a great sendoff from the weekend. The staff greeted my party with a smile as soon as we entered the restaurant and that remained the same during our entire lunch. I will definitely be back to visit!

title: Una estancia espectacular,  ¡y en parte gracias a Xavier!
text:
He viajado con mi familia y nos hemos hospedado en Smyth Tribeca. 
Toda la estancia ha sido muy buena y Xavier nos ha ayudado mucho durante ella, siempre dispuesto a ayudarnos con cualquier duda o cualquier cosa que necesitáramos durante nuestra estancia.

El hotel está muy buen ubicado. Justo con una parada de metro en la puerta y con otras cercanas. Las habitaciones están fenomenal. 

También tienen un restaurante y bar de copas para tomar algo.

title: couldn't be better
text: simply fabulous!! Great service, comfortable rooms, amazing location. Stayed for 11 nights. Booked two rooms, both impeccably furnished. what a great way to explore downtown New York. Metro a two minute walk for midtown and uptown forays.

title: Wonderfully personalized and seamless experience!
text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Smyth for a friend's 30th birthday. Start to finish, the staff went above and beyond to make the experience memorable. Diana and Dale's attention to detail with decor, cake, champagne, snacks was unlike any hotel stay I have had. It was honestly refreshing, surprising and so appreciated to not have to worry about these details. Nick, Xavier and Mario in the front office were quick and accommodating. You can really feel how their guest experience is at the epicenter of the culture. The room was also comfortable, with great products and amenities. Thank you thank you thank you to the amazing staff at the Smyth, will be back soon!

title: Perfect Stay
text: My husband and I went to the city for a birthday weekend and it couldn’t have gone any better. The hotel texted us before we arrived asking if we needed helping getting in and when we told them it was for my birthday, they upgraded me and got us free drinks when we arrived. Nick was excellent and told us where to go and where to eat and even got my birthday flowers while we were out for dinner (because my husband forgot). I really loved the bathroom products and will be getting them for myself. We will definitely be back

title: Hidden Gem
text:
WOW!!This hotel is a hidden gem in NYC. 
The staff, service and room were top notch.  Super surprised  we were welcomed with popsicles at the time of arrival which was refreshing in this weather.  Will be back

title: Great Location, Great Rooms, Great Staff
text: This is the 2nd time we stayed here. We love the location in Tribeca. Away from the crowds but within walking distance to great restaurants and the subway. The staff are all great and very helpful. The rooms are a very good size  and very comfortable.Will be back next month.

title: Easy and wonderful
text: Very comfortable and staff is amazing.  Everyone was friendly and smiley and helpful.  Everyone welcomed us and the popsicles on Wednesday were delicious and refreshing.  The room was made daily and clean.

title: Great stay
text: Smyth Tribeca was home for a week and everything was excellent. Very clean and spacious rooms and great unintrusive service. Fitness centre was good and advice on transport options from the concierge was also helpful.

title: Great stay, reasonable price, convenient area
text: The Smyth is located in a very convenient place in tribeca.  It sits above the 123 Express stop subway which easily ties Manhattan together. If you need to get on the ACE express stop that's just right down the street.  And the 456 Express stop isn't much further either.  You can get anywhere in Manhattan in short order.  I woke up early every morning and took a walk down Greenwich to Canal St and back and it was wonderful.

title: Nice staff!
text: The staff was super, super friendly and helpful. This was definitely what stood out as special with our stay. Xavier was over-the-top personable yet professional with us. We wanted to take him home with us. Thank you, Smyth! You have a great employee there!!

title: Fun Family Girls Trip
text: Lovely hotel in a great area. Staff was amazing and very welcoming. The hotel was very clean and in great condition. The extra space in the Junior Suite was a luxury and we enjoyed the newly renovated guest room. I will definitely stay again on future trips.

title: Great experience
text: We’ve reserved two rooms and both of them were clean and almost new furniture. Huge TV and huge bed (king size). Services were week done during our stay. Besides of the hotel there is a metro station (Line 1) and it was very easy to know every place at Manhattan. Tribeca has a lot of restaurants and a various of them near this hotel, including a French bakery. I recommend this location.

title: Great location
text: Very good acommodation in NYC, the location is perfect (right next to the subway) so it is easy to travel anywhere. Rooms are nice and clean. The only thing we missed in the room were tea and coffee amenities but overall would recommend this hotel.

title: Great place for a family stay.
text:
The room was super comfy and the service was great! The staff is perfect. Xavier was super nice since we arrived! The location can’t get any better - the train station is right outside, there are so many restaurants, drug stores and more on the same street. The tavern also has DELICIOUS food. 
Would definitely recommend.

title: Loved the Smyth Tribeca!
text: This hotel was fabulous!  The room was spacious and well appointed, with good linens and products.  The location was great.  But best of all the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. I highly recommend the Smyth Tribeca!

title: Dale and bar staff were awesome!!
text: My friends and I had a great time at the Smyth. Dale was very welcoming and helpful from the moment we arrived. He provided top notch service! The bar had a great atmosphere and the drinks and food were amazing. Will be going back soon!

title: Great hotel!!
text: I totally recomend this hotel. I Went with my wife for a business trip of a week in June.  Nice and spacious room, great zone in downtown manhattan and specially excellent attention from the front desk team.

title: Great food, Welcoming and Warm Staff
text: I have been visiting the Smyth since it reopened for meals and drinks.  The food is amazing and Xavier has been the warmest and most welcoming person who always greets my family with the happiest welcome.   The hotel is a great addition to the neighborhood and I’d recommend a visit if you are in TriBeCa.

title: Good NY experience with excellent location
text:
ROOMS: spacious and bright. Big bathroom with a shower. Every room is equipped with working table, safe, fridge. Very good city views and are guaranteed :)
LOCATION: excellent location next to Subway entrance. 7min walking to One World Trade Center.
FOOD: there are many places for breakfast, lunch and dinner. You can also order in-room breakfast from the hotel’s restaurant.
FACILITIES: fast Wi-Fi, gym 24h, welcoming pop corn :)
STAFF: polite and smiley

title: Thank you Xavier and Courtney
text: As a local who frequents the lounge and restaurant, Xavier the doorman is a standout. He is friendly, engaging, helpful and professional - not only a huge plus for the hotel but for the neighborhood as well. And big shout out to Courtney as well - super welcoming, bright and professional. She makes the lounge that much more inviting.

title: Clean and Friendly!
text: Very clean rooms with a luxurious feel and excellent service! Mario at front desk was especially hospitable and friendly from day 1 :) Will definitely be coming back for our next visit to new york city!

title: Large and quiet rooms, excellent staff
text: The Smyth is a very nice boutique hotel in the Heart of Tribeca close to great restaurants, waterfront parks and piers,  and the World Trade Center. The rooms are quite large by NYC standards, and it was relatively quiet at night. Every single staff member was pleasant and helpful, particularly Xavier who was the first to greet me and the last to wish me well upon my departure. His smile, helpfulness and courtesy are top notch. The restaurant is beautiful and open all day long, and the cocktail bar for evening drinks was perfect. My only complaints about the Smyth are that there are not enough electrical outlets in the room (none on either side of the bed!), and the hot water was sporadic, which was a bit inconvenient for quick showering. But I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again. We had a wonderful weekend!

title: Xavier’s Customer Service 5 star*****
text:
Our thanks for a great stay. Thank you for your hospitality & kindness!
We always have a wonderful stay at The Smyth but part of the reason why we continually come back to stay there is the friendly staff, in particular Xavier. Thank you for always going above and beyond and for your professionalism. We appreciate your services and attention to detail. Xavier rocks!

title: Shout out to Xavier!!!
text: We come to The Smyth at least once a month and the o overall experience is consistently to the point. Front desk staff are always pleasant and they are there to assist us with anything we need. Although, the key of customer service is to anticipate customer’s needs and Xavier has made our experiences phenomenal. Xavier always goes above and beyond and he’s the most pleasant person there. He’s always willing to help and truly this put us at ease. Shout out to Xavier, his services, professionalism and manner. Thank you!

title: Well located in Tribeca
text:
Way better value than uptown and we are walking distance to soho, china town, little Italy, best boutique shopping area. Steps to subway to bring you uptown to theatre district and central park- museums. 
The room was very spacious with large bathroom and srep in shower. 
Double black out blinds and traffic noise buffer. Ask for room 4th floor or higher.

title: Genial
text:
Muy buena ubicación en pleno corazón de Tribeca.
A pocos minutos del World Trade Center.
Parada de metro en la puerta, restaurantes y cafeterías cercanas. 
Todo limpio y servicio amable.
Restaurante con comida rica con precios un poco elevados.
Hay parking cercano.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Excellent experience from beginning to end. We were fortunate to have a room ready upon our arrival and were greeted by a friendly staff. The rooms were well kept and cleaned daily. The furniture and fixtures were very nice and the beds were quite comfortable. Although we did not partake, the mini bar was well stocked with drinks and a few snack options. There is a subway entrance right by the hotel entrance making traveling a breeze. The hotel is situated in a nice area and is right around the corner from a CVS in case you forgot anything while packing.

title: Wished I’d had more time
text: My daughter and I traveled to NYC for a couple of days for visiting family close by. The staff went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of before, during and after our stay. Unfortunately, we didn’t spend a ton of time at the actual hotel. The room was spacious and beautiful and the location was perfect. I would definitely stay there again and again.

title: Fabulous
text: This is a wonderful, well-located hotel.  The facilities are well-maintained   The 1,2,3 subway is out the front door, A,C,E one block away, 4,5,6, R, W 2ish blocks away.  There are lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance.  Tribeca is a great neighborhood.  The room was large, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom amenities upscale

title: comfort in tribeca
text: The Smyth is comfortable on all fronts. The subway for up-town is on the corner, but who needs up-town when all the fun of Tribecca and nearby Chinatown are within walking distance. The rooms are more than adequate, everything works nice and smoothly

title: Great stay at Smyth Tribeca
text: The staff were wonderful, attentive but not overwhelming, and we were greeted warmly, with a smile every time we went past the desk. The  room was clean and surprisingly large by NYC standards. Beds were comfortable. The food from the restaurant was better than the usual restaurant food.

title: A Gem in the heart of Tribeca
text:
My adult daughter and I shared the very generous sized room having two very comfortable QS beds. a well positioned bathroom and plenty of storage for our week long stay. 
Everything was of top quality including the hairdryer and generous toiletries.
Staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Absolutely 5 Star service!
text: The employees at Smyth Tribeca  are exemplary!  The customer service is of the finest I have seen. I travel over 150  days per year around the world and this team is quite impressive: Abdul, Edgar, Frances Madeline at the desk, Kouame at the bar/restaurant and Karen in housekeeping all are trained, pleasant, positive and genuinely seem to want to make you happy.  Hard to find such layers of hospitality all the way through the teams. Great job Smyth. I will return. Again and again.  The rooms are spacious, great linens and the restaurant serves delicious food.  The location is perfect- I usually stay uptown when in NY and I just loved this location. Walk to anywhere, lots of food, museum and shopping choices all within a small radius.  Bravi!!!

title: I was not given the room that was advertised on booking.com. The
text: The room I was given was not the one advertised on booking.com. Even worse, I was offered upgrades before my arrival but nothing was available when I did try. It’s disappointing to spend that kind of money and not get what you pay for

title: Good Choice!
text: In its price bracket, a good, solid, upscale hotel downtown, convenient to Tribeca, the financial district, Soho, Chinatown and the Lower East Side. Sounds were muted and not at all bothersome, and the bath/shower room is great. Clean, secure, and kind and helpful staff.

title: Will come back to Smyth again!
text: Everyone from the front desk to the doorman Xavier were warm, friendly and informative. The lounge, restaurant and room was perfectly suited for both business and please with my spouse. I will definitely return!

title: My Go-To Hotel In NYC
text: I’ve stayed here a few times and I always enjoy the experience. The staff is very attentive and typically welcomes me back, from the doorman to the front desk person. Rooms are modern and clean and the new bar is great for a cocktail. Looking forward to returning again.

title: A boutique hotel in a convenient and quiet location of the financial district.
text: The hotel is located right next to a subway station. The surrounding neighborhood is pleasant with restaurants, coffee shops and supermarkets within walking distance.  One can also easily walk to the WTC, City Hall, Brooklyn bridge, etc.  The room itself is spacious with ample natural lighting.  It is a little dated with worn carpet in places.  Also the room lacks certain amenities such as coffee maker or kettles.  The staff is courteous but not overly warm.  Overall the hotel is a decent place to stay if one wants convenience and quietness.

title: Good hotel, super nice staff!
text:
Nice rooms, modern, quite small like in every hotel in NYC. 

Extremely friendly staff, super helpful, the guys at the door are hilarious! That‘s the reason I would come again. Location great, next to metro, convenient, you are in midtown in 15-20 min, with express train, easy.

I did not like the breakfast, not so tasty and quite expensive. No worries: there is a nice coffee shop 10 meters away, go there!

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Heart of Tribeca
text: Everyone in hotel from Xavier at the door to Lisa on housekeeping to everyone at the front desk were so nice and accommodating. Room was very nice and comfortable and great location. Stairs to Subway stop is outside door…great restaurants within walking f distance and a very nice lounge.

title: Very comfortable place to stay
text:
I have stayed here more than once. It is in a great location, rooms are modern and spotlessly clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. I’d defo stay here again next time I am in town. Dinner is amazing just great food.

Bar and restaurant closes at 10. There is zero flexibility. A whole bar full of people are asked to pay up and drink up. The staff report the owners are inflexible.

There is an amazing lounge with an open fire that is just perfect but often the bar is not manned and one one of my stays it was closed for a function. 

Also breakfast is a bit blah and not cheap. 

Small complaints but a couple of tuning points that with a few more staff and a little more flexibility could make this the best place in town.

title: Do not stay here if you want to sleep!
text: The location is great and the room is fine but there was so much noise from the bus stop and so many horns honking outside my window because of the traffic that is was Impossible to sleep! Usually hotels in NYC have double pane windows but not this one. Do not stay here if you want to sleep!!!

title: Chic choice with 5-star service
text:
Smyth Tribeca is perfectly located for accessing great restaurants in the region, but also handy to the financial district.
I've stayed at many hotels in the vicinity and the Smyth is a standout, especially in its price range.
The service is superb - friendly, efficient and genuine.
The rooms are fairly plain in style, but very well appointed, especially for business travellers. With a quality iron and iron board, in-room safe, umbrella, hair-dryer. Only minor improvement would be a powerpoint closer to the bed.

My room had a lovely balcony with great city views. Unfortunately, it was pouring with rain so I didn't have a chance to use it.

I visited the fitness center early one morning, and had it to myself. It has a really good range of weights and fitness equipment and was very clean.

Overall a great choice if you are planning to stay in Tribeca

title: A wonderful hotel with fantastic staff
text: We felt like The Smyth was our home away from home! Attentive, friendly, professional service at front deck (and from Mario) coupled with modern, large (for NYC standards), well-appointed rooms with very comfy beds. Checked out the lounge after dinner and was greeted so pleasantly by all that were working there. Love the location too, plus the convenience of the 1-2-3 right outside the door to get to business appointments very quickly. We will be back SOON!

title: An exceptional stay in lower Manhattan
text: I'm a big fan of this property and will always stay here when I am in the city. The staff is warm, genuine and attentive. The rooms are modern, clean and very well appointed. The location is also quite exceptional, right between the growing, burgeoning financial district and the trendy Tribeca.

title: A Great Find at Last
text:
This hotel was just right. The staff is welcoming, the room clean an stylish, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine. Although it sits right on the subway at a busy intersection, it was perfectly quiet. 

It’s location makes it a great jumping off point for both Tribeca and the rest of lower Manhattan and for uptown and Brooklyn. 

We recently moved out of the city but return often. We have tried several Airbnbs and hotels. This is the first place that we felt like grownups. There was no compromise in comfort or location, and the price was reasonable.

title: Excellent!!
text:
I had a great experience staying at this hotel.  Rooms were quiet, very nice and clean. All the staff were amazing. 
I was not impressed with food at the restaurant, But other than that overall experience was really good and i'll be definitely staying here again.

title: A great hotel, a great location
text: We stayed at the Smyth Tribeca for my daughter's wedding weekend; many of our extended gamily stayed here as well. Everything and everyone was great (they even helped jump a car for a friend who came for brunch on Sunday).

title: Wonderful  for family getaway/business trip
text: Truly an amazing stay at Smyth, location is perfect for getting around the city. Close enough to everything and a great restaurant attached, Smyth Tavern. My family enjoyed their time here with thanks to all the staff and especially Delila. We look forward to coming back soon!

title: Best downtown hotel
text: Stayed for almost a week while having meetings at the WTC. The rooms looked new and were much larger than most NYC hotels I normally stay in. The location was key, because I could walk to work or take one stop on the Subway which was directly outside the hotel. Nick and Mackenzie at the front desk were great. I come to NYC for work a few times a year and look forward to coming back.

title: Fun Hotel in Tribeca
text: This is a really fun, sophisticated hotel - the suites are gorgeous, with balconies, would really recommend. Great for entertaining and stays - enough room to have guests for cocktails, then very comfortable separate bedroom, 1 1/2 baths. Perfect home away from home!

title: Secret Gem
text: What an amazing experience staying at Smyth! The hotel has a great vibe and feels like an undiscovered gem. The service from the desk to the cleaning crew was always accommodating and professional. Room was super clean and larger than most hotels I’ve been to. Will definitely be back but hoping the secret doesn’t get out!

title: New Favorite Place
text:
We visit NYC a couple of times a year.  This has by far been my favorite place to stay!
Bart greeted us with a warm welcome.  He answered all of our questions  with patience and enthusiasm.  
Abdul, was the kind gentleman who helped us with directions and recommendations.

title: Would definitely recommend!
text: Our stay at the Smyth was a wonderful experience. The location is great, with lots of good restaurants nearby and close to shopping streets without it feeling too crowded. The staff at They Smyth are so amazing, especially Mario who always greeted us with a genuine smile and good energy! Would definitely recommend.

title: Muy agradable
text:
Pasamos una semana haciendo turismo intensivo en Manhattan.
La ubicación es perfecta y está muy accesible y "a mano" de todo.
Dando un paseíto se llega al World Trade Center (merece la pena verlo de noche también).
La habitación era muy confortable. La cama era enorme y estaba siempre muy bien hecha y suave.
Todo muy limpio y cómodo.
El hotel y las habitaciones tenían muy buen olor. No suelo comentar eso pero es una de las cosas que me viene rápido a la memoria al pensar en este viaje.
El personal era muy amable. 
Recomendable, sin duda.

title: Great staff, beautiful hotel
text: I had great time staying here this weekend with friends. The room was very clean and employees were very kind and helpful. We stayed in the suite room and it was so spacious with a beautiful interior. We will definitely be coming back to the Smyth the next time we are in NYC!

title: Not the greatest
text: They gave up my suite that i reserved. Gave me one that was dirty saying it was an upgrade. They stated all their suites had a soaking tub and that was a whole damn lie. The carpet was stained, the couch had crumbs. The bathroom had these weird stains in the shower. They provided robes but they didn’t seem clean. The staff at the front was nice but i just feel like i didn’t get my money worth for the stay

title: Excellent TriBeCa hotel
text: My husband and I stayed here for a night and were impressed with the overall experience. I particularly liked the text messages received periodically from the front desk inquiring as to our needs and satisfaction. I requested a pair of slippers which were left in our room in our absence. As iprefer members, we were upgraded to a deluxe king room upon requesting same. The room was a good size, bed & pillows comfortable with a spacious, clean, marble bathroom. Our only complaint was the a/c did bring the room temp below 73 and the fan was noisy.

title: Stellar stay!
text:
Whether you’re doing a staycation or visiting NYC, you can never go wrong here. Incredible spot. Dope vibe. If you meet Mark the GM you’re set for an incredible experience. 

Great rooms and optimal experience.

title: Amazing service
text: I absolutely love this hotel. The location, service and the rooms. I have been coming here for years and the doorman, Mario is honestly the reason I come back everytime. He is so helpful with my bags, the service, helping me with cabs, my bags and even brought me tea when I was sick. I have never had that service at other hotels. He is absolutely incredible. Abdul at the front desk is amazing too. What a kind and friendly man.

title: A Day at Smyth Tribeca
text: Very nice stay. Even though we arrived early, the room was ready for us. The desk staff was very pleasant and accommodating. With a king=size bed, we had plenty of room. Everything was clean and neat, and the showers worked fine. Only possible issue was the absence of a directory of hotel services, but it's possible we just didn't find it.

title: Mario #1 Concierge
text: Always love staying at this hotel!! The staff are great and Mario, in Concierge, is the best! He always welcomes you with a big smile, provides great suggestions for restaurants  and entertainment and goes out of his way to make sure your stay in NYC is pleasant and comfortable! He truly treats you like family!

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: The entire staff is wonderful and extremely accommodating! I’ve stayed at this hotel for over two weeks and it’s a hidden gem. I plan to stay here many more times during my business trips. Delilah in particular is amazing!

title: Mario is a great asset to the Smyth Tribeca !!
text: The hotel staff was very friendly and courteous and a huge shout out to Mario  who was my front door greeter,bell hop and concierge he made my first business trip to NYC a memorable one . Leaving  and coming back at end of day to see his face and hear his laugh and see his smile made it all the better at the end of my long day of meetings . He was very helpful with directions and restaurants that I would enjoy as a solo diner.

title: We loved the Smyth Hotel!!!
text: The Smyth was fantastic!! Truly a home away from home. We loved the boutique feel in the lobby, the friendly staff and easy valet service. Having just come  for a night  we felt all the comforts of home. The room is well thought out, simple yet elegant furnishings.  The kitchen was ideal - just enough and complete with a Nespresso maker that was perfect for a late afternoon cup of coffee on this freezing weekend. It felt open and airy, while cozy and easy living. The bedroom was very gracious with lots of storage and the bathroom perfect - equipped with a vanity, 2 sinks and an enormous shower. Truly the lap of luxury! Additionally we loved the bar downstairs! It was a perfect (pre and post!) dinner spot. Lots of couches, a fire place and a lovely extensive bar. Thank you to the Smyth and all the wonderful people who work there. We will definitely be coming back!!!

title: Our stay at the Smyth
text: Very cool and right where you want to be.  The tavern off the lobby has great snacks and wine list.  Cocktails are tasty as well.  We were greeted at check in by Dalila and she was very nice and a pro, answered a couple questions for us and each day we saw her she was friendly and helpful. The staff overall was great and friendly. we will be back

title: Great overall experience
text: Very happy with my stay! Friendly staff. No complaints. Great location. Love the room & the shower area. Highly recommend this hotel. They do put a hold on your card which was additional $150/night but they reversed it a day or two after checkout so make sure your card has enough credit limit to incur those pending charges.

title: Five stars
text:
Fantastic and friendly staff that was very professional, proactive and just on top of everything. 
The Smyth is in great location with a lot of food/drink options in the are. The room was modern, clean and very large for New York City. 
I will definitely be back!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: The Smyth is our go to hotel whenever visiting NYC. Friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms, great location with a restaurant and bar on site. Highly recommend this hotel! Thank you for always making our stay a great experience!

title: Don’t Get The Junior Suite!
text:
I didn’t plan on writing a review and this is my first review online. I normally just send the staff a review so they can make adjustments for the next customers. However, when I checked on this morning the gentlemen at the front counter was so nonchalant about my experience and couldn’t have cared less. The following was my feedback to them when I received an automated message about my stay: 

Hi thank you for checking in. Quite honestly other than the friendliness of the gentlemen who brought us to our room and some of the front desk staff, this has been a disappointment. I would rate our experience a 2/5. 

Here is why we have had a poor experience:

1. The couch bed mattress should be thrown away. The hard wire springs are so prominent it visibly protrudes from the mattress and if you simply place your hand on top of it, you can feel it. No one should pay to sleep on it.

2. I called the front desk last night to tell them about the mattress and asked that someone bring up more comforters so I could create a makeshift mattress so that I would not be in pain in the morning. The housekeeper brought me fleece blankets.

3. I called the front desk again and told them I wasn't cold but needed a thicker comforter because the mattress was bad. The same man brought me a bunch of sheets, a thin comforter and then told me he was on his way home when I called.

4. No one apologized for the condition of the bed or offered to change our room. 

5. Today we put a "quiet please" sign on our door because we did not want service since we are here for such a short stay. We just walked back into the room to find that it happened anyway and my mother was very upset that someone touched her personal items.

6. Though we got housekeeping we did not want, the hand soap in the restroom is empty. 

7. The place was only prepared for 2 people and not three. There are only two glasses, two robes and the couch bed was made after we arrived and it looked like someone threw the blankets on it with two different sized pillows 

This is way too expensive of a hotel for any of the above to happen. I wanted to pay for a higher quality hotel so that we could get a higher quality experience. Instead I've slept  poorly, and I am frustrated and tired. 

I book this trip as a Christmas present for my mother and needless to say it has been a major let down

title: Great Tribeca Hotel
text:
We've stayed twice at The Smyth early this spring.  Location is perfect for Tribeca, right on the cusp of great train hubs and close to amenities.  Incredible service.  One minor complaint is a few detail flaws:  the absence of hand held showers and lack of lighting and mirrors in the rooms which do not make it "female friendly".
This is now our "go to" when visiting New York City.

title: Great location, great service!
text: Overall was a great experience--loved the location in the heart of Tribeca, with all subway trains right outside. The hotel desk staff was great and upgraded our room within a day or two of arrival. I had called to verify our reservation and they offered an upgrade (at no upcharge) be sure to join the I Prefer Hotel Rewards. The mini-bar is a nice treat, but be sure to scan the barcode for pricing. The beds are platform, so they are fairly low and the mattress (although we slept okay) could have been much better. The housekeeping staff did an impeccable job, with a huge attention to detail. Looking forward to returning!

title: Great boutique hotel in a fantastic lower Manhattan location
text: As a returning customer post-pandemic and change of former AKA owner, delighted to have stayed at this well-located boutique hotel. Staff were extremely friendly, courteous and attentive; room was simple but spotless. Location is fabulous for lower Manhattan near WTC, on the 1-2-3 or A-C-E subways. Will be returning for sure.

title: Great Hotel!
text:
Went to this hotel and it was absolutely fantastic. Rooms are modern and clean. The General Manager, believe his name was Mack, helped me deal with a minor issue and was beyond helpful. 

Smyth Tavern was pricey, but food was great. Food, Service and Atmosphere were great but did not get to try the burger (saw pictures on Instagram afterwards). Would like to go back for lunch and see if the experience is the same!

title: Terrible restaurant on site and hotel staff sub par
text:
Came to town for a business trip with one day to myself in the city. The customer service is sub-par and the restaurant is disgusting. The filet had too much sauce, if you have to put that much seasoning on a steak, you need to get a different provider and then learn to cook. The eggs Benedict, too spicy and too seasoned. The wait staff was not attentive compared to other restaurants. I did eat at the Locanda  verde and it was delicious and the waitress was Amazing! The Smyth Tavern and hotel should take note.   Nobody asked what I thought about the food and there wasn’t any offer to comp anything when I didn’t eat what I ordered. 

Do not stay here if you wish to be able to have a decent restaurant on site.

title: Sköna sängar men noll lyx
text: För det priset hade jag förväntat mig mer. Heltäckningsmattan var smutsig och rummet hade ingen utsikt. Badrummet var fräscht och sängen var skön. Servicen var bra förutom att de ordnade en taxi till mig som tog dubbelt betalt än en vanlig gul taxi. Får skylla mig själv att jag inte frågade om priset och förlitade mig på att hotellet sade att de kände till dem väl. Läget är toppen, precis vid tunnelbanan.

title: Amazing Parking Experience
text: Xavier was beyond helpful. He greeted us in line while we were waiting to check in. We inquired about the valet and he offered to help us right then taking our car. We explained that the car was needed early the next day. He confirmed that would be no problem as he would also be here early the next day. Then he came back and offered to park the car on the street right out front. He said given that it was a Sunday it was no problem. He offered to watch the car. This saved us the valet fee. This was beyond kind and completely above what he needed to do for us. Service like this needs go noticed.

title: Amazing hotel with stunning views!
text: Stayed in the Tribeca Suite for my wedding and had my bridesmaids/family get ready there and then stayed with my husband an extra night. AMAZING experience. Very attentive staff who were such a pleasure to talk to and they even gave us champagne and chocolates! Xavier helped us pack and load stuff in our car multiple times and always had a smile on his face. We live in Manhattan but still discuss staying there again as a “getaway” because of what a great experience we had! The Tribeca suite is STUNNING with amazing views

title: Great hotel and service - Go see Markenlie!
text: I booked travel for a business trip and the hotel was wonderful and the customer service was amazing, all thanks to Markenlie! She was so helpful and always assisted and made the stay as lovely as possible. She always answered calls and emails and was always upbeat and polite. Hotel room was spacious and clean and located in a great area. The people at the hotel make the experience that much more amazing and Markenlie was a huge factor in that :)

title: stellar service
text: Mario at Concierge was friendly and professional. He assisted us immediately when we had questions and took care of any concerns. Impeccably dressed and offered great advice about the neighborhood. As beautiful of a hotel as it is I felt extremely welcomed and special. Thank you Smyth Hotel!

title: Amazing hospitality!
text: The Smyth Tribeca is a true Gem of a hotel! They got everything right- from the amazing service, pleasant staff, great food, modern clean cozy room, and did I mention their top notch concierge Mario- his service was amazing!

title: Amazing staff!
text: Our company hosted an event at The Smyth Tribeca and the staff were incredible to work with and always made sure we had everything we needed. We will definitely be looking to the Smyth for our next event!

title: Great stay!
text: Was in NYC for a few days and I wish I could’ve stayed longer! The hotel is comfortable, stunning and clean. The star of my visit was Xavier, such a warm welcome and made me feel right at home. Went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. Even recommended some places to eat and visit. A++  For service and hospitality. Thanks Xavier!

title: Great stay!!! The manager is incredible!!!
text: Stayed here for a weekend with friends and had the best stay. The manager and staff are so kind and make the hotel feel like home. They took great care of us and even walked us around the corner at 2 am to get us to a pizza shop to solve some late night hunger.

title: Great location, loved this hotel.
text: We cannot express enough how much we loved this hotel. The room was huge for a NYC hotel. The bed was beyond comfortable. The shower pressure was probably the best I have ever experienced in NYC. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We will make this our top pick to stay for our next visit.

title: Excellent Accommodations in TRIBECA
text: Really enjoyed my stay at the Smyth Tribeca.   The room was very attractive, coordinated in a sleek design, using shades of gray.  The bathroom was first rate with quality shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and soap.   All linens were top-end.   After a long trip, I was greeted with courtesy by the front desk staff.   Special kudos to Mr. Nick D’Andrea, Director of Operations, who ably assisted me during my booking.

title: Absolutely loved it!! Our new favorite hotel in NY!
text: We stayed at Smyth a few weeks ago after falling in the love with the Tribeca views that we saw online that the corner suites had. We wanted to try a new area that we had never stayed at before, as we are from Florida and have traveled to New York a few times and every time stay somewhere new. From the time we arrived to the moment we left, everything and everyone at the hotel were amazing! The service from all of the hotel staff is what really impressed us the most. We did have a minor issue with the mini bar which was immediately addressed and that really set the tone for the rest of our stay. The check in was super easy. We had a box that was delivered to the hotel prior to our arrival that was waiting for us in our room which was so nice. The front desk staff were always super helpful and friendly and Xavier was awesome! We saw him what seemed like every time we were in and out at all hours of the day and night and even asked him if he ever sleeps lol. He was super helpful and very friendly! We just wanted to say thank you so much for a great stay and we will definitely be back!

title: Spacious clean rooms good service
