text: Thank you Smyth TriBeCa - good hotel in great location in New York.  Clean spacious room for New York - but ask for rooms roadside or high floor for better view. Thx to Marid for help with bags etc & to lovely reception lady on our check in & manager on duty. Worth a visit.

title: Excellent
text:
Exceeded all expectations.
Room was great - it was clean, comfortable and was filled with all the necessities, food was 5 star quality - could honestly eat there all day and not get tired of it and the customer service was even better - they truly care about the experience of your stay! I will definitely book here again in the future.

title: Great stay!
text: Not our 1st trip to NY, but it was our 1st visit to Smyth Hotel and it didn’t disappoint. The rooms were spacious and clean. We directly across from the elevators but weren’t disturbed by them at all. Asking for a late check out and for luggage storage was an easy request… no hassle given. We arrived late on our 1st night so we decided to make things easy and ate at the hotel restaurant .  It was so good that we had breakfast there twice and another dinner. Many thanks to Mario who is genuinely hospitable. An overall great stay!

title: Excellent stay, better service.
text: Smyth is a beautiful hotel with clean rooms, nice views, a great restaurant, and incredible staff! Very accommodating and warm. Modern and nicely appointed the room had some great highlights, including the bathroom. We had a few special requests and the staff went above and beyond! Mario was especially helpful and made our stay a 5 star stay. He always made sure we had everything we needed and was incredibly attentive. Anna, our server, was delightful. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and wine list and made an excellent recommendation! We will definitely be back! P.S. eating at the Smyth Tavern is a must!

title: Great hotel, great service
text: We had a great experience at this hotel. They accommodated our needs for our 2 young kids including having the crib all set up for us when we arrived. Xavier the doorman was super helpful and friendly!

title: Compassionate service and chic nyc design
text: This is a gorgeous hotel very New York loft style. We have a gorgeous terrace overlooking the Jenga building and the Empire State building. We had a glitch with our parking situation but Xavier  I The morning Bellman,walked all the way to the car parking service and drove the vehicle back for us so that we would not be late for dropping off our daughter to school. Exceptional service and compassion.

title: Mr
text: Host is friendly , very helpful, polite. Excellent location. Would recommend for business or pleasure. We stay there for 5 nights and have a good time there. Restaurants, bar, coffe shops are plenty around there. Altough the area at night is not perfectly safe but lot of people strolling around so still enjoyable

title: Thank you!
text: Thank you for making my birthday celebration so special! Special thank you to Xavier for greeting us coming and going and helping us with bags and water, directions, weather and being his friendly self! He was always there to help and will miss his cheerful “good morning” and “welcome back”. What a great representative of your hotel. Other than bill payment/charge snafu at the front desk, we enjoyed our stay! Thank you for the special room gifts too!

title: Luxe in the City
text: Felt like Carrie Bradshaw from Sex in the City while staying at the Smyth! Was so close to the West Village and all of the amazing restaurants and bars the neighborhood has to offer. The room was a generous size and its modern and sleek finishes makes it feel like it's right out of a Arch Digest. You are only a few blocks away from the river which was so picturesque to walk along around sunset. I was in town for business, but stayed the weekend to enjoy NYC and play tourist and was able to walk to tons of museums, shops, restaurants, and bars. The only thing I will comment on is the two eggs any style I ordered for breakfast that was upwards of $15.. would rather not eat and get two beers for that price at happy hour.  All in all, can't wait to return, thanks Smyth for a wonderful stay!

title: Birthday trip
text: Everything about this hotel was simply amazing The staff made sure my stay And birthday went  great Mario was a living angel …. The whole staff was beyond  hospitable I will definitely be back …. Thank you all

title: Ms
text: Great location and beautiful modern hotel. Staff was exceptional. Xavier was a godsend. We had young kids and he was so helpful. A very nice bar and restaurant downstairs. We loved it very much! Thank you!

title: Mr.
text: We had a great visit! I appreciated the staff and especially Xavier, who always gave us on point information and greeted us with a smile and warm attitude.   Looking forward to more time at the smyth and smyth tavern.

title: Awesome staff
text: My first time staying at this hotel and I was very pleased. Great location, great rooms, and the staff was amazing. Thank you so much Mario for taking the time out to talk to my daughter and wish her the best of luck in school. I’m sure your niece will have an amazing school experience as well, and thank you Xavier for your wonderful hospitality.

title: Excelente custo x benefício
text:
Os aptos grandes, acima da média para NY. Localização excelente com várias opções de metrô. Profissionalismo e cordialidade dos funcionários  acima da média!! Xavier, Dalila, Bo e todos do front desk! Lisa fez uma limpeza primorosa no apto todos os dias! E ainda nos agraciaram com check in early e
uma garrafa de espumante em comemoração de nossas bodas!!

title: Great First Stay
text: First time staying at this hotel. Very pleased with the service and the accommodations. Room service was really great. also in good walking distance to tourist attractions.  And we really appreciate the service that Xavier provided us.  Will definitely be back again!

title: Fabulous Find!
text:
I booked on line based on the positive reviews and this place did not disappoint . I’m face, exceeded my expectations! 
From the friendly staff throughout the hotel, to the decor and service, all top notch!

title: Recommend
text: I highly recommend this hotel. From the moment I arrived every one was extremely Pleasant and welcoming! Xavier the concierge was amazing, thank for the great recommendations!  Prefect hotel if you want to explore around the city!

title: Hotel with Class and Hospitality
text: Words cannot express how wonderful this hotel is in NYC.Mario, the concierge, was truly concerned about the well-being of his guests&made sure that whatever was needed was provided; a true gift.  He lined up car service, suggestions on where to eat or visit; etc. the hotel is blessed to have him as a part of their staff.

title: Mario is the greatest!! Whole staff is amazing.
text: Mario truly went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable. We always looked forward to him greeting us when we returned to the hotel. The entire staff at the hotel was wonderful! The room was very clean and comfortable as well.

title: 4 nights at the Smyth hotel
text: Great hotel, great location, great big smile from Mario welcoming me back each evening. By the second night I felt like I was being welcomed home. Newly renovated gym was an added bonus.  Highly recommend this hotel and Mario rocks. 💥

title: Smyth
text: Amazing stay as always with outstanding staff and property. Mario is fabulous, so helpful and kind. The property is clean with the best linens and towels with a spectacular view. The best place in lower Manhattan

title: Best Kept Secret
text: This hotel was a great find. I’ve never stayed in TriBeCa when traveling to NYC but decided to this time based of a recommendation of a friend who stayed at this hotel and loved it. My feelings are the same. Neighborhood was so cool; like you’re an undercover tourist disguised as a hip, cool city dweller. The hotel itself was everything you could ask for. The staff was welcoming and provided 5-star service with every interaction. The restaurant that just opened was a great vibe and the food to back it up. They are opening another spot within the hotel in a few months and I can’t wait to come back and experience it. Smyth is my new NYC “home”. Thanks!

title: Beautiful, central, super clean, and professional staff
text: That's what I expect from a hotel such as Smyth Tribeca. We stayed 7 days for business. Room was super clean the entire stay. Staff (especially Nath) were professional and welcoming, always made sure our needs are fully met. Hotel is located in a great location, few min walk of trade center and other good shops and restaurants. I will visit and stay at the Smyth again when I'm back in NY.

title: Great time with friends!
text: Had an amazing stay with friends there last weekend. Hotel staff was so accommodating and friendly. Rooms were in perfect shape and I loved the decor! We needed some help finding places to go for dinner and the front desk was incredibly helpful. Can’t wait to go back the next time I’m in NYC!

title: Birthday celebration
text:
Celebrated my girlfriend’s birthday in the city and decided to not stay in midtown for a change. The hotel rooms are much larger than most hotels I have stayed in while in NYC. We had no plans but Mario told us to try the new restaurant which we did for lunch and then he told us where to go for dinner. Mario was amazing. Nick was also really nice and helped us with getting Broadway Tickets.

Glad we decided not to do the typical midtown stay

title: Beautiful boutique hotel!
text:
This is a gorgeous modern boutique hotel. The rooms are lovely and modern. Upon arrival and during my stay, the staff was very welcoming and attentive. Mario is simply a GIFT to this establishment by far. He is one of the most welcoming and geniune people I’ve had the pleasure to meet!  I had a few colleagues meet me at the hotel and everyone was welcoming and offering them water due to the very hot day.

The overnight/early morning ( 5am) staff was not as welcoming, I felt a few times that I was being looked at like I was not a patron of the hotel when walking in, especially by the security.

However the daytime staff completely overshadowed that minor experience.

title: Located In Quieter Part Of Manhattan, Walkable To Liberty Island Ferry
text:
Smyth Tribeca is an unshowy building in lower Manhattan, not opulent with frills but good quality and functional. My room was a modest size but very comfortable, good shower and internet. There is no restaurant, but plenty of nice bars and places to eat nearby. 

I’m giving it 4 stars rather than 3 for two reasons. First is that the location for trips out to Liberty Island and other NYC sights was great, and the environment felt safe and relaxed to travel in foot. Second is that the guy on the door and one of the girls at reception were super helpful, which as an out of towner like me counted for a lot.

title: Lovely helpful staff
text: Helpful. Friendly. Always a smile. Mario was so friendly and always there to help with whatever you need. Front desk staff was always available for assistance, even if I wanted some tea late at night.  Would be great if tea /coffee was in the room.

title: A wonderful stay at Smyth Tribeca
text: We had a great stay at the Smyth Tribeca and a special shout out to all of the staff who were ever so accommodating. Service was excellent and location was great too. We had a very good sized room and it was in immaculate condition.

title: Wonderful hotel in New York
text: The location is fantastic. The team, both at the entrance and at the reception was very helpful and gave us a great service. The room was superb. Thanks Dalila (reception) for your kind welcome. If you need to work, there is plenty of room in the lobby.

title: Clean, well equipped, great staff
text:
The location in central Tribeca allowed for convenient travel to notable outlets and sights.  The rooms were clean and comfortable, and we had a view of the One World Trade Centre and the Empire State Building. The toiletries provided were of high quality. The staff were polite and accommodating. Mario the receptionist, in particular, made our stay here exceptionally memorable. He was warm and friendly, always willing to converse with us, and was a highlight of our stay. 

The only cons of our stay were that the walls were incredibly thin - we could hear the residents down the hall closing their doors and the water fixtures whenever someone showered or used the toilet. Also, the breakfast service didn't seem worth it to me as my sister asked for an English muffin and was given a slice of bread with jam.  However, these didn't subtract from our stay here and I'd still recommend staying here.

title: One of the most comfortable places in new york
text: Very well designed modern hotel set back from the street with tranquil garden spaces, and modern interior design. Food, views and everything was so nice that I will be coming again atleast a couple of times before leaving nyc

title: Great experience!
text: Great experience. We have received excellent attention from Markenlie, she has helped us at all times, thanks to her when we return to NY, we will return to the smyth Tribeca Hotel. Very nice hotel, great location, I’m sure best hotel in tribeca.

title: Clean, convenient, cordial staff
text: We have stayed here several times. It has always been notable for being clean and elegantly furnished. Amazingly convenient to sites downtown and only steps from subway stop. Most impressive is the friendly and helpful staff!

title: Lovely
text: I was in town for my daughter-in-law’s baby shower. My first grand-baby! I was very happy with my king suite and spacious balcony. Modern design; aesthetically pleasing. The location is convenient - walking distance to  911 museum; Battery Park; and surrounded by restaurants. The staff was friendly and very attentive. The front desk staff (my car was ready and waiting for me and I didn’t need to call for a reminder); the guys at the door, Bart and the night porter, and the young man who assisted with my bags when I checked out -  they are one reason the Smyth stands out from the rest!! Can’t wait to return.

title: Elegant Hotel, Challenging Service
text: Lovely terrace room in Tribeca. Lobby bar is nice. Parking difficult. No hot water two mornings, bell staff service was poor (said they would get ice and disappeared after being tipped, slow to respond), elevators not functioning one evening, and general staff attitude was you were inconveniencing them if you asked for anything. Lots of options downtown and I will not return.

title: Ms
text: Lilia and everyone at the front desk was so kind and friendly. We were in town for several weeks and everything was wonderful. We (and our dog) miss them very much— made us feel so at home. I hope we can come back soon.

title: Tribeca Film Festival
text: The Smyth is a very lovely and beautiful hotel! The staff is very friendly and attentive.  The brightest and best part of my experience at this hotel is a gentleman named XAVIER! To say that he was extremely helpful would be an understatement!!  This awesome young man is a true lifesaver! I will be planning  another trip soon and I wouldn’t think of going to any other hotel because of his care, attentiveness, helpfulness, accommodations and service.

title: Great hotel!!! Great people
text:
I stayed at Smyth on recommendation from friends and I was impressed at every moment. Arriving at hotel, the door was opened and luggage handled, the lobby smelled fantastic as did the halls and rooms and after smells of city streets, cabs and subwsys that is so welcoming. Bo, front desk, was super welcoming and sent me texts to make sure everything was to my needs …towels, turndown etc …truly exceptional customer service!

My room was lovely and quiet and way more spacious than places I have stayed before.

The hotel has a great location for subway connectivity as well as good eating close by. 
I will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Team at Smyth Tribeca
text: The entire team is excellent. My request for a car service to and from the airport was handled professionally and efficiently by Mario. He always gave us a genuine and warm welcome whenever we returned to the hotel. Robert, Bo and Bart were always helpful! There was another doorman but I don't know his name. He promptly got us a taxi when there was a glitch with the car service. Thanks to him we made it on time to my nephew's graduation. As someone who has been in customer service, the team here is one of the best I have ever encountered!

title: Best hotel in heart of Tribeca
text: My two sons, wife and I had a marvelous stay at the Smyth Tribeca last weekend. We were afforded a wonderful upgrade to a suite and the hotel is elegant, understated, very quiet, and right in the middle of the real residential neighborhood section of Tribeca. Two blocks from Zuckers bagels, Odeon, and a couple more to Frenchette and Weather Up. What more could you ask for? Staff is efficient and kind.

title: Excellent and helpful staff, thank you Lilia Palatsky!!
text: Had a great stay at Tribeca. Got a room upgrade. The location was close to subway and room was very clean.  I also want to say a special thanks to Lilia Palatsky, Operations Manager at the hotel. I forgot my jacket at the hotel and kind of panicked, since this promised me lots of lost time trying to figure out the logistics of getting it back. Lilia actually found my jacket and personally sent it to me to San Francisco. I really appreciate this kind of customer loyalty and devotion. Will visit the hotel again.

title: Lovely hotel, but…
text:
The hotel is lovely, the rooms are spacious, the staff are friendly, and the location is perfect for lower Manhattan.  The hotel also has a well equipped gym with Peloton bikes.

My only criticisms are these:

Someone who had access to my room stole $50 in cash.

The lobby and halls have an extremely overpowering floral scent.

A deranged homeless person threw a chair through a window across the street while I was walking to the nearby market.  New York’s so-called finest were..um…not to be found.

title: Wonderful stay in the heart of Tribeca
text:
The hotel is very design and comfy at the same time. 
The rooms are spacious. Location is great. 
Above all the staff is s extremely kind and. efficient and a special thanks to Xavier, always smiling and friendly and very helpful with luggage and taxi ! 
The whole team at the reception was really amazing. 
Will be back!

title: wonderful visit
text: First time staying in Tribeca area and Smyth - lovely boutique hotel w modern chic decor and location of hotel was great. Staff was super friendly and the room was also quite roomy for an NYC hotel. Had a great time in NYC and will def stay at Smyth again.

title: Wonderful hotel for a mother/daughter NYC trip!
text: We had a wonderful experience at the Smyth Tribeca Hotel. The service was impeccable especially Mario. He took care of us from when arrived to when we departed.  He was helpful in everything needed.  Especially getting us a car to the airport in the early morning.  Everyone who worked at the front desk was also very nice and helpful.  The hotel is very quiet and it’s a great location. We definitely recommend the Smyth.

title: Lovely stay
text: Good location, convenient to walk to Soho and lots of restaurants nearby. Nice sized room, good bathroom. While the hotel might not be splashy, it was more than nice and it had good value for the money considering how NY can be. Plus, the lobby was lovely for getting some work done before the room was ready. Most importantly, the staff totally made the stay, from Robert constantly looking out and being gracious with late checkout, to Honey greeting me with a smile whenever I was in the lobby, to Mario’s compliments and cheer and good info on neighborhood spots. I’ll definitely be back!

title: At Home Feeling Hotel
text: Smyth Tribeca is one of the finest in the area ! If you are there on a Friday or Saturday you will have the dynamic duo Honey &Bo check you in ! I felt write at home during my stay - they helped me with suggestions for my friends and I and helped me with anything I asked for. They are true hospitality. The Rooms are also one of a kind and spacious , which is shocking for NYC. Overall you need to stay here , perfect for buisness or leisure!

title: Gem in NYC
text: Smyth was a pleasant surprise. Walked in and was greeted by Bart at the door and checked in by Bo and Brenda. Very welcoming and full of smiles. I've stayed at different NYC hotels and I can say the staff here is phenomenal. They will go out of their way to ensure a fantastic stay. Will be back soon!

title: Smyth Tribeca- “Posh”hotel
text: Had a wonderful & awesome stay in Smyth Tribeca. It was beyond my expectation. Brenda and Bart was very accomodating during our stay,make sure our stay was unforgettable one.Professional staff. Posh!!

title: Mrs
text:
Super helpful, hard working staff, from the doormen to the engineers, and specially Lilia at front desk, who always goes out of her way to help us, make us tea and accomodate in every way possible.

Sound proof windows, beautiful
Marble bathrooms, comfortable beds and lots of closet space.

title: Great Staff!
text: Love the Hotel. Staff at front desk Diana and Markenlie and everyone else are awesome! Xavier so helpful and his smiling face always feels like I’m coming back home!  I have stayed here many times over the past couple months. Only issue is subway announcement voice on lower floors. Triple windows!

title: MARIO -SMYTH TRIBECA
text: Mario is the best hotel concierge. Above and beyond! . We will be back as it was so great! Hotel is in great location. Chill vibe hotel. Great restaurants within walking distance. Clean. Front desk super nice!

title: Smyth hotel
text: Amazing hotel with excellent service at the heart of TriBeCa. Clean, spacious rooms. Look for Mario- concierge. Nicest, kindest, warmest guy you’ll meet. Will surely be back and stay at this hotel where everything is within walking distance.

title: Great experience
text: The Smyth shines in New York with its excellent service, fantastic location, and extremely friendly staff. The concierge Mario was especially accommodating. Overall, my family and I had a wonderful experience and we will be here again.

title: Great Hotel in NYC
text: I visited the Smyth for business and stayed for 3 nights. The hotel was wonderful. Upon pulling up (I drove from Boston), I was immediately greeted by Mario who was the most kind front door man I’ve ever encountered. He helped me to check in and took care of my car expeditiously. Check in was very smooth and the rooms were perfect - large, clean, and sleek. I continued to run into Mario at the end of each of my work days, and he was always as happy and kind as when I met him my first day. I will definitely be back at the Smyth when I return to NYC.

title: Happiness from the moment he opened the door!!
text: There are a lot of great reasons to stay at the Smyth but for me the main one is the staff, particularly Xavier. Each time we walked up welcomed us with a warm smile and easy laugh. He made us feel like we had an old friend in the neighborhood.  He was helpful with all our questions and went far beyond the call making great suggests for things to do and see. His shining personality set the tone for the entire trip. Couldn’t have been better. Can’t wait to go back!

title: Highly recommend!
text:
I stayed here for 3 nights recently, the staff were great, the room comfortable and clean.
Mario the concierge was especially friendly and helpful!

I’ll be staying here when I’m in NYC from now on!

Highly recommend!

title: Favorite new bar!!
text: Blake was so fun!! We will be coming back to the Smyth Bar. Snacks would be a great addition. Can’t wait to come back. All of the drinks we had were very good and quite refreshing thanks so much!!!!!!

title: Perfect area and friendly staff
text: Recently stayed at the Smyth and the staff was very friendly and went above and beyond for us. Had a great bar and beautiful rooms. Can’t wait for our next trip to nyc! We had such an amazing time!!!!

title: Great stay!
text:
From the time we arrived to the time we checked out, it was a great stay. 

Warm welcome from friendly staff throughout our stay, great location with modern and clean rooms.

Really made us feel special, will definitely be back!

title: Comfortable stay, excellent concierge
text: Comfortable rooms with chic design and decent gym. Mario the concierge was especially welcoming and recommended excellent LGBT+ venues with drag shows. Really inclusive, friendly and high touch service staff in a chic setting. Will stay again!

title: Great stay. Lovely staff and hotel
text: This is a great hotel and a great neighborhood. Very safe very clean and staff is just tremendous. Lillian was extraordinarily helpful when we checked in because there was confusion about original registration. She did not miss a beat and got us into our room quickly efficiently and even gave us a nicer room. Would definitely recommend staying here

title: Excellent!
text: Smooth, elegant well-run hotel in Tribeca was an oasis of chic quiet after intense days on set. Most memorable was the super friendly and welcoming team at front desk and door. Covid protocols in place but they still provided services including an excellent room service provided by a partner. Highly recommend.

title: best hotel in NYC by far
text: I have been to this hotel quite a few times now and I absolutely love it. basing it against almost 20+ luxury hotels in the city that i have stayed at, this one offers more room, a great staff, updates and renovations (most nyc hotels are a bit older), perfect location in tribeca (quiet but full of options) and the staff is ABSOLUTELY incredible from the minute you walk in! i look forward to staying here again and again.

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
Great staff, great location. Wish room would’ve had better heating controls and toothbrushes though. 

Special mention to our bartender Blake! Super friendly, bubbly, and engaging! Definitely an asset to the business. Me and the missus will come again just to chat with her.

title: Best Hotel we stayed in
text: Excellent customer service and friendly staff. Mario in particular helped us with our luggages and had amazing recommendations for restaurants and greeted all of us by our first names everytime. The room was absolutely stunning and my kids enjoyed a lot. I highly recommend it!

title: Blake is the Best!
text: Blake the bartender served up some of the best cocktails I’ve ever had and was very entertaining! The raspberries they added to the Cosmo and Wanda were a great twist and provided lots of flavor. I will be back and would definitely recommend coming here!

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
From the minute we got out of the Uber, Mark promptly greeted us and introduced me to the front desk receptionist Bo. Mark took us to our room and made sure it was too are liking. The room had a view overlooking the city, was pleasantly decorated, modern and clean. Offered complementary Crunch Gym day pass 6 blocks away. Everything you could want at a fair price.

Adam

title: Amazing stay at Smyth Tribeca
text:
I stayed for two weeks at the Smyth Tribeca and had a really great stay. The hotel staff went out of their way to make my stay comfortable. Xavier, Bo and Lilia (to name just a few) were extremely friendly - and made me feel like the Smyth was my home away from home. 
My room was big, clean and with a contemporary feel. 
There is a subway stop outside the hotel, which is an added bonus. 
I can highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great find, Amazing Location
text: Just got back from our trip to NYC and feel so lucky to have found Smyth Tribeca. Such a unique stay in an area that is ideal for any traveler looking for a chill vibe, neighborhood scene and amazing staff. Will definitely make this my go to hotel when on the east coast!

title: Review Smyth Hotel
text: Such an amazing time!! Bo was so nice & was very accommodating. She even left a bottle of champagne in our room for our anniversary!! She made our stay 10x better. Already looking forward to coming back!

title: Hidden Gem Waiting to be Discovered
text: I hesitate writing this review because I want this gem to stay hidden. However, I promised to write about my experience since the staff was so unbelievably hospitable. From the moment you walk in you get the feeling that you are somewhere “trendy”. Intimate lobby check in where, regardless of who I encountered, is staffed by just genuine and very helpful people. Rooms were amazing and clean. Location is in one of my favorite areas of the city where it has that unique NYC neighborhood vibe. Subways right out front. Word is that a restaurant and bar are opening up sometime this year. I can only imagine this will push the hotel right to the forefront of the Tribeca nightlife scene! Definitely making this my go to spot for all future trips.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Nice hotel and well located, spacious rooms, we had some issues with the AC, but Laila from front desk made everything to keep us happy and to fix the problem, thanks! also thanks to the bellman Xavier Batista, who was very helpful storing and having ready our luggage at the time we pass by with the Uber.
Very good option to stay in New York!

title: Friendly Staff and cosy relaxing atmosphere
text: I enjoyed my recent stay at the boutique hotel in NYC. They were so helpful and friendly in particular at the front desk and bell boy concierge. Always doing whatever they could to make my stay enjoyable

title: The wonderful staff!
text: The Smyth staff treated me like family. Always greeting me each day with a smile and how they can help me. Xavier was very helpful with providing an excellent solution for our car or directing me to the gym.  Erica was amazing in understanding how to get us checked into our room after a 14 hour snowy drive from Chicago.  They truly made our stay special.

title: Most caring staff members at the most beautiful and clean hotel
text: Has the most amazing time for 2 weeks at the Smyth hotel. The rooms are spacious enough for NY, newly renovated so looks beautiful and well kept. The staff members are VERY FRIENDLY with a smile and always looking to go above and beyond call of duty. The concierge gentleman by the name Xavier is honestly the most helpful person in all of NY and is always happy to welcome guests as they come in and leave. Going back to NY in a couple of weeks and will certainly be booking again!

title: Smyth Hotel Tribeca
text:
Smyth Hotel is me and my sister’s home when in NY. We always stay at the Smyth and haven’t explored other places because of the location, Manhattan is a good place to be but also, it’s close to most hot spots like the WTC. It has convenient stores nearby and the subway just outside the hotel.
The staff is friendly, the suits are modern and clean, definitely a 5-star experience. I just wish they had a bar and a restaurant.

Good service also at from desk, always smiling - Markenlie, thanks for being so kind always.

title: Celebrating!
text: Great customer service, friendly staff. Bo made sure my stay was perfect. My daughter and her three friends celebrated her birth with a sleepover after dinner. And we mamas celebrated in our own room, too. And we mamas were sent Prosecco, too!

title: Fantastic Property
text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Smyth, looking to have a fun weekend away from the kids. We couldn't have asked for a better experience! From the moment we walked in, we felt like we were treated like the only guests at the hotel.  Considering all of the staffing shortages, we couldn't believe how friendly and service oriented the entire staff was. Even the housekeepers were super friendly and the rooms were spotless! The hotel's location in Tribeca could not be better. I can't wait to visit again in the future!

title: The Perfect New York Hotel
text:
We stayed for 10 nights at Smyth Tribeca and it was amazing.  The staff on arrival, the housekeeping staff the reception staff - I couldn't speak highly enough of how good they were.  So friendly and accommodating,

Bo and the team were just great - thanks so much - we will be back hopefully!

title: Some good, some bad
text:
The 3 good parts were the staff. Markenlie, Diana and Mario. They did everything they could for us.

The 3 bad things were the way too soft mattress, way too thin pillows and the lack of coffee in the morning.

THEY ONLY HAD ESPRESSO WITH ALMOND MILK - Sorry, but YUK

title: Perfect stay!
text:
I’ll start by saying that my trip to NYC was amazing, in part, because of my stay at The Smyth Tribeca. I had some questions before my stay and the staff was super responsive and friendly. When I arrived for my stay, I was greeted immediately “Are you Katie? We’ve been expecting you!” As someone who always travels alone, this greeting really set the tone. My room was exactly as described, clean, and comfortable. The staff is outstanding, especially Bo, who saw how much coffee I was bringing back to my room. She found an extra coffee maker and had it sent up to my room. Seems simple, but it’s the attention to small details that made my stay extra special. The location is great- highly walkable and train access literally outside the entrance. So many restaurants nearby. 

I will 100% stay at The Smyth again.

title: Vacation
text: IT IS NOT PET-FRIENDLY! It has a cold and unfriendly vibe. The room was lovely. However, we did not have privacy while showering.  There is only a tinted glass between the shower and the bedroom. When showering the people in the bedroom can watch your shadowed body move about.

title: Great Hotel in Tribeca
text:
While I am usually a bit apprehensive about staying at city hotels that have lost their national branding (see: SixtyLES, Parker NYC, etc), The Smyth Tribeca, formerly AKA Tribeca, proved my assumptions to be unfounded and far exceeded all my expectations. Despite the post-lockdown era "empty" vibes of New York's once bustling office districts, The Smyth feels like an approachably luxurious oasis that is still walkable to everything of interest downtown (including the still bustling Tribeca) and steps away from multiple transit hubs to take you anywhere further afield. The room was huge by New York standards and well-appointed with a comfortable bed and a large tv with built-in streaming capabilities. I was even able to catch a view of One World Trade Center from the window. The bathroom was bright and also generously-sized. Toiletries were large re-usable bottles, but of high quality nonetheless. The room was spotless. Probably the only thing really missing was robes, which are usually a standard at hotels at this price point, but not a huge deal. Overall this is one of the best rooms I've stayed at in New York and definitely is a cut above several I've stayed in that were twice the price and half the size. While I didn't have too many interactions with staff beyond a quick check-in, everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful.

Overall a great stay and a great property, I look forward to returning and recommending to others.

title: Unimpressed, bed is comfy but room wasn't clean
text:
I want to say nice things because the people working here are very kind.  However, I had such an unimpressive experience, particularly for the money paid.

I arrived after a long drive just after midnight.  I didn't receive much help with my bags or my bike, which I learned they cannot store and it needed to stay in the room with me.  Managing it in the elevator wasn't too fun.  
Parking my car was chaotic - the lot is 24 hours but it does close the gates, it felt like a riddle trying to find the place, stand outside the closed gate in the cold calling them, and finally dropping my car.

Back in the room, it wasn't cleaned.  There was a damp washcloth on the nightstand and a bottle cap with the glasses.  They have limited amenities for food and I went to bed hungry (it was that or eat gummy bears).

I will say - the beds are heavenly. But there is no view from the third floor other than construction and street noise. There's also limited attraction to the room, it looks sterile and has an odd amount of closet space.

I cancelled my second night and went to a different hotel that was rated higher and cost slightly less, I enjoyed that stay much more.  Plus parking there was $35 a night, at the Smyth its $60.

This place is waaaay too much money for what it offers - they should be charging half of what they are for what they offer.  I slept in a dirty room next to my bicycle. 

On the plus, the people working here are kind and friendly.

title: IMPRESSIVE HOTEL
text: I loved everything about Smyth Tribeca.  The rooms were beautiful, clean and a great size.  The staff were all wonderful, accommodating and always welcoming! The location was great too!  I can't wait to come back!

title: Excellent hotel
text: The Smyth Tribeca is is a great hotel, and the staff is super friendly and accommodating!  Our room was gorgeous, light, and airy... a 3 min walk to the Battery Park City greenway and Hudson River greenway, gorgeous setting.

title: Recommend
text: Had a wonderful experience at Smyth. The staff was very kind and helpful. The doormen provided good recommendations on places to eat and things to do in the area. The front desk ladies were so pleasant and professional. Loved the location, close to may things to do and see. Hotel was very clean.

title: Smyth Hotel TriBeCa
text: My wife and I had a wonderful two night stay at the Smyth Hotel TriBeCa. The staff was beyond friendly and a real shout out to Natalie at the front desk. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. Great TriBeCa location. We will stay there again for sure.

title: FANTASTIC!
text:
What a beautiful, fantastic hotel! 
From the moment I arrived, and throughout my stay, service was exemplary from all personnel, particularly the front desk staff & bellmen/security assistance 

All were happy to assist, give help with any questions or issues and also lovely to chat with! 

(Before the pandemic, for about 4 years, I was traveling to New York from LA at least once a month for work and had a regular hotel I loved, I felt it was my NYC home away from home, but sadly, it did not make it thru Covid and it remains closed…)

Knowing eventually I would be traveling to New York again, when looking for a new hotel, Smyth Tribeca was immediately my first choice, I’ve been intrigued for years with the location, decor and especially the rooms with patios! 
So it was perfect the Smyth Tribeca hotel also has great vibes with all professional, helpful and friendly staff! And the location is perfect for me! 
I can’t wait until my next NY trip, when I can stay at Smyth Tribeca again!

title: wayne malone
text: stayed at the Aka tribeca for 4 nights from the 5 march wonderful hotel in great downtown location close to world trade center in tribeca nice area calmer than midtown....mei kam is wonderful at reception as are all the staff and the guys on the door...fine place to eat at the hotel little park aswell....hotel is very clean just an alround perfect stay and thank you for the chocolates and wine sent to the room for birthday great touch......wayne

title: Loved it
text: Great hotel.  Rooms were decorated very nice,  staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice location.  Will be back again for sure.  I found my go to hotel in NYC.  Comfy bed, pillows were feather so if you need something that doesn't squish down in the night call the front desk.  They'll help ya.

title: Very Nice People, Great Place, Great Location
text: We were thrilled to find this fantastic place in Tribeca.  The rooms are actually big enough for 4 people and the staff could not have been nicer.  The bar and restaurant are very nice and the neighborhood has everything.  Still, the staff is what makes this place special!

title: Mario made my stay
text: The AKA Tribeca is beyond wonderful. Rooms are larger than the avg. NYC hotel room and the service is amazing. It felt like home away from home. What absolutely made my stay a 10 is the service provided by Mario, the concierge. He greeted me with joy every evening, always called me by name, made sure I always had a bottle of water in hand, an umbrella over my head in the nasty weather, and I never had to open a door or press an elevator button on my own. Mario is beyond professional in service and appearance. Every hotel needs a Mario and it’s because of Mario that AKA Tribeca is now my home away from home when I’m in NYC.

title: Good tribeca location
text:
Hotel was located in good location of TriBeCa. Rooms were large and we’ll appointed. Included in room Nespresso. 

Attached restaurant disappointing for breakfast. After being ignored for 5 min went down street to Le Pain Quotidian. 

Outlets seemed an afterthought but there was an extension on the bed stand

title: Amazing service!
text:
I came to aka for a business trip and the place was darling! Mario was the most welcoming and hospitable manager! The gym on the LL really nice to get a good workout in with towels and granola bars supplied

Highly recommend

title: Not luxury
text:
Advertises itself as a luxury place to stay, it’s not. Basic at best. 
From the ordinary front desk service to the dirty door to the room, to the crummy lighting, crappy towels and terrible showers. Don’t bother. 
Currently online trying to find another place, worst experience in NY in 20 years of coming here.

title: A needle in a haystack
text: I was recently in Manhattan and wanted to stay in a hotel but not feel like the trappings of a hotel with gift shops and kids taking selfies in the lobby.   Staying at the AKA made this Los Angelino feel like a New Yorker.  I think the upper floors are inhabited by long term guests or owners.  The bar is fantastic and the restaurant attached is also very very good.  The staff are great, very friendly and very professional. My only negative comment is that you can't get a cup of coffee in your room, you have to go downstairs and go into the sister restaurant.  A very small price to pay for a great hotel in a great location.

title: High quality property with exceptional staff
text: My wife and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the AKA Tribeca, over the Christmas Holiday. The rooms are a decent size and well appointed. The staff are attentive and friendly. Having never stayed in Tribeca before, I can recommend it as an alternative to the madness of midtown.

title: Little know but gladly found
text: We checked in with a very friendly and accommodating staff. The rooms were ready early and very clean. So far the space and accommodations we enjoyed a lunch at the hotel before heading to a show. Check it out for yourself!

title: Very nice hotel in a great location
text: If you are looking to stay in Tribeca, we really enjoyed our stay at AKA.  The hotel is right next to a subway line, including an express stop, and the staff was very nice and accommodating.  We amended our plans twice without issue and everything worked out perfectly.  We will stay there again.

title: Comfort and service for a good price
text: I came to New York for my friends 30th birthday and we stayed at AKA Tribeca. We walked in and the environment is very welcoming. It smells great too. Cindy and Mei at the desk were very helpful and accommodating. The hotel has a lounge with a fireplace as well as a bar. The room was big and comfortable. I got room service late at night and it was very fast. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great weekend get away
text: AKA Tribeca is in a wonderful location if you wish to avoid the touristy crowds associated with other parts of Manhattan. The hotel is modern with a nice lounge and attentive staff. From the front desk to the doorman to the cleaning service-  all staff members were friendly and willing to go out of their way to assist. We had a standard room and it is small for the price with only a small mini fridge; otherwise it is clean, quiet and updated. We will upgrade to a larger room for future stays.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: The room was simple, clean and spare but very comfortable. Quiet and Very little street noise on 6th floor. Amazing location for connecting on the 2,3 express trains uptown with the Chambers Street Subway Station virtually outside the hotel door. Lobby area is wonderfully understated, so you feel like you are entering a nice Tribeca apartment building. Restaurant in lobby easy for afternoon tea  and in am Pain Le Quotient on the corner for reasonable breakfast.. The only complaint is the quite tired and a bit smelly hallways and no coffee tea nespresso machine in the room. A good, reasonably priced option in lower Manhattan even if travel too and from LGA is not so easy, fast or cheap.

title: Thanksgiving stay
text: This is our fourth year staying  at the hotel for Thanksgiving. We loved it when it was a Smyth...Despite the new name/management, the treatment we received  and the services offered remain excellent. The Tribeca location is ideal because of it’s proximity to where our sons live in New York. A special thanks to Abraham Rodriguez who helped to make our stay memorable..Andy and Michael Rieder

title: Couples retreat!!!
text: LOVE, LOVE AKA Tribeca Hotel. My wife and I stay here for weekend getaways 2x per year! Very clean, modern, very quiet in NYC standards. The front desk personnel and bell captain were fantastic!  hotel Great bar!

title: Quietest room ever in NYC
text: Excellent all round hotel. But unlike other AKA’s the rooms don’t have kitchenettes if that is important to you. For NY the rooms are large and if you choose well - 601 - no views, except close buildings opposite , but exceptionally quiet. Rare in NY. Good modern style  Italian restaurant attached . Great location. Recommended.

title: Tribeca stay
text:
9.2/10  rating. Great easy convenient ( very near two subway lines) hotel with clean rooms, comfortable bed, helpful staff.  Most than expected for a weekend stay in TriBeCa 

Only ding.  Price but that is all of NYC

Great place to start walks in any direction. World Trade,  Hudson River, SoHo and Greenwich Village, and Brooklyn Bridge region !   

Will return for sure

title: Birthday Celebration
text:
Lovely
Clean & Cozy
Big Windows Loads of natural lighting 
Figi water available at NC upon request 
Bathroom amenities 👍🏻👍🏻
Quiet
Great spot/great restaurants 
Staff fun & friendly
Awesome neighborhood 
Would definitely visit again

title: Perfect
text: The location is great, the room size, decor and amenities are excellent. The lounge and restaurant downstairs are very good and very  convenient. Service is fantastic and room dining service is also top. Perfect stay!

title: Amazing service
text:
There was a mistake in my booking reservation and I had to cancel, 30 mins after I messaged the hotel they helped me cancel it so kindly even tho my reservation was already booked and they could have said it’s non refundable, But they were very understanding and helped me get a full refund which really mattered to me! They even contacted the third party to help cancel which is not their job. 
Thank you for being human and understanding! This was an amazing help!

title: Big and Spacious
text: The hotel is located conveniently by a train stop (the front door is about 15 feet away from the subway) and there is security and concierge at the front at all times. What my wife and I appreciated most was the big room we had. We are use to cramped spaces in New York so it was a warm welcome to have space in a hotel room. There is a great bagel shop a block away and tons of shopping and food within walking distance. The staff was excellent and they have late-night room service.

title: Tara
text: The hotel is in a great location!  The staff was friendly and the room was a good size for nyc.  I will definitely return to this hotel.  The lounge was really nice and only for hotel guests which was nice!

title: Xavier and JC were the best!
text:
This was my first time staying at an AKA property. And there's no other way to put it: I loved my experience. In large part, this was due to the friendliness demonstrated by Xavier (a bellman) and JC (one of the front desk attendants). They went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and in good spirits. For instance, when I first arrived, Xavier was kind enough to offer me a bottle of Fiji water; he later wished me good luck before a law firm interview of mine. These are, of course, only small gestures, but they say a great deal about Xavier's character. 

For those who are deciding whether or not to stay at the AKA Tribeca, I highly recommend it. It's not just a beautiful hotel; the staff are phenomenal as well. 

Cheers.

title: Great team - thanks a lot!!
text: My gf and I stayed a lot at the AKA / Smyth Tribeca during the last 12 months. The interior design of the hotel is clean, almost minimal,  exactly what we needed (I believe that the interior is being upgraded now). But what absolutely stands out is the whole team working there, everyone: the whole reception team during the day and night (thanks Albert for kindly helping us out after hours!!), doormen and house keeping! You all made us feel home. We miss you!

title: Nice hotel - a few minor quirks
text:
I spent three nights at the AKA Tribeca.

Overall, I had a good stay here. The hotel is in a excellent location in Tribeca, surrounded by restaurants, cafes and shops. 

The staff are generally courteous and professional.

I stayed in a premium room, which was nice. But there were a few quirks: the lighting is very limited (this is apparently an intentional design choice), but the staff kindly added an extra light stand which made a big difference; (ii) the shower has no door, so expect water to splash out in the rest of the bathroom! 

The gym is OK if somewhat basic and dated (the Fiji water is a nice touch).

More generally, the hotel is technically newish but you can’t help but feel that it’s more of a ‘soft’ refresh of the previous Smyth hotel (indeed, you can still see some  Smyth logos in parts of the hotel!). 

Overall, I’d consider staying here again for a short stay if I got a decent rate.

title: worst experience, do not recommend this hotel
text:
I am staying at the aka tribeca hotel on a business trip, and I don't recommend it at all.
Below are my 10 reasons why I highly don't recommend it to anyone.
1. The 1st thing I noticed is that It was difficult to find the hotel as the hotel's front doors were closed and no one was there to open them. I had to open two dark and big doors by myself while I was handling my luggage. 
2. The carpet outside of the room was very dirty: the 1st time I see this in a hotel.
3. The toilet's room smells so bad, it may be a plumbing problem.
4. There is no tea or coffee bag nor machine in the room.
5. The bedding sets were wet and do not seem to be clean as they are smelly.
6. Also, I had the breakfast included. They told me that they serve brunch for breakfast during the weekends. But they only served me: tea, orange juice, small slices of fruits, one pastry and one small piece of bread. You have to pay for other things.
7. Also, I called them and ordered dinner. They told me that the fries cost 9$ but I paid 11$.
I ordered pasta and fries, the total without (taxes, tips, ...) cost me 37$.
They charge you the amount they want for tips, and I also paid additional fees, the total amount I paid for, all the fees included, was 51.61$. And the fries were not fresh unfortunately and therefore not good, the oil they used to cook the fries seems to be old.
8. the room is not very well maintained.
9. the shower is not convenient for everyone at least not for me.
10. And finally the bad is not comfortable at all, I didn't sleep well last night. I am really having a bad experience here that I can't wait to go back home and sleep in my place.

title: GREAT LOCATION AND ROOMS, STAFF EXCELLENT - SHAME ABOUT THE THIN WALLS
text: Desk staff super helpful and some porters very good- quiet location next to a subway station, 7 stories high with good double glazing so not uch road noise, lovely lounge area, bathroom and rooms spacious and modern - only down side is that you could clearly hear guests in adjouning rooms WHICH SPOILT THE EXPERIENCE. BECAUSE OF THIS I DONT THINK I WOULD GO BACK

title: Friendly staff, very clean, great location.
text:
Had a wonderful stay at AKA Tribeca. The hotel is located in area, short walk to subway to Penn or Grand Central. The hotel was immaculate, quite, the perfect refug from the city craziness. 
I can't say enough about the staff...the front desk were especially friendly & helpful when looking from directions to local restaurants. Definitely considered a stay here!

title: Amazing stay!
text: I absolutely loved my stay at AKA Tribeca. From the welcoming staff to the minimalist decor to the stunning views, I would stay again in a heartbeat. The room was spacious and very clean. The lounge is a great place to grab a drink or catch up on work. The location was perfect.

title: Amazing personalized attention
text: We were welcomed with friendly greetings and a kind gesture bc it was our anniversary. The rooms are simple, clean, minimalist. We have come here before and loved it when it was the Smyth and the new management has done a good job of transitioning into an exclusive experience with a guests only lounge bar where tips are not allowed. Mei was wonderful and we were greeted with a personalized handwritten note! Very nice touches that made us feel the human connection in service!

title: Location, service, and beautiful room
text: The staff has a very low-key vibe. Our room was immaculate and housekeeping refreshed it to check-in status when we requested it. For NYC, the rooms are larger than what I have experienced in the past. We had a balcony and the door sealed off the street noise at night. It's next door to the best Italian restaurant in the area - Ecco, and around the corner from a really good whiskey bar, Ward III. You have a subway station outside and the Brooklyn Bridge/City Hall station just down the street. And I know this seems weird, but having the NYT or WSJ delivered to your door every day instead of USA Today is a nice touch. The doors staff was friendly and helpful as well.

title: great people running the place
text: Stayed here one night, traveling for work. It was a weird time to visit this hotel, because the lobby was under construction. Had to enter through a weird side door, and use the freight elevator. BUT, the dudes working the door and the makeshift lobby were so nice and helpful, I hardly minded. My room was decent. Decor a little plain. But the bathroom was large and in good shape, and the bed was comfy enough. I'd stay again.

title: New York Birthday Bash
text: This was our first trip to NYC and extensive research on which hotel was carried out! I was thrilled with my choice of AKA Tribeca, mainly due to the location which in my opinion is the best to stay in New York.  Tribeca is such a great area for eating, drinking,and also for many sights including the 911 Memorial,  just perfect for us as not quite so crazy as uptown!  The staff both on reception and on the door were so helpful with providing information and the free drinks and snacks available were much appreciated.  We loved the rooftop terrace with amazing views which we used quite a few times. The rooms are spacious and clean, lovely to come back to after a hard days' pavement pounding.   The only gripe was that on returning to the hotel in the evenings after 1030 we were unable to purchase any drinks in the bar despite being residents. We would love to return to New York and would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic!!!
text: I loved this hotel! It was so clean and the staff was so helpful and kind! They even upgraded me to a better room for free. And the area was perfect! Close to the Hudson River and a nice big park. Can’t wait to go back there! Marvelous hotel!

title: Street always under construction
text: Tribeca is advertised as a luxury hotel but is lacking some of the very basic requirements for modern traveler.  There are no charging stations beside the bed when should be on both sides.  I carry an extension cord while traveling and accessing the single outlet beside the bed involved some gymnastics and moving of furniture.  But then I have my own charging station.  The bathrooms have barn-door sliding doors which do not reduce noise and the shower juts into the bedroom with frosted glass revealing the person in shower.  The rooms are fairly quiet.  The beds are very low--a warning to the over 70 set.  The doormen/bellmen and front desk are very friendly and helpful.  Hotel undergoing renovation during my stay and lobby unavailable.  W. Broadway, in front of hotel, has been under construction repeatedly and I found both left lanes blocked and Uber had to dump me on other side of street.  Best to call front desk and ask what current situation is to know how to direct driver.  I use this hotel solely for its location two blocks from family.  AS noted in other reviews, no complimentary coffee in room OR in lobby.  Also the elevator area is poorly lit (on lobby level), particularly difficult when walking in from bright sun to dim space and trying to find correct end of keycard to insert in elevator.

title: My New Go-To Hotel for Downtown
text:
When you walk in, it smells like clean citrus groves. Front desk is super helpful and kind. Made me feel welcome. 

My (standard queen) room had a patio, clean bathroom, comfortable bed. Only thing missing was make-you-own coffee in-room so I could skip my city-plans and lounge on that patio all day! 

The location was incredible--5 minute walk to the World Trade Center complex, but in a neighborhood with restaurants and services and, well, NYC life. It is also steps away from the 2/3 and (ACE?) subway lines so you can really get anywhere from here. 

For NYC the room felt roomie--lots of light and low bed. No desk, but I preferred working from the patio anyway. 

It did not feel like a mid-range, but didn't cost 'luxury.'

I would heartily endorse and plan to be back.

title: Good hotel nice rooms
text: I stayed here to be close to an event. It didn't disappoint and it wasn't a favorite. No coffee or tea service in room, restaurant is pricey. Staff helpful and friendly. Bathroom small but well appointed. Few amenities, charge for everything. But Starbucks across street and Whole Foods block away so it worked out fine for me. I would stay here again if in the area. Nothing to rave about but nothing wrong. Serviceable with a smile would be my compact review.

title: We stopped in for lunch
text: We stopped in for lunch with some friends. It was quite pricey (I do not live in NYC so it may be normal for that area... $300 for 6 with wine and coffee) but the hamburger was probably one of the best I've ever tasted. My friends had beetroot sandwiches and a pasta dish on special. They all commented on how good it tasted. Services was excellent and it has a nice atmosphere. I cannot comment on the hotel as we stayed elsewhere.

title: Great little hotel
text: I've stayed at the AKA Smyth several times, and it never disappoints!  The rooms are spacious, well appointed and very comfortable.  The staff is amazing and extremely helpful.  I love everything about this hotel, including the location. It's close to great restaurants and businesses.

title: 気さくで温かいスタッフ
text: 主人が病気になって外に出られなかったので、清掃に入らなくても良い旨を伝えたところ、大変心配してくださり、新しいバスタオルだけでも使ってと持たせてくださった。

title: Ottima struttura  !
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 2 notti in prossimita' del capodanno presso questo hotel nel quartiere di Tribeca, nella parte sud di manhattan vicino a wall street
Il quartiere è tranquillo e pulito
Camera (Suite king) pulitissima dotata di 2 televisori divano ottimo frigo bar, macchina da caffe' nespresso ma sopratutto un bagno veramente bello e curato 
A 5 metri dell'ingresso la metro che in 5 min vi porta a Times square
Il personale molto friendly ci ha aiutato nella prenotazione di alcune attrattive e nella scelta di alcuni locali della nightlife di NY
Completa l'hotel un ristorantino curato a piano terra e 2 bar con un ottima selezione di bevande . 
Non abbiamo fatto colazione . Consigliatissimo

title: A Tranquil Oasis
text:
My partner and I spent 5 nights  at AKA Smyth to celebrate my 50th  Birthday and Retirement from the Fire Service. I had also been in contact prior to our visit to discuss another possible celebration ( We got engaged!) Mei Kam and the team at AKA Smyth were exceptional and ensured our stay was very special. The location is wonderful in so far as it is far enough off the beaten track and has a neighbourhood feel. Subway access is on doorstep.
Very clean throughout and very comfy beds.

 We miss it already!

Thank you - Amazing AKA Smyth. X

title: Incredible kind staff, the best of any NYC hotel!
text: We’ve stayed at many hotels in nyc over the years.  The service at the Smyth is better than any other. It even beats the Four Seasons.  We stayed over Christmas and the staff made us feel welcome and taken care of. They went above and beyond— one amazing employee (Mei) even bought a toy for our 2 year old son and had it delivered to our room for the holiday. They were so engaging and kind to our family. The location was great and accessible. The room was beautiful and very clean. The restaurant, room service and bar were well utilized by our group. We’re so happy we stayed here!! It made our Christmas holiday so great!!

title: New York City in December
text: AKA Smyth Tribeca made our December vacation to New York City absolutely perfect! Ever since we started planning this trip back in August, AKA Smyth Tribeca was incredibly helpful and accommodating. It was my boyfriend's birthday and they remembered when we arrived by immediately wishing him a happy birthday. There was a lovely note and champagne when we got up to the room. The room was gorgeous and clean. Fantastic view. The cleaning staff was extremely attentive. The lobby smells great. Perfect location in Tribeca with subway stops just steps away. AKA Smyth Tribeca will be our go-to place to stay in NYC from now on!

title: To the point
text: The novelty of a large room in NYC and the Scandinavian mid century decor mean there are few complaints from me. Service has always been superb and breakfast in the morning is always a highlight. A more than solid choice if working in TriBeCa.

title: Home away from Home
text: I’m in nyc a lot, with most business done in midtown (and the Yanks in the Bronx). So why stay in TriBeCa? Cause this place just feels great. Staff that makes me feel like I’m coming home every time I check in. The smiles and personalities of Clarissa and Mei at the front desk are so warm and friendly, the rooms are great, and the value fair. The competence of this staff is second to none. One of the best downtown neighborhoods with all that TriBeCa has to offer and easy Access to the 1/2/3 and 4/5/6 trains make midtown close by.

title: The best
text: Stayed here for business for 2+ weeks - could not more highly recommend the hotel.  Clarissa and Mei at the front desk are wonderfully friendly.  Bar and restaurant are wonderful.   Service is impeccable A+ all around.

title: Thanksgiving in TriBeCa
text: The accommodations and staff were exceptional.  A great hotel with very nice amenities and reasonable rates in TriBeCa and one we will return to often. The standard king room was well appointed, room service was very good. The sitting area/lounge was large and comfortable and the restaurant service and food was exceptional as well.

title: Wonderful spot in the middle of a great NYC area
text: We were very pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed our stay at AKA Smyth Tribeca.  The location is fantastic - a plethora of restaurants and bars and parks right nearby.  And you can easily visit both the financial district and midtown from here.  We've been to NYC many times, and this was one of our favorite areas.  The hotel was also wonderful.  Very nice, attentive staff, fabulous lounge area, and rooms are larger than many in the city, and very well appointed.  We lacked for nothing.  This hotel will be our new "go to" spot for our NYC visits.

title: So far so good...
text: Great hotel, close to many restaurants & attractions and just overall a clean hotel.  Check-in was a breeze, hotel staff (aside from the restaurant) was fantastic and customer-centric.  Would definitely stay here again next time in NYC.

title: Perfect ...
text:
My husband and I recently stayed in Manhattan. Two weekends in a row. 
Hotel Smyth was our choice both times. 

This time we had a perfect stay, thanks to the caring and intuitive staff !  
We were upgraded to a modern corner suite on high floor, both times ! We enjoyed the extra space in the sitting room and the spacious bathroom. Extra space is a true luxury in Manhattan hotels. Bathrobes, quality toiletries, plenty of towels, luxurious bedding, comfortable king size bed was all we really needed. Surprisingly, it was very quiet ! We slept very well. 

The common spaces in the hotel are very inviting. There is a large breakfast area and we especially liked the cozy sitting room with comfortable furniture and fireplace. 

The welcoming note and bottle of wine from the management was very much appreciated. 

Thank you, Mr. Rodrigues, for personally handling our reservations. We very much appreciated everyones friendly attitude and professionalism, starting with being met in the front of the hotel, handling our luggage and valet the car ($70 /24hrs). 
Check-in and check-out was fast and equally professional.
 
We are looking forward to be back soon!

title: Bra läge, rent och snyggt hotell i Tribeca
text: Sköna sängar med stora härliga kuddar, bra wifi, bra läge. Vi köpte frukost en dag och den var god. Mysig restaurang och en bar som ligger lite gömd men som har goda drinkar. En mysig lounge. Ett lugnt hotell mitt i Tribeca. Bra AC då det var 30 grader ute när vi var där.

title: Very convenient to Holland Tunnel and Brooklyn Bridge
text: We stayed just one night for a quick trip to NY. It was very convenient to the Holland Tunnel. Check in was very easy and very friendly. No problem to valet the car. The room was fairly roomy for NYC. Clean and modern. Not sure I understand why the shower had no door but it was fine. Very quiet as well. We were directly across from the elevator and didn't hear a sound. Also didn't hear any street noise though only on the 5th floor. Restaurant and bar downstairs was convenient. Starbucks across the street. The subway is about 100 feet from the front door which was also extremely convenient. I would stay here again in a minute.

title: Cosy hotel
text:
I stayed in this hotel with my fiancé for 2 weeks when he was there for a business trip. The hotel is very cosy à in a nice area. Not far from the financial district . 
Stuff is very lovely and were quite helpful with everything

title: Lovely hotel!
text: Great experience! Came here for a weekend away and I loved the hotel. The staff was great, hotel was cute/trendy, and it is in a great location! Everything was great from check in to check out. Will definitely be back!

title: Welcome to the Holiday Inn I mean Symth
text:
Everything about this hotel was done with costs in mind....Last time I stay here after 3 failed attempts... the place just felt gross and dirty

Cheap decor and furniture 
Worst beds - sheets felt like sleeping on paper towels 
Carpet looked skivvy - no slippers provided
Iron had rust all over it, as did the replacement
Shoe box rooms
poor excuse of a gym

On the positive side, the location is good and the staff was friendly

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: Very stylish and clean rooms, and a perfect location. Also a nice restaurant and bar on site. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and went out of their way to help when asked. The location is also perfect with easy access to the subways, and close to the Freedom Tower and restaurants along the water. I also travel alone and as a single female I felt safe in this hotel. This was my second stay and I would continue to go back to this hotel without hesitation!

title: great location, stylish and fun !
text: great location and a good ,more stylish alternative to a chain style hotel. nice bath , cute bath and room, nice restaurant downstairs. not a ton of amenities but the cleanliness and style makes up for it.

title: A very pleasant hotel with lovely up-to-date rooms and friendly staff.
text: The rooms are quite nice and reasonably spacious. Internet friendly and up-to-date in every way.  The bath and shower are very nicely designed and lighting and water pressure are fine.  Prices are reasonable and they have a nice restaurant on the premises run by a famous chef.

title: Great hotel in Tribeca -- a little noisy but super clean and well done, fantastic breakfast downstairs
text:
Really enjoyed my stay at the Smyth in Tribeca.  Stayed in Room 410.  The hotel is right on top of the subway.  At the fourth story level, that wasn't a problem, but the buses etc. were loud but not enough to prevent sleep.  I will bring earplugs next time.  This is a 12 story hotel -- so some guests who are sensitive will want to stay in upper floors.

Now the good.  The breakfast place -- the Little Park is phenomenal.  I had bruleed grapefruit for the first time in my life.  Wow!  I am ready to buy a brulee heat gun!  I also had the smoked salmon.  Really delicious and seasoning was unusually good.  Bam.  

The room was great too.  Bed was a little soft but just fine.  The bathroom was really over the top in finishes.  You don't see tubs in new hotels much anymore.  And despite the hotel being about 9 years old or so, everything looked brand new.

Overall, easy five stars.  Little Park Restaurant is six stars for breakfast.  I have not mentioned the staff.  Extremely friendly.  This is like a cozy neighborhood joint.  Really well done.  Will stay here again.  A very nice break from Marriott Downtown or Millenium Hilton.  It is hard for hotels in NYC to stay clean and fresh and small/boutiquey.  Smyth does it.

title: Fantastic stay at the Smyth Hotel
text:
Had a fantastic stay at the Smyth.  Was in the City for a friends 50th Birthday celebration with my wife.  

The Smyth is located in a great location.

When we checked in the friendly staff helped me find a parking spot for my car and then we got upgraded to the penthouse.  What a great space.  The penthouse has a huge terrace with a wonderful view.  

The space in the penthouse is incredible, we didn’t want to leave.  The bed was very comfortable and the amenities are nice.

Can’t thank the staff enough!

title: One night stay
text: We stayed just one night and had a good stay. Nice room, friendly staff etc. Expedia said there was self parking which wasn’t true, but we found a garage nearby. The location was convenient to WTC area sites and the 1,2, and 3 trains stop right outside at chambers st. Lots of good restaurants in the area.

title: Wedding Festivities
text: Thank you so much to Emily and the team at The Smyth for giving us the perfect venue to stage the events around our daughter’s wedding. The Smyth generously upgraded the suite we had booked to the Penthouse, which was the perfect spot for the girls to get ready and for the afterparty. The terrace was so beautiful for the pictures, gorgeous flowers and a lovely city backdrop! I can’t wait to see them!The team was enormously helpful and responsive to our needs and tried their very best to make everything as stress free as possible. They cleaned up after we left for the wedding so that the room would be ready for the afterparty. The standard rooms are also lovely, clean and large. We highly recommend The Smyth!

title: Amazing hotel in Tibreca
text:
If you are looking for a place to stay downtown, and particularly in TriBeCa, the Smyth is your place. 
Newly opened, it offers very spacious rooms, well equipped. 
Service is nice, location is convenient, price is very affordable for the size and quality of the accommodation. 
It may not be the hottest place in town, but definitively one to consider when choosing your hotel in NyC.

title: Exceptional and Clean. Trust me...and I'm not just saying that.
text:
Thumbs way up to this hotel for its cleanliness and rooms. 
Had a standard king size bedroom on the 2nd floor. I had a view of the streets surrounding the hotel which was pretty cool, not as noisy as other reviews have said. 

Cleanliness is very important to me, and everything was exceptional. Bed was comfortable. Side sofa chair was comfortable. Bathroom was nice and bright. Decor simple but perfect. Great air condition, if you want it to get cold in the room, that A/C unit will do the trick haha. 

Cheers to the valet parking bellhop/doorman who helped me with my car and let me know about all the amenities in the hotel. Bar at the hotel has a scene for sure for happy hour and night drinks. 

I was here for my 30th Birthday along with my girlfriend, decided to leave Queens and Brooklyn and enjoy a night staying in the city and away from the norm of our lives.

Would definitely recommend and I would return. 
Still haven't enjoyed all the amenities, but the corner room we had room was a great size. I enjoyed every minute I had and stayed in the room. 

Side tip: Theres a bar a block down which is a nice speakeasy style bar for specialty cocktail drinks as well if you're interested, its called Ward III. 

Thanks for a great time.

title: We always enjoy this place
text: This hotel offers great service and is in a great location.  We learned on this trip that some of the rooms have a balcony on the ninth floor. The rooms are a little small but having the balcony is really nice.

title: Perfect in every way!
text:
Exactly what I’m looking for in a hotel; Modern, clean, minimalistic, great service, nothing was over looked.
Highly recommended. Would definitely come again if I’m staying in Tribeca. 
Beautiful speak easy looking type of bar. I did not eat at their restaurant, Little Park but I did glance at the menu and sounded delicious!

title: Best Staff in the Best Hotel
text:
I had the most amazing staycation in New York ...thanks to the Smyth INCREDIBLE staff.
When I arrived, the bellman opened the door with a big smile for me and my husband. We felt right away that it was the right hotel to celebrate our anniversary.
The Front Desk agent Nikelson was the best! He was exceptional. Genuine interest in us and he gave us such a warm welcome. We live in UPW for years and hardly go out in TriBeCa. Nikelson gave us good restaurant recommendations for our anniversary. He was accommodating to our every requests.
Once we got into our bedroom, we felt on vacation. It was spotless, and we loved the design. The housekeeping team was also so thoughtful. Room was perfectly cleaned. We also tried the next day, after our check out,  the Little Park Restaurant : So delicious! I recommend it highly. This little boutique hotel needs to be known by everyone in New York…It’s trendy but not an overcrowded property like the ones you can find in midtown. 5 stars!

title: Smyth made us smile
text:
Very cool staff that were more than engaging, they were keen on their city and its offerings and were very service oriented.
The bar was also great, with a good vibe.
Thank you to Mei/Keshia/Edward /Joseph and Juan for making us feel welcome and showing a real interest in us.
There were no requirements that could not be met and my family enjoyed their stay.

title: Great location - but room was dirty
text: Lovely location, front desk staff was great.  The room needed cleaning - the couch in my suite had visible stains upon my arrival (see pictures) and there was long hair in the carpet.  The gym could be nicer but the Equinox is a block away and it's fairly easy to get a guest pass.  Won't be staying here again and pretty disappointed that for $500-$600/night I need to put a towel down to sit on the couch.

title: Great location
text:
Just a single night, but hardly a better location to get around and catch up on NYC.

The hotel is boutique and cool. Trendy, yet nice and cosy!

The room was small with a fantastic balcony and view on the 9th floor.

Will come back!

title: Très satisfaisant
text:
C est plutôt un bon rapport qualité prix pour New York / Manhattan. 
Les chambres sont - où peuvent être - grandes. ‘
Emplacement idéal dans lower Manhattan proche TriBeCa. De nombreuses ruelles et restaurants à explorer. Accueil professionnel - sans plus. 
Éviter le petit dej a l’hôtel.

title: Great place...will return
text: A colleague recommends this hotel...and he was right.  Freiendky refeotion upon arrival, clean comfortable room, good restaurant attached.  Lots of pubs, restaurants in easy walking distance.  Enjoyable stay for busiensss...and will return on my next trip to NYC....May well use it as  vacation weekend as week later this summer

title: Fantastic hotel in a perfect location, with the comfiest beds
text:
Loved everything about this hotel.  It's not overly large, but not too small either.  

It's location in Tribeca is fab, with the subway immediately accessible, or a short walk to many downtown areas.

Concierge was very friendly and helpful.

The rooms are modern and well designed - the beds are the comfiest I've ever slept in!

title: Only Unfortunate Timing
text: Only stayed one night as due to local construction, no water was available between 9 pm - 5 am. Unfortunate timing as our time here was great and it was a new location for us - loved the room which was very clean, spacious and quiet with a comfy bed. Shout out to Joseph who went out of his way to find us a cab during rush hour traffic!

title: Love this hotel in TriBeCa
text: We stayed at this hotel for the past 3 Thanksgiving holidays. Initially we chose it strictly for its TriBeCa location as it is situated around the corner from our son’s apartment. It is a lovely,well run place with friendly, helpful staff. Also, there is a Whole Foods Market and Bed Bath and Beyond across the street....This makes it convenient for purchasing items that we need for Thanksgiving dinner. The 9/11 Memorial and Hudson River walking area are just a couple of blocks away....I must add that the staff at the Smyth are so accomadating by giving me access to stairs as I am not a fan of elevators.

title: Our Anniversary holiday
text: We have nothing but praise for the team and the hotel. We stayed 10 nights and everyone was friendly and very accommodating to our every need. The room was spotless and comfortable and housekeeping was attentive and efficient. As a location and hotel we would highly recommend the Smyth as its in a fantastic location and whilst modest in the reception decor, the service and cleanliness more than makes up for anything superficial.

title: Great location and super comfy
text:
Very conveniently located in Tribeca, comfortable walk to plenty of dining options and Downtown area. 

The hotel is small, has a very nice restaurant/bar in adjacent to lobby which had a vivid night scene.
