Although I didn’t quite like the general interior aesthetic, I was upgraded at checkin and the room was quite large with a separate living room, 2 TVs, extra large king bed...the bathroom was very nice. Everything was clean and tidy.

Overall, very convenient location and very comfortable stay.

title: It was “OK”
text:
I originally sent an email requesting concierge assistance for a hairstylist... and I NEVER received a reply...
I arrived at 3:30 am... on April 25... I was exhausted from travel.
It took the front desk clerk approximately 10 minutes to show up... not two good first impression.
I just wanted my bed!

Thereon, it was OK.  Good location.  Good sized room. Very Comfortable bed.  Shower needs a door.  Need more hooks in the room to hang “things”... bathrobe, etc...

title: 位置超好 設計感強的精品酒店
text:
喺紐約芸芸酒店入面 呢間算係性價比好高
尤其以精品酒店嚟講 佢嘅房間大細用料 同埋服務質素 都係有保證嘅
可以叫做 有姿勢有實際 

可以行路去到金融區 financial district / lower manhattan
酒店大堂嘅lounge 又好好坐 可以約埋朋友嚟飲番兩杯

title: Very nice hotel with a few odd lapses.
text:
Found the staff to be exceptionally pleasant and helpful.  No attitude or fake friendliness as with many upscale New York hotels.

Rooms are very well sized, light, airy and modern.

Heating is quirky.  Has a mind of its own.

Not enough electric outlets. (At least in the King Standard)

No hotel shower door. Just a couple of glass panels on either side of entrance. Designers I guess were bath people and don't take showers.

Towels could be fluffier.

Room service prices are high, even by New York standards.  After taxes, gratuities and delivery fee- a hamburger will run you about $38.  Come on!

Parking is pricey too.

Roof top patio for condo owners only, we were told.

But with the good service, clean rooms and great location, we would go back.

title: Architect
text:
The staff is amazing.special commendation to sandy 
Room comfortable
Little park restaurant in hotel excellent staff excellent 
Location excellent 
Wish they installed sound proof windows and had complimentary coffee in the morning in the lobby

title: If you like noise and no temperature control, great choice
text:
I think I should’ve just spent $2.75 and slept on the subway platform because that’s what it felt like i was doing in my room. I was on the 6th floor and heard every train and announcement from the Chambers Street subway station below, not to mention each car rumbling over the steel plate on the road below and every voice returning to their rooms during the night. It felt like I was surrounded by tissue paper instead of walls and windows. I live in the city to a little noise doesn’t bother me but this was really ridiculous. I’d stay in another location where you might be able to find some peace and quiet. Also note that as is hidden in other reviews here, the heat and AC didn’t work in my room. It’s not uncommon in old NYC buildings for there to be one boiler which controls an entire building but it is NoT common for this to be the case in a hotel, leaving guests with zero control of their own room temperature.

Lastly, We sat in the “living room” off of the lobby for 40 minutes before anyone offered us a drink. When she did, it took 20m for her to return for our order.

title: Good value and good location
text: It can be really tough to find a reasonably priced hotel in New York with rooms that aren't just a few inches larger than the bed.  So, I was pleasantly surprised with my recent stay at Smyth.  The room was well appointed and spacious (by NY standards) with a really good and large bathroom.  It's located in Tribeca so a great location if you need to be in the financial area or just like being in a relatively quiet/quaint location.  We had brunch in the hotel restaurant and it was quite good - it seemed to attract people from outside of the hotel - always a good sign.

title: Ok but where is the design
text: Booked this Hotel for a business trip. The Communication says luxury boutique Hotel. But i find it quite ordinary. Good standard and Nice beds but there is no extra with this hotel. No ambience which you would expect from a luxury boutique Hotel. Good gym and Nice reception personnel.

title: Best hotel in downtown manhattan
text: We stayed at the Smyth Hotel while our apartment was being renovated.  They made us feel so at home, we never wanted to leave.  Sandy, the bellman, is the hotel's secret weapon.  He knows the scoop on everything, and takes next level care of his guests.  He knows my dog's name, my son's name and has become part of our family!  In a city like NY it is so refreshing to see someone everyday who makes you feel so welcome, and cares so much about providing comfort to their guests.  When I am running to the office he hands me a bottle of water.  He knows where to find parking!  This place is seriously the best hotel in NYC largely because of the amazing staff there, their attention to detail, high level of service and warm personalities.  Sakeem, Diana, Sandy big thumbs up!  The living room in the hotel has a fireplace and is the coziest place downtown for an early evening cocktail.  Love everything about this place.  Seriously would just live there full time if I could.

title: Freezing Room, Warm Staff ...
text:
I was looking forward to staying in this hotel. After having many great experiences staying in various hotels in Tribeca over the years, it was exciting to try a new place. 
Hotel Smyth is very close to my son's new apartment and came highly recommended by my daughter in law's family that travels to NYC from Cleveland. 

I booked with the hotel directly, speaking with Jean Carlo Ventura. He could not have been more accommodating, patient with my various requests and questions, in one word, excellent and efficient representation of the hotel. 
On arrival, the next afternoon I was greeted by bellman who came outside to the car to see if I needed help. I arrived around 5 PM and was pleased to meet Jean Carlo at the front desk. He checked me in without delay.  

The room was everything I requested. High floor, King size bed. Modern, spacious, bright and clean with wall of windows overlooking the street below. At the last minute my husband could not make the trip, so I was traveling solo. At first look I liked the comfortably sized spacious room. The bathroom was modern and spotless, nice toiletries. Bathrobe, slippers, minibar. High quality linens. 
On the desk in the room was a kind and welcoming note from Jean Carlo, beautifully arranged plate with fruit and large bottle of sparkling water. And within minutes a follow up phone call inquiry if everything was satisfactory. So all in all, an excellent and flawless start.  
I am a frequent traveler in the US and abroad and this kind of wonderful service we usually get in 5 star hotels and pricey resorts, where we often are repeat guests. 
I did not quite expect it this time, especially just booking an overnight stay. It was certainly very much appreciated. 

I left the hotel room just minutes after my arrival. When I returned, quite late at night, the room was freezing. (65 degrees). I tried to adjust the thermostat, the bathroom was freezing too. So taking a shower was out of a question. I was hoping that the room will warm up during the night. I woke up early shivering cold! The front desk tried to help, sending staff up repeatedly, checked the windows, yes they were closed, adjusting the thermostat ... it just would not work. Followed up with several trips with portable heaters, first one, then second one later for the freezing bathroom. The heat from the heaters was cancelled out by the cold air coming from the ceiling above. 
With all the hope for a peaceful start to the day gone, I was forced to get out of bed where I was trying to stay warm, to open the door numerous times to staff who genuinely tried to be helpful. (Thank you,Sandy). 
Yes, it probably would have been better to move to another room, and it was offered. But it was highly inconvenient, especially because all I wanted was a quick hot shower and early check out, to move on with my busy day, spending time with my family. The one and only reason traveling into the city. I never thought it would take so much time without resolution. It was miserable and huge waste of my limited time that day.  

When I finally realized that all this effort was an exercise in futility, taking much longer than expected, I gave up and checked out. After speaking with the assistant Manager Diana Tzanis at the check out, she offered 15% adjustment to the one night hotel rate. As she put it ..." for the inconvenience!" 
Yes, I absolutely agreed with her that it was a huge inconvenience, more than inconvenience really, especially if one only comes to the hotel to just overnight. To be able to take a hot shower and get a good night sleep in a reasonably warm room and bathroom should be the minimum. 
The 15% discount was a "token" that did not make me feel any better at that moment. More like adding an insult to the injury ! Any 5 star hotel would have comped the night. Without a doubt!  
About a week later I received an email from Ms.Tzanis, once again apologizing for the unfortunate situation, offering a discounted rate for a future stay.  

Am I going to book our next stay in Tribeca in hotel Smyth?  Absolutely! 

Because this year the winter was unusually brutal, there were heating problems everywhere and I believe in second chances:) 
We will come back with high hopes for a much more comfortable stay! 
 
I took a car service from NJ, so I did not need parking. There are several parking garages nearby, should you arrive by car. Hotel's valet parking is most likely also  available.

title: 2nd time around, THEY STILL GOT IT!
text:
I returned for my 2nd stay at the Smyth towards the end of January and it was even better than my first stay. The hotel staff truly ensures that you are not just a number but a part of the larger home that you are staying in. 

They are a close walk to the subway if you need to sneak uptown and the front desk is always helpful with recommendations. I love this hotel and can't wait to return for the charm that is my 3rd stay!

title: beautiful hotel
text: The rooms are gorgeous. The service is amazing. Everything is spotless and beautiful. I cant wait to come back!! front desk very friendly and helpful, not to mention the great location, the World Trade Center, and is a few steps from the Chambers Street subway station.

title: Mediocre Stay Due To Transition?
text: We stayed at the Smyth because it was a Thompson Hotel Property when booked.  However, upon arrival we found that we had arrived on a day of transition from Thompson ownership to a new ownership group.  Perhaps this transition had to do with a very mediocre stay that would not lead me back to this property. Regarding the stay itself, we began by arriving in Newark and being taken by car to the hotel.  During the transit I contacted the hotel to request early check-in, which was denied as they "had no rooms available".   Upon arrival, I again requested early check-in (it was right around 12N at the time) and advised that we could not have room until after 4 PM.  I explained to the desk clerk that I understood but we had theatre tickets and needed to change prior to leaving the hotel right around that time.  He advised that they would text us if a room became available.  We set off to have some lunch and walk a bit.  Around 2:30 PM we returned and I again inquired, to which I was again told "no".  My wife was a bit frustrated and a very nice bellman noticed and suggested that he could take us to the gym where there was a sizable bathroom that we could use to change.  This was the first effort anyone made to assist us and the theme continued throughout the stay.  Upon return late that evening we were given room keys and our bags were delivered to the room, where a new bellman told me of his challenging day due to the ownership change.  This was the first we had heard of this and perhaps had someone mentioned it earlier we would have been more understanding, although the lack of interest in helping was still a bit disappointing. Our room was ok, but definitely needed some upgrading with damage to cabinets and stains on the chairs.  Pillows were dreadfully flat and uncomfortable as well. But, we made it through the night and checked out in the morning.  Still no mention of the change in ownership and still a rather stoic desk crew.  Again, the bellman from the prior day was there to "save the day" as he helped with our bags and organized a car back to the airport.  In summation, outside of a very nice and helpful bellman, not much else I can say positive about our stay at Smyth Hotel.  This will not be a return property for us in NYC.

title: Disappointed
text: I was excited about booking this hotel.   We had not stayed in this location before and it seemed well situated in the heart of Trebecca.    The overall impression was one of sheet disappointment.    Staff were dull and sleepy.   One guy at reception did make an effort to find me a restaurant before a concert and came up trumps but the others were not engaging.    The bar staff were rude.    I found the whole experience, despite the location of the hotel, dull and not inviting and will not be back.

title: Disappointed
text: I stayed 4 days at the Smyth.  Rooms are generally ok but heating was not working, TV remote was not working and fridge was empty.  Its also the first time in many years that I had a room without a coffee machine... and no breakfast served before 7am...  I really see no reason to stay at the Smyth, there are plenty of better alternatives in NY.

title: Stylish quiet hotel with excellent staff
text: Stayed at this hotel for a birthday weekend and really enjoyed it! The hotel is very clean and modern. The staff was the standout though. They were incredibly friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friend. We unfortunately didn't stay long enough to enjoy the restaurant and bar at the hotel but they looked like they would be tasty and fun. The hotel would be perfect for a romantic or relaxing weekend.

title: Another Wonderful Stay
text: This is our favorite New York hotel.  It's near several very good restaurants, the World Trade Center, and is a few steps from the Chambers Street subway station.  The service was friendly and attentive.  Our bath room was large and well laid out.

title: Don't waste your money
text: If you're looking for a place to stay for a special occasion, don't book here. The rooms are very ordinary and bland. We wanted to make coffee in the room but there was no coffee maker. Only one elevator worked. The subway kept us awake at night. The rooms are too overpriced for the lack luster you'll find.

title: A new place to stay when i am back in my hometown
text: A total pleasure that began at check-in, and didn't stop during my entire stay. I had never been to the Smyth before, and i have to say it was the most pleasant surprise. As a professional musician i travel a lot, and often the surprises i encounter are not positive. However, at the Smyth, i found the best hotel experience i had in years. I can think of no need that went unmet, no problem that went unsolved, and no employee i will not look forward to seeing again. They were all just great. I Am hoping to return in the Spring, and i especially hope to encounter the same friendly, professional staff tht greeted me every morning and every evening upon my return.

title: amazing stay at the Smyth!
text: the service from the manager when  we checked in, Jean-Carlos, was exceptional. We were exhausted and hungry so we had a speedy check in and headed up to our gorgeous rooms before Jean-Carlos got us a table in the restaurant which was delicious. The staff all around in bot hotel and restaurant for dinner were amazing highly recommend

title: Highly recommend Thompson Hotels
text: This is the second Thompson Hotel in NYC that I have stayed in, and both were very pleasant experiences.  Although Smyth is not in the center of town, the value is worth the extra distance. The rooms are modern, roomy, and very clean.  The staff is friendly and professional.  The valet parking is reasonably priced, and the mattresses very comfortable.  The lounge provides the opportunity for an on-site snack or drink.  I highly recommend Thompson Hotels and will stay again the next time I'm in NYC.

title: weekend
text: Exceptional on all counts! I loved how attentive the staff was and how comfortable the room was. I laos liked the location as we were doing a lot in teh downtown area. The hotel lobby was also very nice .

title: Great Boutique Hotel in TriBeCa
text: We stayed at The Smyth while moving my daughter from the East Side to TriBeca.  Great location in TriBeCa and an unbelievable staff.  Very helpful and friendly.  Room is nice, akin to a W in style, but not fabulous - except when considering the price!  Great value, much better than The Beekman for example.  Excellent fitness facility that isn't mentioned on the website.  Only negative to the room is that there is not a makeup mirror, which frustrated my wife.  Only other minor complaint is that there isn't a complementary coffee/tea service in the morning, meaning you have to spend $23 for a small pot of coffee and a pot of tea.  Again, not terrible given the room prices ($188/night) for a King Superior, which is an interior room that is extremely quiet.  Not sure why you would pay more for a street view that is more expensive.

title: Disapointing
text:
My wide and I booked last minute on another website that classified this as a 5 star hotel.  The price we paid was moderate ($250ish with taxes) and the reviews were very good.  Our experience may have somehow been unusual but I can't imagine how?

My review is intended to reflect the expectation that this was a 5 star "upscale" hotel.

When we first arrived, we were a bit lost as the GPS had us going to an address on the street around the corner. I called the hotel to ask where I was going wrong and the clerk was not helpful.  She couldn't give me specific instructions even though I was literally 2 blocks away.

We pulled in front and there were no spaces in the drop off area.  My wife ran in to ask what we should do and was told to just wait in the car and someone would be out.  So we waited for around 5 minutes.  The same desk clerk came out and vaguely said to pull the car forward and just leave it there.  There was no doorman or valet.  It was strange for an upscale hotel.

The room was very small, even for NYC (#414).  It was unremarkable but clean.  There were several things that we really didn't like.  The bathroom is extremely awkward.  The shower wall is around 3 feet from the side of the bed and is frosted glass so basically you can see the person showering, especially if they are close to the wall.  Depending on who you are with this could be totally inappropriate. 

There is also no real bathroom door.  There is a sliding barn style door that does not seal in the opening meaning you can very easily hear the person in the bathroom doing whatever it is they are doing.  I'm not exaggerating.  You can hear in the bathroom as if there was no wall or door.  In a super small room, it is very awkward.

The heating system would not work and kept making a grinding noise.  I had it set to cool and on auto.  I went over to fiddle with the controls and see if I could figure something out.  I put the fan on low and it made a humming electrical noise.  I put it on medium and it did not work at all.  I had to put it on high for it to work but then it was on high all night.

A few more strange things...  The lamp next to one side of the bed was unplugged and the cord wrapped up.  There were no easily accessible plugs around the beds for phone charging.  No coffee maker.  The heating light in the bathroom had a timer on the wall but did not work.

I've probably stayed in 15 NYC hotels.  I'm definitely not the most critical person and definitely don't often stay at the fanciest hotels, anywhere I go.  Just for context, this is not an upscale hotel and there are many better options at a lower cost around the city.

title: Awesome Hotel!
text: Great staff, location, room, dining!  Check in and check out was breeze, Room was spacious and very clean, water pressure in shower was divine, bed was like a cloud!    Location was great, subway right outside the front door.  Will be back for sure!

title: High End Comfort
text: Stayed for two "date nights" with my husband who works nearby. Clean, friendly, warm and cosy fire in the bar. Very nice restaurant in hotel but terrific small places within a couple blocks' walk too. Definitely would stay here again!

title: My new place near Wall Street!
text: Very nice - it's a smaller boutique hotel, but has everything.  Nice modern room with very comfortably sheets, bathroom is small but very large nice shower, modern fixtures, clean, great workout facility, and nice lobby bar area with comfy chairs and fireplaces.  There is a restaurant too but I did not get to try it. Ten minute walk to Wall  Street - loved it!  The only thing I would recommend is complimentary coffee by the papers in the morning.

title: Always a pleasure
text:
Have stayed here twice and it's my favourite hotel in NYC.  The hotel is located in Tribeca a short walk from Ground Zero / Wall Street.  

Good things?  Nice interesting neighbourhood, quiet and away from the tourist mayhem, subway station right outside which gets you to the main points of interests, short walk to Ground Zero, Statue of Liberty and Wall Street, well sized rooms which is unusual for NYC, lovely cosy fire near the main lobby, Bar is discrete and stylish, nicely furnished, staff or super helpful, good value for money.

Downside?  Not suitable if you want to be in the mayhem of Times Square or close to Central Park.

title: Suite was amazing for getting ready for the wedding!
text: We live in NYC, but we were getting married in Jersey City... so the thought of cramming everyone in our tiny apartment to get ready wasn't going to happen. We looked for a place close to the ferry at World Financial Center, but also near some cool restaurants and bars and that's how we found the Smyth. I got the Thompson Suite for the night before the wedding and for our wedding night. The suite was GREAT... and much bigger and a much better value than any other hotel we looked at. I also like that Thompson Hotels aren't huge chains, as let's face it, a Four Seasons or Ritz, just wouldn't have had those detailed touches. The hotel bar is also great as a great meeting point. The staff was incredibly helpful and took care of us at all points. We would definitely stay here again, even if for a staycation!

title: Stay at Smyth Tribeca!
text: Rooms are well-designed, comfortable and clean. Recommend a stay at the Smyth. Plus the location is very convenient to lower Manhattan activities. Thank you for a wonderful stay. We will come back and stay at Smyth Tribeca.

title: スタッフがとても親切
text: 拙い英語でも一生懸命対応してくれる。部屋は綺麗にされているが、やや暑く調整がしにくい。駅出て目の前なので観光にも最適です。

title: Almost ruined
text:
Visited this hotel for a short birthday trip. Upon arrival was a little underwhelmed by the entrance and then we were met at reception but the most unfriendly person I have ever met at a reception desk. No smile very cold presence and minimum eye contact. He proceeded to check us in with very little communication. 
We checked into a room we were very disappointed with, a small room, very small bed for 2 people to share and a window facing a brick wall with some windows. Regrettably had to call reception and speak to this same person who was very rude and unhelpful and wasn’t willing to help. We had to go back to who we initially booked with and were moved to a nicer room with a better view, we were helped by a lovely man called SAQIB who was very welcoming and made our stay more pleasurable. (Credit to your hotel)
I did ask the rude person for his name and he told me John, I later found out he had lied and he is called Giovanni. Real let down to this hotel!

Positives- Location is great, right near the subway if you want to use it. Few minutes walk from ground zero and Westfield shopping centre. 
Lots of coffee shops and places for breakfast. Rooms higher up more spacious and great bathroom mirror. Beds also very comfy.

Negative- we caught taxi into time square each day as it is a distance away. 
Rooms could do with brighter lighting.
Need to insure you have your best staff on reception to greet the guest and make them feel welcomed.

title: Details matter
text: WE have stayed at Smyth numerous times. It is our go to hotel in NY.  Things are a bit quirky over the holidays perhaps.  Most uncomfortable was the way the thermostat in the room seems to not affect the temperature in the room.  We stayed five nights and over the six days we went from chilly and unable to warm room to two days of constant proper temperature to last day of chilly, uncomfortably chilly.  when we first complained, the desk promised to have engineering take a look and when we returned the room was a comfortable temperature.  We did not touch the thermostat for three days but on the third day returned to find room again getting colder and colder even though the thermostat was still set the same, endured two nights like that.  Attempted to talk to engineer but got nowhere.  Except it seemed as if he could control temperature of whole building from basement--very strange.  I had an extended  discussion with front desk, but they seemed to not have a clue.  We checked out as planned and then returned for one night to room on same floor.  Found the thermostat in that room set to A/C; room chilly so we put to Auto/Auto and eventually room warmed.  IF the thermostat is only a supplement to the main heating, guests need to be advised.  This was a strange problem, but we were gone for most of every day and returned to sleep and were not interested in calling and having someone come to room after we had retired.  We requested extra pillows at beginning of stay only to have one disappear after room cleaning two days later.  On second check in we requested an extra luggage rack which never arrived.  Since our experience with Smyth is that all requests are promptly we suspect it was holiday season which caused some of the "misses".   The rooms are very comfortable and amazingly little street noise.

title: Love staying at the Smyth every time
text:
I often stay at the Smyth Tribeca when in New York for business.  Last time I was here was particularly excellent - who doesn't love a good upgrade?  Was upgraded to the Thompson Suite which was 900 square feet of contemporary space.  Had a separate living room and dining room, bar, and powder room at the front of the suite.  Wish I had stayed in town for longer.

Staff at the hotel are great, very helpful.

Will keep coming back here

title: Sweet deal!!
text: Great service and cleanest rooms in the city...valet is a plus but street parking on sides is free is you can find it. Lots of local food and shopping close by!!! COFFEE and pastries around the corner, bookstores, and a MUST try is Little Park with its Amazing seasonal  flavors.

title: Terceira lua de mel
text: Hotel muito agradável, funcionários muito atenciosos!   Quarto bem agradável , banheiro bem grande !  Restaurante muito bom .   Recomendo para casais e famílias .   O quarto tem uma sacada excelente com vistas para o memorial às Torres gêmeas ! Tem mercados e padarias próximas

title: Hip en rustig hotel in TRiBeCa
text:
Fijn rustig hotel op loopafstand van het 9/11 memorial. Chamberstreet metro op struikelafstand voor de ingang van het hotel. Je bent dus zo overal!
Mooie kamers, wij hadden 713, groot bed, heerlijk zachte luxe lakens. Dure minibar (what’s New?!)
Diverse ontbijtmogelijkheden in de buurt, wij hebben dat niet in het hotel gedaan. Zucker’s bagels & smoked fish is een toptentje op 1 minuut lopen, straat tegenover. Of bij de buren Le pain Quotidien. 
Gezellige bar met open haard. Klein beetje vreemd dat deze dicht was met kerst. Dan is eigenlijk alles dicht, houd daar rekening mee! Maar overall, raad ik dit hotel aan!

title: Business Trip Stay NYC 8th-10th December 2017
text: Very nice boutique hotel which is located very conveniently at the Chambers street subway line. The rooms are very large (especially for NY standards) and well designed. Very clean and comfortable. The hotel restaurant and bar serve good food and excellent cocktails. For business travelers I can highly recommend this hotel. One of the best in terms of price and value I came across in NY.

title: Happy time in nyc
text:
Very beautiful hotel with style and personnality.
I really enjoyed my stay there and i will come back.
Very well located.
Staff is efficient and very smart.
It would be good to have some nespresso coffee in rooms. Maybe there is in other rooms categories.

title: An absolute gem of a hotel.
text: Incredible location, extremely friendly staff and our room was immaculate. Loved everything about this hotel from start to finish. Decorated in a mid-century style with lots of interesting artwork it was hip and stylish. Food and drinks were inventive and delicious. The neighborhood is clean and safe with no shortage of great eateries and shops. The 9/11 memorial and Freedom Tower are just a short walk away as is the Brooklyn Bridge and City Hall Park as well as subway entrances and the Path train located in the stunning new Oculus building. Honestly the best hotel experience I've ever had in NYC. Not only would I highly recommend it I can't wait to return and do some more exploring around this amazing neighborhood. Thank you to all the staff at the Smyth for making our stay a wonderful experience!

title: Tribeca in Style
text:
My wife and I try and rotate locations in NYC between upper and lower neighborhoods because we love both and appreciate that the nearby experiences are pretty different.  This trip, we picked Tribeca and a Thompson hotel after having stayed at The Cape in Cabo and loving it.

The Smyth was quite nice and the location is pretty fantastic, close to West Broadway and Greenwich shopping areas.  The living room portion of the lobby was well used because it’s highly functional, cool, comfortable space.  The bar area, by contrast, was fairly lifeless and literally had the sound system “down” our entire stay, which does not seem optimized from a management perspective.

We were traveling from the west coast, so noticed the restaurant closed for breakfast surprisingly early and the service level there was squarely in the mediocre to not very good range.  That being said, the food was very good.  

The rooms, as you might expect in New York, are tight, but comfortable enough.  This is not luxury, folks, but it’s not in bargain territory either.  By that I mean to say, nice product, fair pricing, great location, just some small service issues around the edges.

Still recommend, without reservation.  Have fun!

title: Tribeca gem
text:
I have stayed at The Smyth multiple times and find it to be in a great location. The area is fairly quiet and close to multiple subway lines - one is located across the sidewalk from the front door of the hotel. The staff is friendly and accommodating, the food/ restaurant is excellent and the hotel is quiet.
The neighborhood is filled with dining options and interesting shops.

title: Clean, Quiet and Excellent Location
text: It's a smaller hotel (with condos/apartments on top floors), but it works in Smyth's favor, as everything from reception to room service to the bar area felt cozy and personal. The rooms are simple but clean. Prices will be a shock to first timers, but it's lower Manhattan. Access to the subway is literally steps away. Quick walk to the 9/11 memorial. Times Square was a quick subway ride. I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Great NYC hotel
text: I loved the relaxed and stylish vibe of this hotel and will definitely be staying again. Great service, great amenities, brilliant helpful and friendly team. Rooms are a great size for NYC and have everything you need for a comfortable stay.

title: Perfect for vacation or for business!!!
text: Loved it. Cozy clean cool hotel down town with quiet rooms, super well located.  The gym could be updated, that is my only comment. Staff super friendly. Amazing Bar and Restaurant. You feel like a local.

title: AWESOME
text:
Just one tip. The Nesspesso machine is programed by the pods.  The larger deeper pods are for a tall
coffee size.  The smaller pods are shots.  The staff was great.  My daughter live one block away so it was very convenient.  ENJOY your stay!

title: Great position fortransport links
text:
Some staff very friendly-others a little less so.
had an issue with the heating of the room but it was resolved.
Comfortable bed.
Lights in bathroom had a mind of their own! Decent sized room. good position in Tribecca

title: Smyth Hotel, NYC
text: Great hotel with excellent service in convenient Tribeca location. Contemporary room facilities with luxury accommodations. Good dining/bar options onsite and many nearby bar/restaurant options. Have stayed here a number of times and have always had a positive experience.

title: Stylish, calm and luxurious boutique hotel
text:
Amazing ambience, warm, welcoming, delicious food and exemplary service.
Cannot recommend highly enough. The location is perfect, next to the subway, Tribeca is a great location to explore.
best granola and yoghurt for breakfast.
I will make this my NYC hotel of choice.

title: Love the setting!
text:
Efficient service and friendly staff, also enjoyed lobby area :) 
Really like the bathroom decor, it's unique and i have never seen any similar style in any other hotels. Hotel is right near the subway station, that just made my trip so easy

title: Weekend get away
text: Staff was friendly and very helpful. Front desk were great giving recommendations for  restaurants. Room was large for New York and very clean! Bed and pillows so comfortable, and housekeeping was twice a day. Terrific all around.

title: Almost perfect
text: Everything was wonderful. Room was beautiful but a little bare and could use comfortable chairs but location, quietness and cleanliness were better than anything I’ve experienced in New York, including hotels that cost 3 times the price. In fact, probably the cleanest bathroom of any hotel I’ve been in around the world. Staff was very nice and restaurant was terrific.

title: Fantastic Stay in Modern Boutique Hotel
text: This hotel was fantastic - great location, excellent accommodations and good food and bar on site! We stayed for three nights in November and it was wonderful. Felt very luxurious, at great prices (for NYC)! I loved that we were in walking distance to many amazing shops and restaurants/bars in TriBeCa. Subway right outside the door, too. Hotel rooms were quiet and tastefully decorated. Beds were very comfy!

title: Trendy and Nice
text: This is a nice hotel, nice restaurant, nice gym, friendly, quick and discreet check in staff.  I usually stay here however for work purposes, and it does not really cater to business travelers.  No coffee available in the lobby or rooms, breakfast not available by restaurant or room service until after 7.  I've stayed here twice and had a good size room.  The last time I stayed there the room was pretty tiny.  But rooms have always been clean, fantastic housekeeping, and the bathrooms in particular are really nice with nice products.  I also really appreciate that the housekeeping staff replaces the products every day. I like staying here, good location, but might be better for pleasure travel than business travel.

title: Excellent hotel
text: My wife her daughter and I stayed at the Smyth Tribeca (lower Manhattan) from 1st to 12th September 2017 and enjoyed the 12 days immensely. The rooms were bright both lighting and natural light (something unusual with many US hotels), airy and very comfortable and the staff incredible, particularly Sandy who was more than helpful. Sandy went out of his way to assist with all our transport needs, from taxis to subway, directions to events and assisted with bookings for the events. He made our stay an absolute pleasure. The Smyth is also well located just a short walk to Soho, 2 blocks from the 9/11 memorial site short walks or taxi rides to restaurants, theatre and great shopping.

title: a relaxed stay
text:
We had a great stay, associates really friendly and always trying to help with genuine approach. Location perfect for us, close to many classic tourists spots, but also to express subway, which was a pleasant surprise for us.
We didn't try the restaurant , so no comment on that, as well ad the bar, but bar looks very warm and cool
Rooms very clean and spacious, and wifi working perfectly. 
Thanks again

title: Ist stay in Tribeca
text: Just back from our annual trip to NY but,  our 1st time staying in Tribeca.  This hotel was well situated in lower Manhattan based on all the things we planned to see and do.  We walked everywhere we needed to go, even though the subway was right at the corner.  Lots of unique restaurants and shops to visit and all within walking distance.  The Smyth Hotel was clean and  well maintained.  I would stay here again.

title: Großartiges Hotel
text: Ein wunderschönes Hotel mitten in Tribeca. Hervorragend gelegen -direkt an der U-Bahn-Station Chambers Street. Vieles ist fußläufig zu erreichen, aber durch die direkte U-Bahnanbindung ist man auch schnell in anderen Teilen Manhattans bzw. New Yorks. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich, zuvorkommend und hilfsbereit. Die Zimmer geräumig und sehr sauber. Sehr empfehlenswert bei für einen Trip nach New York. Sicherlich nicht das günstigste Hotel, aber der Preis-Leistungsaspekt ist absolut okay.

title: Tolles Hotel in TriBeCa
text:
Wir waren hier für ein langes Wochenende und waren sehr zufrieden 

Das Personal im Hotel war immer sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend 

Unser Zimmer war für New York recht groß und sehr schön modern eingerichtet 

Alles sehr sauber 

Das Frühstück im Restaurant war ok aber zu teuer und der service eher schlecht

title: An Incredible Stay
text: We arrived greeted at the door and upgraded to a suite the Friday we arrived. The room was spacious with incredible views. There was absolutely nothing more we could have asked for. Nicholson was so helpful at the door the rest of the weekend giving us great recommendations for restaurants and bars. We also visited the hotel's bar and restaurant which was the perfect first night after a long day of traveling. The Tribeca area is the perfect location for a weekend getaway or trip where you want to be in the city but feel like you are home. We can't wait to stay again!

title: Easy
text: Very easy, comfortable, and chic hotel.  The lobby and restaurant were impeccably designed with various areas for seating and gathering.  They were great for spending time away from your room, but still at the hotel.  The rooms were basic, but I liked that the furnishings aren’t your standard faire.  The location is very convenient to the World Trade Center.  I could easily stay there again.

title: Noisy from the street.
text: Good location and a very nice spacious room and friendly staff. The one downside to our trip was the amount of disturbance at night from the street - especially where there are large steel sheets over the road works. If I stayed again I would not want a room on the lower floors.

title: Great Hotel in Tribeca
text: This the second time we’ve stayed at the Smyth.  Great location, staff, food & ambience. Right next to a subway stop; neighborhood feel but close to everything downtown.  Great views of the Eorld a trade Center.

title: Dropped in here for a brief business meeting.
text: The atmosphere is really nice. The staff are helpful. They don’t approach you but are available and were attentive on the day.  I quite like being left alone unless I ask for help or service so for me this was an ideal environment.  The bathrooms and food area were very clean and it’s a nice welcoming hotel. The WiFi is free in the foye.

title: Perfect location and service
text: Beautiful property, nice space for NYC and full service, including 24-hr room service. Has a nice mid-century modern feel with the lounges to match. Easy to get to with plenty of dining and local bars nearby.

title: Love the Smyth
text: One of the best Hotels i ever been to. Good located in the heart of Tribeca, with a lot of very good restaurants nearby. The Rooms are big, with a very comfy bed and a nice & clean bathroom. The rooms in general look like new & they`re in very good conditions.

title: Fantastic location and welcoming atmosphere
text: A cozy atmosphere and convenient location in the Tribeca Area.  When visiting the City, I have stayed here on several occasions as I love the easy access to the walk along the Hudson, wonderful restaurants and distance from the constant buzz of the Times Square area.

title: Light and airy or dark and depressing
text: If you're fortunate enough to land a room facing West Broadway, The Smyth can be nice.  Otherwise, the rooms facing the back of the hotel are dark, dreary and depressing.  Staff at check-in are friendly-- unless you get the guy who doesn't believe that you're actually supposed to be in a different category of room. When I was finally moved to the category of room I had booked, it was light and airy, and very nice.  But it took far too much work after a long flight. The location is great, and the area is wonderful. That's what you're paying for.

title: Amazing stay at the Smyth
text: We had a last minute need for a hotel in NYC for a group of women in town and we couldn't have been happier with our find.  The hotel was beautiful, the staff friendly, and the location perfect.  Sad we only stayed one night.  The rooms were spacious, clean and modern.  I would recommend a stay at this beautiful hotel anytime you're in the area!

title: Nice but not worth the $$
text:
We arrived early Friday morning and while we didn’t expect an early check in we did expect to check in by 3, which is what was on our reservation. We waited for over an hour and then they upgraded us from a queen bed to a king with no view... so not really an upgrade. 
The hotel is centrally located within Tribeca and the Q stop is just out front which is nice for taking the subway around town. Over all I was not impressed and probably won’t stay there again based on the caliber of hotels surrounding this one.

title: Great choice for a quick business stay
text:
I stayed overnight at the Smyth recently and was very impressed. I used to work in the neighborhood for 20 years so I know there's a lot of options. This is a great choice for an on-the-go business traveler. The location makes it very easy to take the Airtrain to the A-line subway from JFK. Ride takes about 50 min (same or better then by taxi/car svc), total cost is $7.50 (you read that right), and just a one block walk from the chambers/church street station to the hotel. 

Can't say enough about the customer service - I emailed the morning before my arrival to ask if some docs could be printed and left in my room for arrival. Within minutes the response was 'yes, no problem.'  When I arrived hours later, two copies were waiting for me in my room. 

There are two bars which are both great if you need to schedule meetings. It's a super easy location for anyone to get to. One bar is loungy with couches and fire place. The other is part of the attached restaurant, more conventional but still cool and boutique-like. 

The room, bed, bathroom were beautiful. Modern and very boutique cool. What you would expect from a Thompson property. 

All in all it was an impressive stay, easy, convenient, reasonable price, and great service. I would stay again next time I am there.

title: Best hotel stay
text: I recently booked a stay with my girlfriend at Smyth and had the best hotel experience of my life. I got in touch with the front desk staff, who were extremely helpful. Cristal was so great to work with to plan a surprise wedding proposal and helped make arrangements for champagne and flowers. My room was upgraded and it was decorated beautifully. I would stay here again anytime! I can't say enough about how great the staff were and how perfect our stay was!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: We had a suite for the weekend of my daughter's wedding.  It was spacious and lovely.  The hotel staff was professional and very accommodating.  We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

title: Great TriBeCa Hotel
text: This is a really lovely hotel in a great section of town. We had some business meetings there in the hotel catering was spot on. I also had lunch and drinks in the restaurant and I enjoyed my time there. The room had a robe and slippers (which is important to me), but not a coffee pot (which is also important for me as an early riser). There is a great Pilates studio two blocks down and it's close to the Greenway for running.

title: Hidden Gem in Tribeca
text: Hotel stay is always exhausting me and husband, however, this cozy boutique hotel made us feel relaxed and comfortable. I loved their furniture and linens. Clean, simple, and casual elegant. We were able to sleep deeply, which barely happened except staying in Aman Hotel. We loved this hotel and we will come back again.

title: Average for a 5 star
text: Slow service, late housekeeping and a freezing cold restaurant (air condition certainly works) made for an unmemorable expensive.   Rooms are very small.  Other Thompson properties are way better... and in NYC there are simply better 5 star hotel options available.

title: Exceedingly comfortable beds, but rooms lacking personality
text: Staff was wonderful and accommodated an early check in. The Lobby Den was charming and cozy. Drinks are very expensive. We got a king suite with a view of a brick wall. While we didn't mind the wall (there was sufficient light in the day), the room just didn't have much personality. It was very minimalist, sterile, but clean and comfortable. There is a bit of a gap under the door, so you could really hear everything in the hallway, including doors opening and closing early in the morning.The bed was luxurious and the pillows and duvet were the perfect softness and warmth. The sofa had some stains on it, but it folded out into one of the more comfortable pull-out sofas I've seen. The best part was the bathroom, which was spacious and included a deep tub. The separate shower's water pressure could be stronger. All in all a very nice hotel, but I don't think I'd pay more $600+ a night for a room again. That didn't feel like great value to us.

title: fabulous stay
text: We had a fabulous stay!  Rooms was great and people working at the hotel were wonderful.  Cant wait to go back.  I have been telling everyone i know about this great hotel. It was my boyfriends birthday and they made it so special for us

title: Terrific Hotel for a glimpse of TriBeCa and downtown
text:
I usually stay mid or uptown when I come to NY but this time I wanted to poke around Soho and TriBeCa. The Smyth was a great choice. Location is excellent. Five minutes from 911 memorial and museum and the Freedom Tower. Walking distance to Soho and of course TriBeCa. Subway right on the corner and other stations nearby.
The room was a nice size by NY standards and comfortable. Decor is sparse (trendy) but not unpleasant. 
The staff was TERRIFIC! Period end of story!
The drinks in the bar overpriced as NY tends to be.
I did not eat in the restaurant. 
I definitely recommend this hotel based on location, comfort and staff!

title: Downgraded upon arrival
text: Great location, but there was an unfortunate mishap at check-in where I was told upon arrival that there had been a leak in the hotel and that the room I booked wasn't available. The front desk said I would be put in a smaller room but be charged the lesser going rate for the smaller room (as if this were somehow a win for me). No other real accommodation for the inconvenience which I thought was weird. Also they had my email address and phone number and never tried to contact me in advance. It would have been nice to have been informed in advance.

title: Buen hotel a precio razonable.
text:
Escogimos este hotel por las críticas en TripAdvisor durante 3 noches. La experiencia fue muy buena. El hotel es moderno, las habitaciones son cómodas, amplias, limpias y con buen wifi. La situación es excelente si quieres visitar Tribeca o la parte sur de Manhattan. No se trata de un hotel tradicional. Los empleados van vestidos como en Abercrombie, con camisas a cuadros pero son muy amables. El parking es caro, como en todo NY pero ofrecen el servicio. Tienen un restaurante cerca de la entrada pero no lo probamos. Muy buen gel y champú y demás complementos de baño.
La única pega es que no pudimos ir a la terraza pues no estaba disponible.
Recomiendo el hotel para NY. No defrauda y el precio es razonable, no barato.

title: Great Stay!
text: Cool hotel.  Nice big room.  Despite what I read before booking, I found the staff generally very friendly and helpful.  Room service and housekeeping were incredibly quick to respond.  Room very big.  Sounds minor but both my daughter and I were most bothered by one thing.....no full length mirror!!!!! Style over practicality may have been at the forefront of room design decisions.  Just annoying.  Overall though very pleased with the location, cleanliness and details.

title: very good stay in NYC
text:
Very nice stay in NYC, liked the location in tribeca area.  Was a minute or two from nearest subway station.  Also was less than 10 minute walk from 9/11 memorial.
The rooms were very big by New York city standards.  Check in and out was easy and painless.
My only complaint was the small sign out front.  Driving in crowded New York city is not easy and the sign was very hard to see causing us to have to circle the block again to find the entrance and the valet parking.
Otherwise a very good stay and would gladly come again.

title: Review
text: I am usually not picky. but my girlfriend with a high standard really loved this place and she said she would visit again. location was great. we went shopping at soho and bottega in a mall. perfect walking distances to everywhere

title: Quaint Hotel in Tribeca, Needing a little peptalk
text:
Great location--subway is right outside, easy access out of the city, and several attractions nearby. We picked this hotel for this precise reason. Overall, I think the hotel was good, but there were a few things that could have been better. The staff was  mediocre with the exception of the front desk personnel on our last day (when checking out). We arrived on Friday evening at ten o'clock--very tired from our drive and couldn't wait to lay down for a bit, however, the valet was slow, needles to say he was in front of the entrance for awhile and it wasn't until we approached him that he came out to help.  Upon checking in, we were greeted by someone who was not the friendliest but also not the most rude, simply put he was just doing his job and we were just other customers.

In any case, the room was good, clean and provided comfort and it was a good home away from home. I think one of the biggest problems with the room was the AC, It was too loud and I didn't serve its purpose--did not provide ventilation/cool air. Another thing I did not particularly like was the fact that the room only had one robe and even though I placed it on the floor when I was done, the cleaning lady put it back on the hook instead of replacing it with a clean one. On our second day, the hot water was shut off due to emergency repairs on the road. This was out of their control and I understand this, however, their repose when called was " oh sorry, emergency repair we just put a note under your door...". I think almost all interactions I had with the staff were not impressive. In addition to the hotel staff, the restaurant staff was by far the worse. Our waiter took our order, gave us coffee, brought the food out and disappeared. He didnt even ask if we wanted a drink--which we did and did not once ask how the food came out.   I get it, its job and with so much incoming visitors in the city, its easy disconnect from the customers,  but at the end of the day it is important to make people staying there feel comfortable so they can choose to come back. Great customer service goes a long way and could have made our stay a lot better and would have truly made us come back. With this being said, one of the things that made this hotel stand out from the rest was the complementary chocolate and water. It was a nice touch to come back to this after a long day in the city. It is small gestures like this that truly go along way.

title: My Home in Tribeca
text: I wanted an authentic TriBeCa experience. Excellent location. The room was very nice. Low noise from street. We did have hot water issues the last morning of the stay due to some city work outside. The shower didn't have a door so if you are someone who likes steam kept in that could be an issue. Overall I would recommend but maybe give a call and make sure the city is down with their work outside if you are staying there in early September 2017z

title: Stay in Tribeca
text:
Great location .. excellent service .. super helpful staff .
The room was so well insulated from noise we slept like babies .. fantastic for  a Smaller more intimate hotel in NY... comfortable and impeccable service .

title: Beautiful hotel, great location - service lacking.
text: So this is a beautiful hotel and I absolutely love the location, closest to some of my favorite restaurants and bars in NYC (we ate at Mark Forgione and then had drinks at Macao Trading - both were amazing) and shopped in Soho (we were there to shop for my wedding dress). The rooms at Smyth are enormous by NYC standards and very clean, chic and modern. Here is my issue and this is really me being tough on them because it is a luxury hotel and thus the standard must be higher: 1. the people at the front desk are cold and unfriendly. Typically at a nice hotel you get a smile, some travel tips, maybe a cold drink. Our front desk folks barely looked up at us. 2. they don't have a coffee machine in the room and don't offer any kind of complimentary coffee service. I think they told me a pot of coffee would be like 20 bucks. Thank goodness this was not a work trip or I think I would be furious! We were annoyed but were heading to a nice brunch so we skipped the coffee at the hotel. One really positive thing was my friend left a nice pair of diamond earrings in the room and when she called they still had them and held them at the front desk for her. All in all this was a fine stay, amazing location, and huge rooms. I preferred the staff at the Soho Grand though - which is nearby and typically a little more reasonable price wise (plus they greet you with champagne!). If room size and the modern, cool vibe is your thing and you're not a big coffee the second you wake up person -- i highly recommend Smyth.

title: トライベッカを堪能できます
text: 一階に昼はカフェで夜はバーの店があり、トライベッカに仕事で行っていたので重宝しました。朝食のレストランは値段は高いですが、品質も高いです。両方とも宿泊客だけではなく、多くのニューヨーカーが利用しています。その中に自分もいることが醍醐味です。客室はバスタブが無いことが日本人には残念です。しかし、それ以外は最高！十分な広さ、申し分ないインテリア、センスの良いアメニティ。値段は高いですが、マンハッタンの他のホテルと比べると120%の価値があります。

title: Great little boutique hotel
text: This is a great boutique hotel that is walking distance to lower Manhattan.   The hotel experience is great, the rooms are lovely, modern and clean.  The staff is warm and welcoming.  I've stayed quite a few times over the past few years and the Smyth is definitely my favorite when I visit New York.

title: Bring your own makeup mirror
text: It is a small thing but very important to the ladies. A room must have mirrors and lighting for makeup application. The rooms including the bathrooms were dark. There was no magnifying mirror to help out. Otherwise this is a nice property with a very attentive staff. The rooms were good sized for New York. It is very well located for the subway to the rest of the city.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Our 1 night stay @ the hotel was pleasant & would stay there again! The location is good & easy to get around. The hotel offers parking @ a reasonable fee. There's a restaurant & a lounge & also a bar.

title: Lovely Hotel in TriBeCa
text: The Smyth is a lovely upscale boutique hotel in a convenient location in TriBeCa. Close to the Freedom Tower and the National 9/11 Memorial & Museum. Wall Street, New York Stock Exchange, City Hall & the Brooklyn Bridge are all within walking distance. It's easy to go to midtown or uptown on the subway located just on the corner by the hotel. Staff are friendly & helpful. Lots of food options are nearby too. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect-- Will be staying again
text: Incredible experience well beyond expectations. The staff was fantastic and the room was incredible. I've already recommended to several people I know and will make sure my company continue to use this location when we travel for business.

title: Great hotel in perfect location
text:
We stayed at the Smyth Hotel for one week in May/June. The location of the hotel in vibrant Tribeca is just perfect, lots of coffee shops, bars and restaurants as well as the 9/11 Memorial are in walking distance. And the closest subway station is literally next to the hotel entrance.

Our room was very spacious (for a NYC hotel) and spotlessly clean. The staff at the front desk and the doormen were always friendly and helpful. The bar/lounge area is also really nice and a good place to start the night with some cocktails.

title: Killer vibe, awesome location (4.5 stars)
text:
The Smyth is a beautiful hotel. The location is killer, the vibe is spot on and the staff is amazingly friendly and accomodating. If I could give 1/2 stars, I would have rated it 4.5. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and would totally stay here again.

Pros: 
AWESOME location
Fantastic lounge/bar area with craft cocktails
Attached restaurant Little Park's food is amazing
Super comf (and clean) bed
Beautifully appointed room with plenty of space in room and closet
Toiletries smell amazing 
A+ service from staff (front of house and cleaning service), they were lovely
Subway entrance right outside front door

CONS: 
A/C in my room was subpar - it was only high of mid 70s outside, but I couldn't get room cooled to desired temperature...I would hate to be in there when it was actually hot outside
No Sprint service in room
Free wi-fi hotel service spotty, paid wi-fi overpriced
Shower configuration is a mess - it's beautifully done in marble subway tile, but the open design (no door or curtain) meant that even when I turned the shower head towards the wall (which isn't the most comfortable thing in the world) water sprayed all over the bathroom

title: Great Visit for a Special Celebration
text: We stayed at the Smyth, and absolutely loved it! The rooms are clean, bright, and comfortable. Jason, Cristal and Dana at the front desk were friendly, helpful, and provided outstanding service. We will definitely be back!

title: Disappointed
text: This hotel is average. The only reason they can get away with their rates is the location. Very close to Brooklyn Bridge and 9/11 Memorial. The hallways are dark which makes it look dirty. The doors are impossible to open. The front desk staff have no personality. The two doormen were very nice and seemed happy to be there. Then an awkward strange experience with housekeeping. We checked in at 3:00 and went for a quick walk. Got back to the room at 4:30 and someone was in our room because the shades were closed (we left them open) and there was water and chocolates. Why come at 4:30 and do a half assed turn down service. Then at 8:30 this morning house keeping knocked on the door and did not say anything. They knocked a second time (still saying nothing) and opened the door while I was in bed. Who cleans a room at 8:30am and who doesn't announce themselves before entering a hotel room!!?! Only stay here if the price is that of a 3 star hotel.

title: Very good, dog friendly, part of the neighborhood
text: Hotel is in a great location and you really feel a part of the neighborhood.  Plenty of city areas to walk around and the Hudson River/ Esplanade area is nearby just a few blocks.  Plenty of restaurants and bars without the overwhelming hustle of Time Square/ Midtown.  Good size rooms for NYC with nice amenities.  Dog friendly hotel and area of NYC.

title: Very good
text:
In Spanish: La estabcia fue muy buena. Solo sugeriría se arbitren los medios para poner un asa o agarradera en el cuarto de ducha, indispensable para personas mayores como nosotros.
El dieño y confort son, por lo demás, excelentes

title: Front desk very bad
text: Not even a word during night or day.  Not even looking at you when passing by the front desk     Incredible for a hotel !! A lady the first night was helpful and nice. but the other day we passsed and the man not even looked at us ..not even a word or a smile ...

title: Friends weekend
text: We booked 4 rooms for a 12 girl trip to New York.  Hotel was beautiful, clean and we truly enjoyed ourselves!  The beds were comfortable and the staff was very friendly!  We booked 1 king room, 2 king suite rooms and we booked the Thompson Suite.  The Thompson suite was outstanding!  It was big enough for all of us (+4 more so 16 girls total) to hang out in before we went out for the night.  Such great views of the city and in a great location.  Easy shopping access as well!  Very safe neighborhood.

title: Exceeded expectations!
text: Expectations were exceeded at Smyth! I was in town for a girls getaway weekend, and was pleasantly surprised at the beautiful suites. Location is fantastic and within walking distance or a short subway/Uber ride of many attractions and restaurants. The staff was very attentive from the moment we pulled up - carried bags, opened doors, immediately offered water, friendly greetings all around. Accommodations were clean and comforting, a calm retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city! Would gladly come back for another visit.

title: obsessed!
text: Wow!  I was blown away by this hotel.  No detail is overlooked. This hotel is incredibly clean, staff are so nice and very accommodating, the bathroom is modern and spacious, the bed is huge, beyond comfortable and in a city that never sleeps, once inside I heart no noise and slept like an angel. Not to mention the location couldn't be more convenient.  I was close to everything!  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
The Smyth is a great option in NYC, walking distance from Tribeca, Chelsea, Soho, 9/11 Memorial. Overall service was excellent,every person who works at the Smyth were kind and very helpful. Subway station is just steps from the main entrance.
Staff at the hotel were always kind, especially Christopher Shiel, hotel manager who got sure my daughter's birthday was the best ever, sending her a birthday cake.
We booked a Family room, and everything was great, clean and spacious.

title: Bachelorette Weekend in NYC
text: I just spent my bachelorette weekend at the Smyth. There were 16 girls and the Smyth accommodated all of us perfectly.  We made a few last minute upgrades to the rooms to include pull out beds for extra guests. Even though the changes were last minute, the rooms were ready and the beds already pulled out and made! The location of the hotel was perfect, allowing us to walk or just hop on the subway directly outside of the hotel to get to dinner/bars. The biggest surprise was the size of the rooms and bathrooms...for a NYC hotel, the rooms are VERY spacious. There were 3 girls to a room, and we were all able to comfortably get ready.

title: Authentic Tribeca Boutique
text: Prized service and attention to detail make this boutique hotel a must stay. Within a short walk of all essential lower manhattan sites and activities,  the Smyth Tribeca Hotel located at 85 W Broadway, offers up luxurious amenities and top individual service for travellers who want an authentic experience in perfect location at a reasonable price. Dont miss the treatment and experience you will receive at this great Hotel

title: Welcome oasis after a long work day in NYC
text: After a long day on the road and walking around Manhattan, I got to the Smyth and felt "Ahhhhhhh!"  It was clean, comfortable, and I could just go to the Little Park for an excellent dinner.  I had to change my reservations, and I did it all via text with the staff.  This was a HUGE convenience.  Next time I have work in Manhattan, I will stay there regardless how far it is from my meetings, etc.

title: Top 5* service!
text: We have booked this hotel on last minute as we had problem with our reservation at the Conrad. Upon arrival reception explain us that unfortunately booking.com was not close on time and indeed they were fullybooked. So indeed we did not stay there but we would like to mention the perfect 5* service we received by the front desk team compare to the very bad service at the Conrad! Both ladies at the front desk have spent time to call différent hôtels, booking.com, and offer us a drink at the bar! Wahooo! Thank you again for your professionalism! For sure we will stay with you for our next stay in NY!

title: My stay at the smyth
text: From the second i enter the hotel where two lovely men opened the doors wide for me i felt at home. I was so happy with how i was greeted and treated by the hotels Staff. One member of the staff named Diana recommended plenty of activities for us to do during our time in TriBeca. I suggest asking the staff for recommendations, they know the hood. Peace up

title: Run Down and Less Than Average
text: This Smyth has gone down down hill over the last five years,  Punk front desk mamangememt, rundown gym.  The gym feels, smells and looks like one big mold factory.  Dirty.  Unkept.  Average rooms.  No concoerge.   I won't be back.

title: Second stay at this hotel! Love it!
text: Second time to this hotel! I Will not live at any other hotel when i am in nyc. Excellent! The food, service, rooms, everything matched our needs. The bellmans are the most nicest and helpfull and concierge are excellent.

title: Good boutique hotel
text: Good location if you want to be based in downtown, quick access to Wall St but also close enough to TriBeCa and Soho. Hotel is minimalist modern, not too much fuss but it does the work for a business trip. If you are tired of being he usual chain hotels this is a nice change. Restaurant below is excellent as well.

title: Perfect Tribeca Stay
text: We had a perfect stay at the Smyth. Check in was speedy and seamless. The rooms were great and nicely appointed. Our room happened to face West Broadway but we didn't have an issue with the noise. The staff was attentive and very helpful. We love their restaurant Little Park and their bar which you have easy access to downstairs. I wish we had a longer stay but we will be back. It's great that you can use Chase UR points to book.

title: Tribeca Gem
text: The Smyth delivers virtues that become more apparent, the longer you're there.  Service is exceptional - personable, thorough, and thoughtful. Location is in a vibrant, growing area that is exploration-worthy.

title: TriBeCa's finest boutique
text:
Really enjoyed my stay here. Got upgraded to the corner balcony one bedroom suite which was extremely spacious with local TriBeCa loft vibe. Loved it!

The speakeasy behind the lobby lounge is a must! Great atmosphere and great staff

title: Another very nice Thompson hotel
text:
We had been used to going to the Belgraves in London and liked it a lot (see review). 
The Smyth was perfect for our NY stay during the weekdays as it was accessible to both downtown where my wife had meetings and right on the subway line to mid-town where I was participating in a workshop.
Rooms are nice (although NY small), service is excellent (Front desk recommended and excellent Lao restaurtant nearby) and lobby is cool to hangout and get some reading or work done.

title: One of the best boutique hotels in NY
text:
Stayed here for 4 days and was pleasantly surprised. Staff aimed to please and were 
Accommodating, and helpful. Rooms were much bigger than I had expected for a TriBeCa hotel. This place is a gem of you are willing to splurge on your trip. Minutes walk from great food and of course canal street. 
Only negatives, in house restaurant in my view has a very limited menus. And a got a room service charge for ordering a drink at the bar and walking around with it. 1st time I've ever seen that. 
Overall a great experience. As long as you avoid the dinning experience, you will love this place. Almost made it to the top pick list except for bar experience.

title: Great hotel on every count!
text:
This is the third time I've stayed at the Smyth since relocating to LA and it didn't disappoint. Everything about this hotel is great.

From the personal greeting upon arrival, to the well appointed, comfortable rooms, to the room service attendant who asked how my husband was (he joined me on the prior trip), I was struck by the customer-centricity that drives this hotel.

Having experienced the exact opposite elsewhere, I felt like I was coming home upon arrival. These guys do it right. My room wasn't ready so I left my bags with the concierge. When I came back, they had already placed them on a luggage rack in the room - along with a welcome fruit basket! 

This may be a boutique hotel, but it acts like a 5 star one. Being a transplanted New Yorker, it's odd to be staying at a hotel when back in NYC. The Smyth makes that transition painless and has certainly won my loyalty big time.

Bravo!!

title: Unreliable staff, basic hotel facilities
text:
Stayed here while on a business trip, and wouldn't stay there again. 
Hotel is clean & has the very basics. 
Asked for 2 wake up calls one morning  - never got a call (after I chased them, turns out they called the wrong room number!). 
The morning of my hotel departure, I asked them to confirm my driver pick up details, which they didn't do. They said they would follow up, gave them all my details, and they never did. 
Not sure how you can run a hotel in NY like this. 
Won't be staying here again.

title: Very average 5 star  hotel
text: Stayed June 2-4 , 2017. Nothing exceptional - very clean , small and comfortable. I would not call it a luxury hotel, but rather a solid 4 star small hotel. Friendly staff - comfortable beds. We did not have a view ,  I am sure there are some  rooms with a view .

title: Room with balcony was tops.
text: Just stayed three nights at the hotel along with attending a quaint wedding ceremony and reception at the private even room. The atmosphere and service at the wedding was fabulous. Our room that we stayed in was on the smaller size, but with the addition of a walkout balcony it was amazing. Sitting on the balcony enjoying a glass of wine will be a memory that I will charish for some time.

title: TOUT SIMPLEMENT PARFAIT (bis!)
text:
Un des meilleurs hôtels dans lequel nous sommes allés, tout est parfait, les chambres sont superbes, grandes, avec tout le confort et rangement nécessaires, la literie est dingue, la salle de bains magnifique, avec une paroi vitrée opaque sur la chambre, canon, le personnel est très qualifié et vraiment gentil, jeune, souriant, serviable, un rapport qualité-prix sans égal. Tribeca est un des meilleurs quartiers de la ville où séjourner. 
A vraiment contribué à la réussite de notre séjour. Je rêve déjà d'y retourner. 
MERCI SMYTH HOTEL! 
(Si vous voulez plus de précisions, n'hésitez pas à m'adresser un message, je répondrai avec plaisir).

title: Convenient location
text: We stayed at the Symth Tribeca with our married daughter and her husband and three children, They gave us  adjoining and across the hall rooms. The hotel is close to the 911 Museum, Brooklyn Bridge and the Battery and close to the subway-it was easy to get to all sights. The staff is friendly and there are lots of family friendly restaurants nearby.

title: NYC
text: Very welcoming property.   Staff go the extra mile to ensure you enjoy your stay in the city.  Great central location with many options to see.  Staff are very helpful and can direct to many local sites and restaurants.

title: A succesful return....
text: As we found on our previous stay, all was very good. The young angels still run the place, and do a very good job indeed. Can not beat the location, and NYC is the best walking and people watching city in America.

title: I'll be back!
text: So glad to have found this hotel. Room was comfortable and clean, reception staff were very friendly and helpful (opening doors, providing directions, getting cars for us) and food for breakfast was delicious!

title: Amazing stay at The Smyth Hotel
text:
" The Smyth Hotel "
- Amazing experience. 

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying 18 nights at the Smyth's.
Actually we just arrived back to Denmark this morning from New York.

I have to mention the staff. So so nice, sweet, helpful and smiling. And with a sincere smile.

This was our first " real " visit to Tribeca.
 It will not be the last time we come to this area and this hotel.

Rasmus Kock Hansen
Copenhagen, Denmark

title: Like staying with family -- only better
text: Every staff member -- at check-in, at the bar, in the restaurant, and at check-out -- acted as if they'd been waiting all day just to help me. The hotel obviously puts a big emphasis on training staff to make guests feel like VIPs. And it works. This hotel is warm, friendly, not at all stuffy, but extremely disciplined and competent.

title: A lovely hotel
text: The Smyth Hotel is a well located gem in the heart of Tribeca.  A visitor will get their money's worth as the well trained staff is cordial, warm and quite helpful.  My  34 year old daughter and I were very pleased with this Thompson hotel.

title: Boutique friendly hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed for four nights for a city break. The hotel provides good quality accommodation and friendly staff.  It is not a stuffy hotel - has a laid back vibe and is really handy to the Chambers subway station which is an express station.  There are lots of great restaurants in walking distance too.
I prefer to stay in this kind of hotel and neighbourhood compared to the hotels around Central Park and Mid Town which are very impersonal.

title: Clean and modern boutique hotel
text: I stayed at the Smyth Thompson for 3 nights on business and preferred it to the other Thompson property I have stayed at, Gild Hall. The room was spacious, clean and modern with a very large glass enclosed shower which separates the bedroom from the bathroom. The service at the front desk was great. The location is a close walk to the World Trade Centre. I would stay there again.

title: Great stay at the Smyth Tribeca
text: Wonderful stay at the Smyth Tribeca. The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable, the location is fantastic and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would recommend choosing this hotel for your stay in New York.

title: Great Location, Amazing Service
text: Stayed 6 nights for a mixture of business and leisure.  Check-in and check-out were efficient and friendly.  In fact all the staff I dealt with throughout my stay were fantastic.  The room was a decent size and nice and bright.  Comfortable bed with quality linen.  The bathroom was nice and spacious but the water pressure in the shower wasn't great, it took ages to rinse my hair clean.  I would have much preferred to have a proper bath tub but they only seem to be an option in the very expensive rooms.  The one thing that did bug me was the ironing board.  It was one of those table top thingies and skidded around alarmingly when I ironed a shirt. You really need an extra had to hold the thing still.

title: Sufficient for short stays
text: Had a double deluxe room for five nights: spacious, quiet. The hotel's location is great to venture out onto west broadway and surrounding lower manhattan neighboorhoods, short walk to hudson river. The hotel lacks a personal touch, no decorations whatsoever in the rooms (in artsy tribeca!), very minimalistic, but if you're into it... what i found strange was the darkness (probably an attempt at creating a "cozy" atmosphere), you basically have to feel your way from the elevator to your room where you'll struggle to find the slot for your room key. Staff is nice but not in a remarkable way. Didn't try the restaurant, famed for farm-to-table-meals but the menu was pretty basic and very expensive (just the way I like it. Not.) There are plenty of alternatives around the hotel, from low-key diners and delis to more upscale dining options.

title: Great TriBeCa Boutique Hotel
text:
My wife and I had a great NYC stay-cation sans the children at the Smyth. It is a great charming individual boutique hotel perfectly located to explore TriBeCa and lower Manhattan. It's own restaurant Little Park is very good (we've had dinner there before and had breakfast there on this trip) and the hotel is an easy walk to many great classic neighborhood places both new and old like Locanda Verde, Bouley, The Odeon and even simple but delicious falafel joints like Nish Nosh. Plus you're never far from a watering hole to find a strong drink and there's plenty of shopping nearby from the massive Century 21 to many high end little boutiques. And if you want to see some of NY's cultural tourist spots it is very close the 9/11 memorial, Brooklyn Bridge, City Hall, the Financial District and even Chinatown and the Highline Park. 

The hotel itself was very nice. We had a surprisingly large corner room w/ sound proof windows and a nice new modern and large spa bathroom. It was a great little oasis for downtown Manhattan. And we received nothing but friendly and professional service from all the staff we encountered. It was definitely the type of place you look forward to returning to as soon as you leave. We certainly plan on going back.

title: Great time away with the Husband
text: The Smyth was a great hotel! Exceptionally clean, friendly and helpful staff, great location! Rooms were smaller but that didn't bother us at all. We would definitely stay here again. I left my watch by accident and they sent it to me without any hesitations. Honestly, a great hotel!

title: Love this place
text: The Smyth hotel is Tribeca has a great location close to attractions, great restaurants, whole foods a block away, metro right outside the door. It has good size rooms, but really it's the service that makes the difference, it's really great, everyone is super helpful and accommodating. On one of my trips I came in from a redeye and was super exhausted so they were able to give me a room earlier than the usual check in time so I can get some rest. That made all the difference.

title: Fantastic place, fantastic staff
text: We had a wonderful time at the Smyth.  The hotel itself is great, with great rooms in a great location.  Even more, we had a great interaction with the front desk and central reservations.  There was an issue with the initial reservation, and they went above and beyond to help us reconcile the issue.  It was very impressive, and a level of service you don't typically see this day and age.  Great place!

title: Location location location
text:
