The place is located at chambersxwest broadway, close to the best bars and restaurants in nyc.
The hotel was renovated recently, everything is very clean and the bar and restaurant downstairs are very nice, staff is helpfull and friendly.
This is the third time i stay at the smyth, i strongly recomend it

title: A New York City hotel in Tribeca
text: This was my second visit to this sweet boutique hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is relaxed. And best of all, the bedding is soft and cozy! The free internet is awesome and you can connect your phone apps to the large screen television.

title: Girls Trip
text: I was in a solo room for a bachelorette weekend.  The room size was smaller than I expected it to be given the cost of the room.  However, the location was great!  We were close to everything.  However, I think I will look for better value the next time I am in the city (especially if my husband travels with me)

title: Nice area
text: Very nice hotel with large rooms for New York) in a nice place. Close to the World Trade Center and lots of shops. Metro is located right outside the door, which makes it convenient to the rest of New York.

title: A suite mess and a missed flight
text:
I wrote this review as I waited to board a JetBlue flight home at 9 p.m. at a charge of $800. It was supposed to be a Delta flight at 7:30, but I digress, sort of…

Let me start by saying that my last stay at a Thompson hotel was outstanding. So my expectations were high for The Smyth. We booked a King Deluxe for the weekend but the night before we arrived we upgraded to a King Suite paying full price. We arrived at 3 and were greeted very graciously by the doorman as well as the front desk team. Our room wasn’t quite ready and they offered us to revert back to a King Deluxe, which was ready. I wish we had taken them up on the offer.

We waited on the King Suite and after about 20 minutes we were given room 203, a very nice room in and of itself. But, it was also on the floor the Tribeca Film Festival was using as their press floor, two doors down from their press roundtable rooms. Sounds exciting but not really — with no offense to the Tribeca Film Festival personnel who were extremely nice, but who also questioned why the hotel would put guests on that floor given the activity all weekend. Again, Tribeca Film Festival folks - thanks for all your graciousness! You were great. 

The room was well appointed, spacious and comfortable. It was also very clean, until you looked out the two windows, which were also on the same level of the roof to a connected building. It seemed that this was the ashtray/garbage collection area given all the cigarette butts and trash that collected there, as pictured in my review. It was also surrounded by walls and windows of the connected buildings. 

The weekend went on, we kept the curtains drawn and the sounds of the comings and goings of people and gear in the press rooms were relegated to the back of our minds. 

Sunday, it was time to go. Our flight was at 7:30 p.m at LGA so at 5:20, we walked out to grab an Uber. However, the doorman at the hotel said that they could arrange an SUV for $55 and that they would be here in 10 minutes. 10 turned into 15, 15 into 20, 20 into 25. A different car pulls up than expected and doesn’t want to honor the $55. We talk for a few minutes and can’t come to an agreement so I decided to go back to Uber. It is now 6 p.m, 40 minutes past when we wanted to leave. Our Uber arrives and on the way I call the Assistant Front Desk Manager who earlier had sent me an email letting me know that a survey was coming. I let her know there was a good chance we were going to miss our flight because of the car issue and that a detailed review would be coming, but it wouldn’t be good. Long story short, she said she was sorry that it all happened - the busyness of the floor, the dirtiness of the area outside our window, the mistake made with the car -  and that she was willing to give us a free night on our next trip. On our next trip. 

So, we missed our flight, it cost me $800 to get on another carrier and I was offered a free night’s stay on the next trip. But the issues didn’t happen on my next trip, it happened on this trip. Decidedly, there won’t be a next trip to the Smyth. It will probably be the Conrad, the Roxy or any other brand that finds value in their current customers, not the next time they come around.

title: Great stay @ the Smyth TriBeCa
text: Hotel lobby, bar, and dining areas were very nicely appointed, while our room was modern and very clean.  The staff was courteous and helpful. Little Park bar/restaurant had excellent food and craft cocktails while the Evening Bar and lounge area boasts an upbeat and energetic vibe. Nice location to lower Manhattan sightseeing but also within walking distance of many excellent cocktail lounges, nightlife, and dining

title: Amazing Spot in the Heart of TriBeCa
text: I travel a lot for work (and play). The Smyth never disappoints. I've had over 40 nights in this hotel in the last six months and every time the trip exceeds my expectations. The staff are incredible friendly. The rooms are clean, beautiful and very comfortable. The hotel bar and restaurant are delicious and one of the best spots in the area.

title: Style over function
text: While the lobby is an excellent place to meet and have a drink, there is not enough attention to in room amenities and service for longer term stays (3 days or more) They seem to be under staffed. Our room air conditioning was not fixed, the valet "misplaced" my car three days in a row, and the second floor was too noisy for my co worker.

title: April 2017 Visit to the Smyth
text: Very convenient location to the subway and lots of local shops and restaurants/coffee shops. I would highly recommend the hotel. The only negative item was that there was only 1 small hook in the bathroom for hanging our towels. Otherwise, great experience.

title: Excellent hotel, accessible location
text: It’s everything you hope to find in NYC hotel that is fabulous but stays on budget at the same time. It has comfortable, spacious, restful rooms with friendly, attentive, informed and polite service. Right by the subway—I’d stay there any time!

title: Lovely boutique hotel in Tribeca
text: Relatively spacious and well lit room for NYC, convenient location, gracious staff. Would happily stay here again. Did not try the food at the restaurants due to our short stay. Great food options near by. Easy walk to Soho, Financial district. Convenient subway stop.

title: В духе Манхэттана
text: Отличное место расположения - рядом метро, кафе, магазины, ряд важных достопримечательностей Нижнего Манхэттена. Внизу располагает ресторан с очень уютным лаундж-баром и приятной атмосферой. Питание на уровне, персонал нареканий не вызывает.

title: Couples Weekend
text: Great location, clean rooms and lobby, workout facility very nice, staff very helpful. We would definitely stay there again. Brunch at Little Park was very good. Fun neighborhood, within walking distance to hundreds of stores and restaurants.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
We stopped at the Smyth Hotel for a few days break, and had a great time there. The hotel is in TriBeCa, in downtown Manhattan, close to the Financial district and the World Trade Centre site.
The hotel is a boutique style, with a trendy lobby area and nicely appointed rooms; which are plenty big enough, which can be rare in NYC. The beds are huge and very comfortable!
Staff are very friendly and helpful.
Just a few small glitches - the rooms are a little bit style over substance e.g. No door on the shower, and not enough plug sockets in the room, but overall, highly recommended hotel.

title: Le 5 stelle se le sogna
text:
Assolutamente mal valutato. All'arrivo ti chiedono 100 dollari di caparra per notte (personale non proprio cortese), la mia prenotazione su booking non esiste più e dobbiamo aspettare 20 minuti per farci assegnare una camera nella quale manca un accappatoio. L'armadio ha un'anta rotta e la moquette in alcuni punti si alza dal pavimento. Dopo qualche giorno mi accorgo che sulla mia carta di credito sono stati accreditati quasi 200€ dall'hotel, quando chiedo spiegazioni sanno solo dirmi di rivolgermi alla banca, inutile dire che ho dovuto contestare quella transazione e sto aspettando il rimborso dalla mia banca! 
Inutile dire che da un 5 stelle non ti aspetti queste cose.

title: Nice hotel close to 9/11 memorial
text: Stayed at hotel with friends for 5 day break. First time to NYC. Hotel very nice, exceptionally clean, staff very attentive. Our room did not have a great view (a wall!) however we could here a pin drop at night, so quiet and beds comfortable. Our friends had the better view on the street and much lighter rooms, however noisy at night due to traffic. The gym was good (do my husband tells me). Would stay here agsin

title: short stay
text: in general we were very happy in staying at smyth for 3 nights. finding the hotel enterance at a rainy night was the only difficulty as the outside sign is hardly visible - and the noise of the next room was a bit on the loud side..

title: Don't stay anywhere else!
text:
the service was outstanding. Smyth exceeded my expectations in every way!
What an exceptional staff! Rooms beautiful. Everyone so helpful and attentive! I'll be booking Smyth before any other hotel in the future.

title: Smyth Hotel
text: Everyone was very helpful and pleasant.  Did not get to use the bars and restaurant, but they seemed inviting and fun. My room was small but very nice and had a cute balcony to hang out on at night. Really centrally located to what I wanted to do.

title: Wonderful Weekend Getaway
text: Such incredible service and a warm establishment in this big city! Spent an anniversary here in January and The Smyth did not fall short. The reservationist, the bellmen and the front desk attendants were warm, friendly and accommodating. Our room was spacious and even in the dead of winter the balcony offered too pretty a view to pass up.  We were treated as if we were the only guests in the hotel and it seemed as though it was everyone's first priority to make our weekend one to remember. They turned a little weekend getaway into (what I hope will be) a new tradition and what definitely was a trip to remember. Thank you!!!

title: Outstanding Hotel in Great Location
text: We have now stayed at the Smyth several times, and decided to write this review after our most recent visit a couple of weeks ago. The rooms are spacious with attractive updated furnishings. Bathrooms are also large with wonderful walk-in showers. The hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of Tribeca, just a short walk to the Freedom Tower, the Oculus underground mall, and a slew of fine restaurants (one is attached to the hotel). A subway stop for different uptown trains is literally outside the hotel entrance. We have a son who lives in the area & have stayed at other hotels in Tribeca & SoHo over the years. The Smyth is definitely at the very top.

title: The bellmen are the best in the city!
text: Excellent bellman service.  I love how attentive the young men are and their willingness to assist with anything. They are all handsome and extremely polite. My room was not as nice as other stays but still sufficient.  My view was of a brick wall.  I love the gym and the convenience to my office at World Trade Center.

title: Smyth Thompson
text: A downtown boutique hotel in a superb location to my business meetings and to transport with an air of understated quality and chic! The lounge is a great place to sit and relax, to work and enjoy the world go by. The bar drinks are many and varied, the food quality excellent. Staff are attentive and courteous.  I stay here each time I visit NYC and I am looking forward to bringing my family for a leisure visit.

title: A wonderful boutique hotel.
text: Centrally located in Tribeca, service intensive, very well appointed, highly conscientious staff. Very quiet.  Will stay there whenever we go.  The restaurant is great, especially for brunch.  Subway around the corner. Lots of restaurants in the neighborhood.

title: Service Lacking
text: No one to greet car as we pulled up.  No indication of valet service.  Parked ourselves and then hauled our luggage across snow piles on street.  No one to open door when we arrived at hotel...trying to get inside laden with luggage, coats, etc.  Room is small but attractively done.  Frosted glass walls used for bathroom allows the room not to appear so tight...but it is small.  The bathroom is tastfully done with excellent toiletries.  After late Saturday night....10:00am knock at the door.....what was so important? Restocking the mini-bar.  Really???  When we told the front desk, they said they would tell housekeeping.   We could tell they really didn't care.  3 of them behind desk which is about 35 feet front the front door....but we still had to struggle to manage luggage and get the door open because they were doing what ??? Behind the desk.   SERVICE IS KEY - and this team failed.

title: Beyond expectations in TriBeCa
text: I spent my NY visit in this lovely, modern hotel.  The accommodations were simple and elegant and the bed was extraordinarily comfortable.  Wonderfully appointed bathroom and shower.  The Smyth offered an authentic and personal experience from the moment I checked in to the moment I left.

title: Comfortable and Stylish
text: My favorite hotel in the city! Convenient location, fantastic neighborhood. Comfortable and very clean rooms that are stylish, not to mention quiet for a city hotel. The staff is friendly with zero downtown attitude. Accommodate requests and make check in a breeze. The lounge is like being in the coolest living room. You feel very VIP here. The restaurant is also excellent, though service there could be improved.

title: Highly recommended stay!
text: I live in Hoboken, so we never have a need to stay overnight in NYC, but I wanted to treat my mother for her 60th birthday with a night stay in NYC. The hotel accommodations exceeded both of our expectations and I consider myself picky. The area is great for getting around via subway or taxi and plenty of restaurants are within walking distance. I would say one comment, that we were on the 2nd floor and it was a little loud outside - trucks, people, honking, etc. But that is to be expected in a city hotel.

title: Great TriBeCa Boutique Hotel
text: Loved the hotel. Room was very large (for New York). Beautiful and clean with top rate amenities. Bar is excellent as is the restaurant. Staff are very helpful.Location is terrific with loads of great restaurants close by.

title: Quiet Elegance - Great Location
text: We just spent a weekend here, and our stay was quite enjoyable.  Our second time here.  Our room was large for a NY hotel.  It's an easy walk to the best shopping and restaurants.  Very close to subway.  Our room was quiet and very comfortable.  Service was excellent.

title: Quiet room with a fabulous bathroom
text:
The valet was great - we parked in front of the hotel, and they have a service come and pick up the car. Very convenient. The porters at the door are so helpful, and I like that they are not in stiff suits. Unfortunately our room was not ready, even at checkin time. The front desk said we could have a free drink and wait or they would text us. We went out and returned later. 
We wanted a quiet room, so the front desk suggested the suites that are away from the street. Obviously this means there is no view, but we really wanted a quiet and romantic night and have seen the NYC views many times before.  And the room was very quiet. Our room was large, with a little sitting area with a couch and tv. First impression was very stark, minimalist feel. Our favorite features were the incredibly large (for NYC) bathroom and the lovely bed, which was so comfortable. Another high point was room service for breakfast. On time and delicious. 
I would return to this hotel for drinks or meeting friends in the fabulous bar/lobby space - wonderfully welcoming and warm. The rooms have a colder feel, and I felt like hanging some art on the blank white walls. Of course, that's the style, but I wish the rooms were done more like the public spaces.

title: Overpriced and poorly maintained
text:
Although we were 'upgraded' to a bigger room, there was nothing beside an unmaintained ordinary hotel.
Furniture looks like it's falling a part. Dirty carpet and an old closet you don't want to put your stuff inside.
The room maid waked is up twice while entering the room while we were sleeping.
The loony is so dark you always think you got to the wrong floor.
And it's an expensive hotel as at least it was a boutique one.

A great disappointment!

title: Luxury at The Smyth
text: I had a wonderful staycation at The Smyth this past weekend. to was great. Check in was super fast and I loved the room. It was huge by NYC standard. The shower was amazing as well. I loved the movie options in the room to and the amazing Tribeca view. I dinned at Little Park for breakfast and dinner and both were superb! Try the coconut pancakes and fried egg croissant. I also had drinks at Evening Bar and the crowd was chic and attractive. I'll definitely be visiting again. The location is perfect too close to major shopping at Brookfield Place and Westfield World Trade. The service was superb everyone at the front desk was amazing.

title: Great place. Can't wait to return
text: My first time in NYC. Perfect place - comfy, great bathroom, boutique feel, friendly doormen. Valet is expensive $55/ 24 hours with no in/ out privileges. Maybe that is common in NYC, I don't know. Very walkable to Soho and World Trade Centre.

title: The Smyth= Big Love!
text:
I travel to NYC almost every week for work and have stayed at multiple hotels across the city.  As with anything, some places have been better than others and then some are pleasantly memorable. The Smyth falls into the memorable category. I LOVED my stay! 

I was greeted at my car by a very friendly and handsome bellman who opened my door and grabbed my luggage. The desk staff were all smiles and check in was super fast. My room was super spacious, well appointed and felt more like a small apartment than a typical NY hotel room. It was modern, decorated with a mid-century modern vibe, very quiet and super clean. I had floor to ceiling windows (with black out shades) and the king sized bed was super comfortable. I slept very soundly. 
My bathroom was well stocked with great lighting, space for my things, a plush robe, soft towels and lovely water pressure that came from a rain shower.  

Room service was on time and the waiter who brought my food was super friendly. My breakfast and coffee were delicious! I visited the lovely Little Park restaurant the last morning for breakfast. I had an egg white/broccoli frittata, gluten free toast with fresh marmalade and butter, a lovely green side salad and crisp bacon. 

The location of the hotel is terrific and convenient. The Smyth is now on my list of go to hotels and I plan to stay there again the next time I'm in NYC. I only wish I had had more time to enjoy everything the hotel had to offer. :)

title: Great Location, Great Value
text: This is a well run, clean and friendly boutique hotel. It is located in neighborhood friendly Tribeca, close to many good restaurants and bars. The rooms are spacious and modern, the staff (particularly the night staff who I ended up meeting more than the day staff) were friendly and extremely helpful. We enjoyed our dinner at the hotel restaurant on our first night in NY and were very happy with the menu. I would not only stay at this hotel again but would recommend it to anyone looking for a quality hotel at a reasonable price.

title: Convenient to financial district without BEING in the financial district
text: The Smyth offers a comfortably luxurious place to stay when you need to be near the financial district but don't want to actually STAY in the financial district (it's just a few blocks to SoHo). We found the staff very helpful, and Little Park, the restaurant, is quite good (be sure to try one of the seasonal vegetable dishes—they're invariably excellent). If you have to kill some time, the fireplace in the back of the lobby area is the perfect cozy spot.

title: Wonderful stay at the Smyth
text: We were in town visiting a couple of friends and had an amazing time. Beautiful room, the most comfortable bed, excellent service. Try the cocktails downstairs they are outstanding (though pricey but hey, it's New York).

title: Great trip
text:
Friendly front desk, clean rooms, great location. I would definitely come back again and plan on staying at the Smyth again on my next trip for NY. 
Little Park bar experience was really good. Unique drinks, excellent service.

title: Stunning views and giant terrace!
text:
We had an amazing time at Smyth! I had arranged a whole Girls Night staycation for my mother and I and planned a majority of the night around our hotel stay. I knew I wanted a hotel in Tribeca because I love that area and there are a lot of great places to eat, shop and walk around. 

After grabbing brunch at Bubby's, a fantastic place in the 'hood, we checked in at 3:00 pm and were greeted by the ever-lovely Cristal. We last-minute requested a terrace and she made it happen! Cristal also assisted with our reservations for this fabulous show in midtown, that she recommended, and we're forever grateful. 

After going to our room and gawking at the giant size of our terrace (seriously huge for NYC standards) and bathroom we freshened up and enjoyed a couple of Manhattan's in their beautiful, speakeasy-themed lounge. Delicious!! The staff was friendly and we didn't feel rushed even though there was a private event about to start.

Overall, the staff and the beautiful views made this a staycation to remember. We took advantage of the mini-bar before heading to our show and enjoyed waking up to coffee that we sipped on our private terrace. All in all, a wonderful NYC night thanks to Smyth!

We'll be coming back again!

title: Location great, service okay
text: Location was great, but check in took forever and room turn down requests were neglected. Even though hotel knew we had three people in the room, we were waiting until 1130pm for our requested pillows and extra bedding. Overall, an average stay, but great decor and comfortable setting.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel in phenomenal location - highly recommended.
text:
A fantastic weekend at The Smyth. Friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful rooms with top notch amenities. Phenomenal sleep experience - impressed how quiet the rooms were. Relaxed, modern lobby with a quiet sitting / fireplace area and adjoining bar. The location is ideal - in the heart of lower Manhattan / Tribeca. 
Would not hesitate to return to The Smyth.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Stayed for one night at a five star hotel on Central Park. The experience was like chalk and cheese. Smith is clean comfortable cosy quiet with excellent friendly staff lovely rooms and fantastic facilities. Other place cost more and was truly horrible!

title: Great area, exquisite hotel
text: The Smyth was one of the most enjoyable hotel experiences we've had in a long time. Everything was perfect. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and they truly go out of their way to ensure you feel at home and welcomed. Honestly, some of the warmest hotel staff I've interacted with in a very long time. The rooms were large, with great views of the city, and an extremely comfortable bed. The decor was exquisite. Location can't be beat; right in the heart of TriBeCa and also right next to the Chambers Street subway station. We had a tremendous time, and I am definitely staying here next time I come to New York. Totally recommend.

title: Excellent hotel, great location
text: I stayed at the Smyth with a friend for one night and highly recommend.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The room was adequately sized and the location of the hotel is great.  We also had breakfast at Little Park and had a fabulous omelet.  Wish we could have stayed longer to spend time in the bar/lounge.  Highly recommend.

title: Exquisite
text: My husband and I spent 5 days at Smyth and we enjoyed every moment. This is the second Thompson property we have visited and as usual they didn't disappoint. In true Thompson fashion it was modern, sexy, and all in the details. We had a gorgeous corner suite with lots of natural light, views of the city and the most comfortable bed. The night bar was the first stop every night before we hit the town, and our last stop for a night cap. The staff was attentive and friendly. We will be back! We have found out NYC spot!

title: Great modern hotel in excellent location
text: This is a great hotel with a very modern touch.  Excellent location in the heart of Tribeca within walking distance of many great restaurants.  The room was spacious with a very comfortable bed and quality linen and pillows.  The heating/ventilation was very good and quiet.  This is important to me as I am a light sleeper.

title: Great area, cool hotel
text: Staff was always friendly, called to say would be very late in check in, came in after midnightcool and still made up the pull out bed, cool lobby room/bar, good restaurant, nice rooms, umbrellas ready on a rainy day, great in room wifi

title: Great base for Downtown
text:
I have stayed here several times over the last two or three years, and always had a pleasant visit. The rooms are both sizeable and comfortable, with good shower room and all the usual amenities.
There is a really nice bar/lounge area with fire place,, which always seems full and the adjoining restaurant is equally popular.
The staff are all very welcoming and friendly and go out of their way to help whenever required.
The hotel is in a really good location, being only a short walk to the PATH and 911 museum, WTC etc, with Chambers St subway almost adjacent.
Overall, really enjoy staying at this hotel- the lobby area is small and underwhelming but don't let that put you off !

title: Excellent Hotel - Great Location
text:
Friendliest staff and great location. Room service was quick and delicious with generous portions, but on the expensive side. 
Basic wifi was fast enough to FaceTime with no interruptions or issues. 
Best door staff in NYC.

title: Smyth delivers
text: Great experience celebrating my wife's birthday at Smyth. Great room, great service , great location. The staff is totally attentive and goes the extra yard to deliver great service, and always with a smile. Very nice feel to the hotel and the relaxed feel of other guests was obvious. Walked out the door on Sunday morning and great coffee shops on every block. We even had our dog and she was easy to walk in the neighborhood.  Cannot wait to go back

title: Priceline rated as 5 star/really a solid 4 star
text:
started using priceline recently to make bookings. Working out ok, got a great 5 star in bangkok so decided to try it transiting nyc. 

Used the express deal for 5 star w/ a rate accordinglt. For sure this is a solid four star boutique hotel. Actually trip advisor rates it a 4 1/2.

Room decor is minimalist w/ comfortable bed, decent size room. Our room seemed to have had some wear as my wife would not walk in her bare feet as the carpet had some wear and stains actually. 

Downstairs is nice and comfortable lounge area w/ fire place, good looking restaurant althought we just had coffee in the morning. 

At any rate, outside of that satisfactory its just not a five star property as. I probably could hv savedd 50/75usd if i'd picked a lower rated hotel but i wanted to try and see if the express deal on priceline would yield the same great deal i had in bangkok. It did not but that is a priceline issue

title: Above and beyond
text: I travel often and yet I have never posted on trip advisor. I am compelled to write a glowing review of the staff here. It was a long story but for convenience we checked into a hotel in Brooklyn for a girls night as we were going to a concert at Barclays. The hotel was definitely not up to our standards. We walked into the room and immediately walked out. We hopped in the car and booked The Smyth on our way back into Manhattan. The whole experience from the moment we were greeted by the bellman to the second we checked out was completely different and much more enjoyable. The customer service was phenomenal. They understood our frustration and upgraded our room and bought us a round of drinks. They went as far as to call our previous hotel and mediate our disappointment and try to negotiate a refund...we felt this was completely above and beyond;) Our room here was perfect . Nothing over the top but perfect for us...updated, clean, cozy, quiet. Our night was lovely and had a completely different outcome simply because of this hotel and their staff. We live fairly close to NYC and I will recommend The Smyth often.

title: Perhaps my error
text:
First, the service is excellent.   Very personalized and everyone is happy to help with anything you ask about.  Could not ask for more on employee interaction. 
I booked my room through my company's travel site and may have not selected the right room, it was very small.   The last two visits, the rooms were a great size.   If staying, make sure you do not get the base room, especially if there is going to be more than one person staying there.

title: Best boutique in Tribeca in my opinion
text: Lovely and large room.  (An oddity in NY!).  As for the common areas, probably the most cozy fireplace lobby bar I've visited for a long time.  Quiet, restful, perfect area (even right outside a subway station).  Staff is beyond personable - they are like your personal valets.

title: Great location and Hotel
text: Very easy access location. Relaxed but stylish hotel. Great staff and service. Super clean and attention to room every day. Feels like you are in a happening place but it is quiet and cozy enough at the same time.

title: Wonderful property with excellent service
text: The Smyth is stylish, quiet and cozy with wonderful staff, clean and comfortable rooms and delicious food. I love the mid century furniture in the lobby den with the creative gallery walls. Little Park is, of course, amazing as it is an Andrew Carmellini restaurant. I would absolutely stay here again and again.

title: A M A Z I N G
text: During my recent trip to New York, I unfortunately I screwed up the booking on my Airbnb, leaving my girlfriend and I without a place to stay for our last night. Luckily, Cristal and her wonderful team saved the day. We were placed in a spacious room on the 6th floor that had the biggest bed I have ever seen. We left for dinner and when we returned, there were warm chocolate chip cookies and milk waiting for us when we got back! This is an incredible property with a staff to match. Special thanks to Sandy and Ean for helping me so much with my check out process. Great location, beautiful hotel, with an even better staff to run it.

title: Excellent rapport qualité-prix
text: Excellent hôtel chic et trendy. Les chambres sont très spacieuse pour New-York et très bien isolées du bruit. Le personnel est jeune, ouvert et serviable. Nous y avons passé deux semaines à Noël. Nous y reviendrons avec plaisir.

title: Top Notch
text: The location and size of the Smythe rooms is wonderful.  Everything is super clean and the staff is wonderful.  Truthfully on one of my nights I had a horrible experience with the lack of heat in my room and I was quite upset.  But the hotel really rallied.  I had a great experience with the front desk, treats sent to my room and room compensation.  The Smythe did an excellent job of fixing the situation and keeping me a return customer.

title: Great spot
text:
Stayed for a week with husband and daughter in adjoining rooms. Very spacious by NYC standards, rooms spotless, comfortable beds and staff delightful. 

Good spaces downstairs for meetings or just lounging. 

Little Bird downstairs was fantastic for breakfast - try the yoghurt and granola and I understand they offer a great lunch and dinner menu. 

Great location with subway right outside the front door and walking distance to 9/11 Memorial and downtown attractions. 10 blocks to SoHo. 

Would stay again.

title: Perfect
text:
Perfect stay from staff to rooms to views. Was an amazing experience for the second time 
We went for our anniversary and was totally amazed by the modern room decor and the cleanliness of the hotel and our room.

title: Very nice hotel, but 4am party next door was a downer
text: My wife and I came into the city for a night away.  This was our second trip to the Smyth and most everything lived up to expectations, including a great dinner at Little Park.  Hotel and wait staff were excellent, but at 3:30am, a party started in the room adjacent to ours.  When they started playing music, we called the front desk 3:45 to get them to keep the noise level down. While it briefly died down, the music started up again at 4am and continued until after 5am.  My only disappointment was that the hotel staff didn't come back to check and make sure they stopped, nor did they mention anything at checkout.  Not exactly the peaceful, relaxing night away we were expecting, and while not really the hotel's fault, I was hoping for more of a response from the staff.

title: The jewel of tribeca
text: Thanks for wonderful, welcoming staff and superlative hotel design, the Smyth made my daughter's and my trip really special.  Special appreciation goes to Crystal, Diana, and the fellow at the front desk who was so kind to us whose name I regret not getting.  The door guys were fantastic too - nice to my daughter, always there and so helpful.  The design of the room we had was REALLY good, and I am picky.  The rooms feel brand new, but without any kinks to work out - it's already a Tribeca hipster institution.  Can't recommend highly enough!

title: Great room, great location
text: The room was a nice size, modern and very clean.  I love the location, which was not too busy making it easy to grab a cab or Uber to get around.  The staff were very friendly and always looking for ways to make the stay more enjoyable.

title: Very lovely hotel!
text:
Awesome stay! Very friendly staff at the front desk and hotel bar.

Only complaint is the pillows are a bit soft. Drink prices at the hotel were a bit pricey, but the quality was good.

We would definitely stay again! Great location and beautiful hotel.

title: Great hotel in excellent location
text: We just stayed here over the new year, great hotel in a great location next to the metro and a short walk from the attractions.  staff were so helpful and friendly, they organised our new years party for us. couldn't recommend them enough and if returning we would definately stay here again. Also they have a great little bar and restaurant on site which Is chilled to sit in for a beer in the evening.

title: Dr.
text: My recent stay at the Smyth hotel did not disappoint. I was looking for something downtown, modern and with easy access to the rest of the city. I stayed for five days and really felt like I was staying in my own apartment right there in the city. The staff were particularly accommodating, namely Eddie. He is a gem and ensured that  my experience was hassle free (a real feat in NYC), and that I had access to the best restaurants and nightlife (which can also be a battle in NYC). So THANK YOU Eddie, and everyone else there at the Smyth. This is the place you want to be in NYC when you're away from home.

title: Wonderful stay and great location
text: I recently stayed at the Smyth in Tribeca. This is the perfect location for those familiar with the area or looking to discover my favorite part of the city. I didn't see the room product, but the suite was big, featuring lot of natural lighting. Small desk for business, but large dining table and living space. I really enjoyed the extra large shower.

title: Both good and disappointing
text: I used an "average" rating because there was a lot I liked about the hotel - location, helpful staff, reasonable rates, comfortable bed, large marble bathroom - and more.  We did, however, have an uninvited roommate in our shower (see photo).  I realize Smyth can't control every element of New York's underbelly, so I can't be too upset about the presence of a roach.  I was not thrilled, however, when I showed the photo to the front desk and all they said was "ewww".  I later emailed it to the manager after he solicited my comments and received no reply.  Guess they figure I'm not returning anyway, so why bother to address the problem.

title: A Great Option for Lower Manahattan
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Smyth for 5 nights at the end of November.  Overall, we really enjoyed our stay, and I would consider staying at the Smyth again. 

Location: I loved being in Tribeca.  We spend most of our time below 14th Street, so staying in Tribeca is more convenient than Midtown.  There is a subway stop right outside the front door for the 1, 2, or 3.  There are three other subway stops within a couple of blocks that will give you access to pretty much any line you want.

Rooms:  Our room was on the 6th floor.  It was nicely appointed, and the bed was comfortable.  It's a decent size for NYC.

Bar/Restaurant:  We loved the little bar hidden in the back of the lobby.  We only ate at Little Park once for breakfast, but it was very good.  Although there are many bars and restaurants within walking distance, it's nice to have a good option right in your own hotel.

Service: We had an issue with the thermostat in our room, and they attended to it right away.  Unfortunately, it didn't really fix the issue.  Upon checkout, I mentioned that the thermostat still didn't work properly, hoping they could fix it before the next guest checked in.  The front desk clerk immediately apologized and comped our meal at Little Park restaurant for the inconvenience--that was a nice touch.

We had an enjoyable experience staying at the Smyth--great location, nice room, and a very good bar and restaurant.  If I got the same rate for the room, I would stay here again.

title: The B E S T Hotel experience in NYC!!!
text: The Smyth Thompson Hotel won't disappoint! The service was 10 star!!! I'm a difficult girl to please but this hotel experience was exceptional in every regard. Eddie was the go to guy for all thing NYC. He gave us superb tips on where to dine and go for a drink at night. It really was a positive experience! And the in room dinning is delicious!! :)

title: The staff 👌🏼
text: We stayed at Smyth for two brief nights- we loved the location, clean rooms, fireplace lounge and perfect little restaurant / bar on the first floor. The most incredible was Eddie. He remembered us from the moment we arrived until we left- his sincerity in making sure we were comfortable and happy was incredible. Thank you! Ps, the pizza reco was perfect.

title: A Great Place and Wonderful People
text: I stayed at the Smyth for 7 nights... It was great meeting so many wonderful people. Everything was top notch... the rooms, the cleanliness, the restaurant, the staff, the subway is like 10 steps away... This was my second stay in NYC and it was memorable. Definitely recommended 5 out of 5. Thanks guys for the wonderful stay :)

title: Comfortable, nice service
text: It's pretty much as described on reviews here and on their website. We had the queen doubles which were more than adequate. Furnishings are beautiful and beds are very comfortable. Only drawbacks were that breakfast was not included (and nor do they offer any discounts for residents in the restaurant downstairs) and the bar is very expensive. Otherwise location is great and it's on a safe street. Good restaurants within a few minutes walk - we tried distilled, odeon and edward's which were all good. Overall a great stay!

title: Fantastic Staff, Fantastic Service - Above & Beyond Expectation
text:
With just the basics - location, room size/comfort and amenities, the Smyth Thompson in Tribeca is a fantastic place to stay while visiting New York.  I recently spent a week there and couldn't ask for a better spot.  Access to the subway is right outside the front doors and the variety of restaurants, bars and things to see and do (neighbours the new World Trade Centre and the WTC Memorial) made it the perfect spot.  The room was clean and the service fantastic, always checking in to make sure everything was as needed.  The hotel is also very quiet.  The noise of the city never interrupted sleep and the size of each floor is moderate so you are not disturbed by other guests.

Now this is where the hotel set itself apart.  THE STAFF.  All of the staff was fantastic at recommending travel routes, places to dine and the regular fair but this staff went above and beyond in a way I'm not used to when travelling (and I travel a fair bit for work).  They knew me by name.  They knew my dog by name.  In fact, they are a dog friendly hotel and even provided a food bowl and water dish for him in my room.  The staff then went the extra mile to walk my dog for me when I would be away from the hotel for long hours.  Free of charge, simply as being great, accommodating staff.  As I said everyone in the hotel was pleasant and helpful but I have to give a special nod by name to Eddie, Dana and Sandy who regularly interacted with myself and my dog to make our stay the best it could possibly be.

I will definitely be back and I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York for the first time or travelling for work on a regular basis.

title: Loved this low key boutique hotel
text:
Low key and upscale, in a fantastic neighborhood.  Close to many bars and restaurants.  I loved this hotel because not only for the interior but for the location.  I loved that I felt like I was part of the neighborhood, rather than another tourist in Times Sq.
Rooms were average size for NYC, and the hotel is also quite small.  But made it all the more cozy.

title: Nice boutique hotel in a convenient location
text: This place is newish. The rooms are sizable for NYC standard and bed is extremely comfy for my liking. The lounge bar is very cozy.  Ground zero is 5mins on foot. Do check out the Whole Foods which is a couple blocks away. It is amazing! Staffs at the hotel are very friendly. This hotel is really close to everything you want to see in downtown.

title: Lovely hotel in Tribeca
text: I stayed with my husband and son in the Smyth Hotel for four nights. We have been there a couple of times before, so needless to say we really like this hotel. The staff is great and very friendly. The hotel room and beds are perfect and I really like the design of the rooms and the hotel. Feels a little bit like home and that is what you want. Location in Tribeca is nice. It's just a short walk to Battery Park or Soho.

title: Ottimo hotel in una location ideale!
text: Ho adorato la mia permanenza in questo hotel, pulitissimo, camera spaziosa ed elegante( e A Manhattan non è cosi scontato) letto super comodo. Personale molto gentile e disponibile. Tribeca è una zona fantastica, elegante e piena di locali alla moda e ottimi ristoranti. Tra le altre cose, la fermata della metro è proprio sotto l'hotel...questo particolare per me non ha prezzo. Ci tornerò senza dubbio!

title: Great location in Tribecca, Amazing Staff!
text: My group had an amazing time in this upscale, clean hotel. The location in Tribecca is perfect being steps away from a subway station & a close walk to desirable locations such as SoHo. As well, Eddie the concierge was extremely accommodating and helped make our trip a ton of fun!! 5 star service & 5 star location.

title: Great Location/Nice Staff
text: The hotel is ina quite location, the beds are super comfortable, the restaurants is excellent farm to table cuisine, and everyone at the front desk/door are very nice and helpful.  They could use a concierge and a Nespresso maker in the rooms.  If you are going to the upper Manhattan a lot then prepare for the traffic and the added cost. If you are saying in the Tribeca/Soho area its in a great location.  Ground Zero is also in walking distance. The King Bed rooms have a bathroom which has frosted glass and a sliding door (not very private or roomy) so we suggest the larger king room suites or the double rooms if that matters to you. Also make sure you are 6th floor or higher.  Would stay here again.

title: Upscale, comfortable rooms in a dog-friendly hotel…heart of Tribeca
text:
We really enjoyed our weekend stay in this spacious, well-appointed dog-friendly hotel! Often the dog-friendly rooms are not so human friendly.  Not the case with Smyth.  Everything is new and shiney.  Great design.  Really comfortable beds.  Large room and bathroom.   And this was the dog-friendly room!  Plus the staff were completely accommodating to our older labrador and a mix up with our third party booking.

Excellent spot and we'll go back again!  
Thanks Smyth!

title: Sleek hotel in a great neighborhood!
text:
The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street (for NYC) in the heart of TriBeCa, with a subway station right out front.  The hotel bar is warm/cozy with two gas-fired fireplaces surrounded by comfy seating.  Within a 10 minute walk you can get to the Freedom Tower, SoHo, Wall Street, and the Hudson River.  If you are interested in healthy, organic food options look no further than Pain Quotidien, right next door - perfect for breakfast/lunch.

For NYC our room with double beds was expansive - plenty of room to spread out, decent closet space, and best of all - a bathroom that's not tiny.  Big window's faced West Broadway where we had a great view of the Freedom Tower!

The beds were comfy and everything was very clean.  the air conditioning unit was non-intrusive, ie quiet.

We booked online directly on the hotel's website and was able to secure a reasonable rate (again, relative to NYC).  A small clerical error on our room rate was quickly and efficiently addressed.

Having stayed in many different hotels in mid-town, Times Square, Upper West Side, SoHo and the Financial District, we like this location and hotel best!

title: Perfect location
text: The hotel is in the center of Tribeca and very close to many sight seeing MUST SEE. A tube station is just in front of the hotel. Perfect. The service was nice and the staff always in a good mood and very helpful. Very expensive, but maybe that's NY. The bathroom is very nice and the beds are fantastic. I slept heavenly. The Smyth would be my first choice should I return to NY.

title: Back again
text: Pour la deuxième fois je suis retourné au Smyth Hotel dans Tribeca. Cet Hotel est un excellent compromis pour rester en plein cœur de Manhattan sans pour autant être dans Time square. Nombreux restos sympas, tendances et très proche de ground zero. Vous êtes en outre proche de l'Hudson et aurez le privilège d'aller boire un verre devant le petit port le soir au aller prendre votre petit déj devant la statue de la liberté. Chambres très correctes,assez grandes pour New York! à la deco vintage 70. Petit bar sympa à l'intérieur. Éviter le petit dej en revanche car le service est long. Mais vous aurez une multitude de choix en sortant de votre hotel.

title: STUNNING!
text: I stayed 6 nights celebrating my birthday. My King Deluxe room overlooked West Broadway. Great, modern decor and that bed was the comfiest bed i've ever slept in. The staff here are extra helpful and make this place a great Manhattan location. Ca't wait to return.

title: Good location
text: My husband and I stayed 7 nights in October. It is a little over-hyped but we still had a pleasant stay. Very close to a metro station. The room was smallish and the bathroom door didn't close properly. Bed very comfortable. No kettle or coffee maker but there are literally coffee shops everywhere you go when you step out the door so not a problem. Maids would only leave one bottle of water a day when there were 2 of us staying there. I thought that strange - they give you another if you asked. Staff at reception helpful. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it seemed popular.

title: Nice hotel
text: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights back in June. We found the hotel to be clean, modern, and comfortable. It felt like a nice quit separation from the crazy rush of the city. The hotel is conveniently located near the subway, restaurants, bars, and shops. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel has a small hipster vibe. Great place to staff in this area of the city.

title: Weekend getaway
text:
Very nice hotel right in TriBeCa!  Great area and the restaurant has wonderful food and drinks if you can get a table.
The front desk staff is very helpful and the rooms are beautiful and bright!  There was even a big bathtub in my bathroom!  A great way to unwind after a long day of walking.
Anta and Patrick were quick to give helpful tips and were attentive to our needs!  Thank you, both, so much!!

title: Excellent Place, but Some Surprising Flaws
text: We had a generally good experience there, but it's a bit over-hyped. Beds were soft and comfortable, but no coffee maker in the room. We had to ask for one and then got one with paper cups. However, security and service are all good; we were very comfortable for two days. The neighborhood is great, public transportation is right out the door, plenty of food options. A great place.

title: Perfection in a hotel
text: I'm apprehensive to share this hotel with others, as I don't want to let the secret out, but this hotel is perfect. They have found a perfect intersection between luxury and casualness that was just what we were looking for. We felt pampered from the moment we checked in, when Patrick and Abraham greeted us with a warm reception. It felt like were being greeted by friends. The accommodations were perfect, bed was super comfortable, the hotel was classy, clean and inviting.

title: smyth tribeca first rate
text:
Stayed 10/3/16 with my wife for a night away. We arrived early at 1200. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by the bell man , Sandy. He directed us to Anta at reception. Being it was so early for check in we had intended just to leave our bag and go for a walk. Anta checked and informed us we could check in right away. She even gave us a choice of rooms. WE could be upgraded to a king deluxe or take a smaller room with a full balcony. We opted for the balcony. Sandy offered us water and accompanied us to our room where  he showed us around and then onto the balcony. It was a good choice as it seemed we could touch the WTC. It had 2 chairs and a table for relaxing. The views could not be beat. Sandy was very friendly and knowledgeable.  He gave us advice on where to eat and what to see. He even provided complimentary wine in the afternoon to enjoy on the balcony. The next day Anta was kind enough to let us have a later check out. 
  We are native New Yorkers and have stayed at many hotels uptown. I have to say that Sandy and Anta are probably the most pleasant hotel employees I've dealt with . Good job.  The Smyth is ideal for exploring Tribeca. Multiple dining choices within walking distance and things to see. Our room was small, Anta warned us, but the balcony made up for it. It was fine for the two of us for one night. The bathroom was large with a large walk in shower. An excellent stay and will be back.

title: Great location. Friendly Staff. Service Issues
text: Located in a great neighborhood with the Chambers Street Subway stop directly outside, the Smyth was pretty good overall. The hotel is beautifully decorated and manages to be modern yet warm. Every staff member I interacted with was very friendly and eager to please. HOWEVER, my room was not cleaned at all during my stay. I'm a late riser (out by 10:30/11am most days) but always remove my DND before I leave and expect my room to be cleaned when I return in the evening. Even after bringing it to the desk's attention, it happened again the following day. An email I sent prior to arrival with a few requests also went unanswered. Not acceptable for a 5 star hotel.

title: Great location and very comfortable beds
text:
We just spent a night there. The hotel is very well located in TriBeCa. Lots of restaurants and cocktails bar around. 
The room is nice but not amazing especially when you look at the price tag for a night.. The decoration could have been a bit worked, white wall no painting or wall decoration. The bathroom is very nice. Most important the bed was very confortable and the room quiet. 
Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would come back again.

title: На стиле!
text:
В этом отеле останавливались на 1 ночь, понравилось все от ресепшена и выше-))
Мгновенно заселили, легко и непринужденно ответили на все вопросы, помогли со всеми нюансами-)
Номера стильные, ультрасовременные, добротный завтрак с хорошим выбором европейских блюд. 
Вцелом, рекомендую, здесь оптимальное сочетание цена/качество.

title: Not bad but not 5 star
text: Booked room blindly via PriceLine. Was listed at PL as 5 star property but while not bad, I certainly wouldn't put it in the 5 star category. Perhaps with room booked via PL I didn't get one of their better rooms, but 8th floor room overlooked roof or adjoining building. A/C wasn't cooling room and after two visits from maintenance I gave up. Hallway common areas were just that - common. Had I not gotten a 'deal' I would have been even more disappointed. I DID enjoy area but would book elsewhere if I was headed back to Tribeca.

title: Great Birthday Weekend Stay
text: My husband and I stayed at the Smyth for a long weekend birthday celebration.  From the moment we arrived the staff couldn't do enough to make sure our stay was top notch.     My husband and I travel quite a bit and would put the professional and friendly staff at the Smyth up against any five-star hotel.  The hotel itself is in a great location and exceptionally designed and maintained. The room was absolutely incredible.  Special thanks to Mark who really helped us out with our bags and anything else we needed for our room at check-in and check out and Scott for making sure our stay was perfect.

title: Great style, HORRIBLE wifi, and No Service for AT&T mobile
text: Look, this is a great hotel, stylish, great common areas and rooms. HOWEVER, I have stayed 3 times, and the wifi is almost nonexistent in the rooms. If you use AT&T mobile, be prepared for little to No Service. This is a shame because the hotel has a terrific friendly staff, and the rooms are nice.      But lets face it, without a wifi remedy, I can never return. Thats a shame.

title: Au calme
text: Pour moi le meilleur emplacement à NY, loin de la cohue de Times square. Très bien desservi par presque toutes les lignes de métros, les chambres sont spacieuses modernes, et le personnel de l'hôtel est adorable et performant.

title: Brilliant Hotel
text:
The hotel is in a good location and staff is extremely helpful. 
During my stay I only had an issue with people who were having a party in the room next door and the staff advised them several times to keep music volume down (party finished at 4am).
With the exception of this problem that occurred in one night only, the experience was really good

title: gute Lage, leider ziemlich hohe Preise
text:
Liegt in absoluter Laufnähe zu Ground Zero, dem neu erbauten One World Observatory, Battery Park, Fähre zur Liberty und Wall Street. Viele kleine nette Restaurants und Läden in Tribecca. Das Personal war immer sehr freundlich und aufmerksam.
Einziges Manko, sämtliche Türen auf unserer Etage waren "verzogen", das heißt, man hat die Türen nur mit Ruck zubekommen, konnte also sagen, wann die Nachbarn nach Hause gekommen sind ........

title: Beautiful neighbourhood, lovely hotel
text: Tribeca is a beautiful neighbourhood. It has a real homely feel, a place where people live rather than just visit. After the devastation of 9/11 it is regenerating with lots of independent cafes and bars. This hotel is in the middle of the area.  It is a quiet, classy joint, with excellent staff. Only negatives: inconsistent housekeeping - never quite sure what will be left and what time the room will be done, and the complimentary water policy you - we were nearly charged for $70 worth of 'Fred' water, which is not complementary. As the check out invoice is not itemised, we only discovered this when the $100 bill was queried. However, issues were amicably resolved and hopefully the hotel's policies and invoices will be more transparent in future. Overall however, just a blip in an otherwise great experience.

title: Great people, service and love the new look
text: Haven't seen the hotel since it's renovation, but, boy what a great job. Love the lobby sitting area, the lounge in the back and the rooms are great.  Had a great week stay, slept well, shower was great and room so clean.  Enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant each day.  Loved the beverage program too in the lounge. Bartender was fantastic.  You should check this place out.

title: Perfect location.  Fantastic service.
text:
Spent a short weekend in NYC for our 20th anniversary. This day was made special by this wonderful hotel.  The location was excellent. It is in the Tribeca area very close to the Soho shopping district.  It was also a short ride to Broadway. 
I would especially like to acknowledge Gianni for his warm welcome and great suggestions.  We will be back and will make this hotel our destination.

title: Weekend in the city
text: Great experience. Started when we got to the city earlier than planned. Called and the staff happily tried to get a room early but were unable to but allowed us to drop our bags when we there( we were getting there very early not just an couple hours). We walked around the sites close to the location which is a lot( 9/11 museum, the 9/11 memorial, and Wall Street to name a few). The location was great(Tribeca) with many things in walking distance and the subway steps from the front door. We got back before check-in and the staff worked and got us in a room early which was wonderful. The room was great comfortable bed, bathroom was great, and the view was good which is not always possible in the city. Restaurant ( Little Park and Evening Bar are great (recommend the No. 9 at the bar). Janior ValleI will stay here again and have friends stay as well. I hope that the management reads this because the the staff was equal the best anywhere. Everyone from the desk staff, bell hops, and housekeeping was amazing.

title: Amazing FOH employees
text: Greeted warmly on our arrival. Arrived early and room wasn't ready but that was expected. Was able to leave the bags and go shopping around town. Once room was available the check in was fast and efficient. Front desk realized it was my birthday and wish me a great time and stay. Room was clean, a/c was perfect and bed was so comfortable. Couldn't ask for anything more!! But more I received....I was asked to answer the door and there stood both front desk staff with a birthday cake and they sung me Happy Birthday. That little touch of sincerity set this hotel apart from other hotels. It was so nice of them and just started my evening off great. Thank you very much Smyth Hotel.

title: Great boutique hotel in TriBeCa
text: I had never stayed at the Smyth until work suggested it (my office is downtown). The Smyth is a small hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The beds are comfortable, and the food from their restaurant is excellent. Breakfast was a joy in my room. The room rates are quite reasonable for New York.

title: Great Hotel with Excellent Staff
text:
I made a quick trip up to NYC for a baby shower.  Throughout the whole process, the feedback and service from the staff at the Smyth were excellent.  I am a bullet point person so forgive me if you appreciate paragraphs.
1. Text updates were sent to my phone to keep me informed of my upcoming reservation with plenty of options to customize my stay
2. When i got there the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming
3. My room was great with lots of minibar options!!!
4.  I forgot my phone charger and i ran into a staff member on the elevator; she asked how i was and i was telling her great, but i was going to go buy a phone charger.  She said she had one at the front desk and she would bring it to my room.  When i got back from visiting with some friends, the charger was in my room! Awesome.
5. The bar staff was nice and they have a great bar selection!
6.  I wanted to have a late checkout and when i asked the front desk, even though they were full, were able to extend my checkout time.

Overall i had an extremely positive experience!

title: Wish I could give more than five stars!
text:
Wow!!!! Just returned from four nights at The Smyth and we want to go back! 
From the minute we walked in we were made to feel special. The customer service was second to none, Diane checked us in and made us feel welcome. 
Our room,709, had lovely view onto West Broadway and amazing view of downtown, including 1WTC. Our room was opposite the elevator, which was wonderful after long  days walking and not a problem with noise. 
It is a quiet hotel both from the inside and out. 
Clean, very comfortable room, lovely bright bathroom, great bed, well maintained. 
A special mention to Patrick, so friendly and helpful to us!! 
The owners and management of both The Smyth and The Gild Hall should be proud of their staff!! The best we have come across!! We will be back!

title: Love the bar scene!
text: The bar at the Smyth is my favorite in TriBeCa. I always grab a cocktail here before dinner. The sexy bar in the back has a cozy feel with a beautiful fireplace and the barmaid makes the best drinks. I appreciate how they switch up their cocktail menu every few months. We had a small gathering for my birthday party and the staff did a fantastic job ensuring our glasses were never dry!! This is the hidden gem of TriBeCa!

title: Long weekend in city
text: Great nondescript front that you could easily miss, this is a good thing. Staff was great, they truly seemed to care and enjoy their work. They helped with all the things that we asked for. Location was a plus, we walked to most of the land marks in lower Manhattan. The red line is feet from the doors of the Smyth, giving you easy access to the rest of the city.  This is a hotel that doesn't need a giant neon sign to deliver. Low key and professional. We loved the location and service. Trying to think of a reason no to stay again but I can't.

title: Nice quiet hotel nice neighborhood
text:
This hotel was so quiet I almost forgot I was in NYC.  The staff are friendly.  The rooms are clean.  There is no view but we didn't need a view.

Rooms ending in 01 and 02 are away from the elevator and other rooms.

There are 2 bars in the hotel.  One is in Little Park which was a very nice restaurant.  The other one is almost a little secret.  

There is a lounge on the other side of the lobby that is also quiet and secluded.  We really enjoyed getting a drink in the quiet lounge after a long day in NYC.

The TriBeCa neighborhood is also less noisy than midtown.  There is a Whole Foods grocery store right around the corner and it is a short walk to SoHo and the World Trade Center.

title: Interesting stay
text:
The rooms at the Smyth are clean and well appointed.  The platform bed was surprisely comfortable.   We enjoyed the "speakeasy bar" bar off of the lobby it was  very cool with great drinks.  The hotel is within walking distance to ground zero and many subway stations. 
I caution parties traveling with family or friends as Bathroom privacy may be an issue with the room we stayed in.  The door on the bathroom is a barn style pocket door that gaps so you can easy see and hear everything in the bathroom.  In addition, the shower is shaded glass that is visible from the room. You can clearly spot an image male or female in the shower.  I bring this up as it could be a very uncomfortable situation for some guest traveling together.  
I should also mention as part of the mini bar you can choose from two sex boxes complete with condoms, whips and bondage items.  There was a cheesy factor to this room  leaving me to question if this hotel is catering to a couple seeking a one night stand?  I don't think I'm hip enough to stay here again.

title: good location , amazing corner
text: i used to stay at the smyth all  the time i'm in manhattan, it's very good for subway, restaurant, laundry, breakfast , walking along the river or in the cozy area , everywhere you go to; it's fashion as much as it's usefull

title: Convenient and Comfortable
text: The Smyth is my go-to spot in Manhattan, having stayed there four times or so over the last couple of years.  It's quiet, convenient, and the service is top notch.  The rooms don't feel like a huge sacrifice for space and are comfortable.  The bar(s) downstairs are great on their own and the lobby is a nice oasis while waiting for your Uber, friends, etc.

title: It's the Staff... always the staff!!!
text: We just came back from five days at this excellent hotel in Tribeca.  Management should be proud of the staff, each of them, including the restaurant, because they are the reason we will go back. We can find a good hotel anywhere in NY, but the staff made such a wonderful impression on us. We felt going back home after a long day. Always asking about our day, always smiling to us and asking about anything we needed. About how beautiful a hotel is can be  checked their site. But the soul of a hotel  is the staff, and the staff attitude is what matters in the end for a successful business. Congratulations to each of them.

title: Great customer service!
text:
The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating. The room was great and so was the bar. We have a 16 month old and the staff was very helpful. The location is perfect if you want to hangout in Tribeca. I highly recommend it and I will return. 
Christophe.

title: Good all round hotel
text: Great location. Staff great.  I travel a lot and in NY love staying outside main tourist areas.  Tribeca is a  great area.  Hotel is relaxed,  good restaurant and bar.   Can sometimes be a little pricey so look for deals.

title: Summer Weekend
text: Staff is fantastic from top to bottom.  Couldn't ask for more for twice the price.  Rooms are NYC small but comfortable.  You got to live out of your suitcase because little closet space and no drawers or shelving.  It is perfectly located downtown and subway is at the corner.

title: 4 gg a NYC
text: Partiamo dall'unica nota positiva, il posto al centro di SOHO, per il resto tutto brutto, sporco e approssimativo, colazione da incubo con personale poco professionale, come il resto del personale, lo consiglio solo ed esclusivamente per chi vuole vedere la zona.

title: Summer trip 2016
text:
We were so pleasantly surprised by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff 
My daughter and I had a blast in NY much to do with the Smyth staff.Ty. We will be back.  They helped us with theatre tix and tix for Empire State Building.  C
I would recommend this hotel to anyone for business or pleasure

title: Go to hotel in Manhattan
text: The Smyth is downtown and is a boutique hotel but a great atmosphere for working people as well.  I am here on average 2 x a month and have stayed close to 50 times.  They make you feel welcome when you arrive and the staff are all friendly, professional and helpful. The restaurant Little Park is great but also can order in or walk to lots of other great spots.   A quick coffee or breakfast are adjacent at starbucks or Le Pain Quotidian.     Unlike other nearby boutique hotels the staff does not leave you with the impression that they think they are cooler than the guests or that the hotel is too trendy for families and business visitors

title: 5 star quality and service hotel with a smart casual and inviting enviroment
text:
We stayed 4 nights so we could thourghly enjoy not only the very comfortable room with a bed made for great sleep followed by a an excellent morning shower, but also the other facicilities at the hotel. The first night we had a light dinner at Little Park restaurant where we enjoyed excellent pasta dishes, but we also took advantage of their outdoor seating for a last day lunch.We were four adults of different ages so the lounge off the lobby was a great place to meet up for a drink before dinner or relaxing with a  beer between outings. 
The location is excellent near a subway stop for easy transportation to the top sights  but also walking distance from several great restaurants like Locanda Verde and the Laughing man Coffee shop or morning bagels.
Tribeca offers a calmer location with its lower buildings and small green areas away from the masses near Time Square and midtown.

title: Amazing Service at Smyth Tribeca
text: From the moment we arrived at the Smyth, Everyone went above and beyond to make my experience wonderful. The room was lovely, service was beyond perfect and the location was great.  I would highly recommend the Smyth Tribeca in New York.

title: Great tribeca area...comfortable
text: I stayed with my parents in a mid-sized room in facing towards West Broadway, we wanted to try something else than midtown, and I can say the hotel is located in an awesome area with tons of restaurants nearby and three blocks from the 9/11 memorial. The part I enjoyed the most was the restaurant next to the lobby, the Little Park is a delicious gourmet style restaurant offering great choices of fine dining.

title: Smyth - a relaxed space
text: The hotel is in the best location in TriBeCa. There is a very residential feel to this hotel. Quiet, calm, nice place in the middle of a busy city.  The staff is fantastic - genuinely friendly and helpful. The lobby and bar are very relaxed - great place to have a drink after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. The room was a reasonable size with a pull out sofa for the third person. Everything was very clean, the room, the bathroom, the bedding. Walking distance to great restaurants and shopping.

title: All I can say is Wow!
text:
Wife and I wanted a Saturday evening in NYC and his seemed like a great choice based upon what we saw on Trip Advisor. We checked in with Diana and Gianni who couldn't have been more helpful explaining the services available at the hotel, along with answering our questions around some of the places nearby.  

The room was beautifully appointed and the quality of the in room amenities was first rate. I can best describe it as cool and comfortable. After an evening of exploring the area, we retired to the room and got a great night's rest. Regrettably, we had to leave fairly early the next morning, and Gianni and Jacky assisted us on our way out.  While it was brief stay, it was certainly memorable. 

I just wish we could have stayed longer. But we'll definitely be back.

title: New York Trip
text: Clean, comfortable and with very nice staff. Room was acceptably sized, especially for NY which are notoriously small. Easy for one..might be a little tighter for 2. Staff was exceptionally nice. I will stay here again if given the chnace.

title: Great tribeca location and food!
text: Stayed there on valentines day weekend and was upgraded to a king room and greeted with welcome amenities of chocolates and roses. Food from Little Park and room service was excellent and quick! Great views of the World Trade Center, but would prefer to stay on a higher floor next time.

title: Buen hotel cerca de Wall Street
text:
Habitaciones cómodas, cama confortable, buen baño, personal muy amable, bien ubicado.
Tiene en PB un bar - restaurante muy bueno para desayunar o cenar al regresar de tu dia laboral. En la zona a distintas opciones para comer con distintas opciones de precio.

title: Great Visit. Nice hotel!
text:
We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel didnt blow us away, but for NYC standards it was excellent. We had a king deluxe room and it was very spacious. Bathroom was huge, shower was good. Free newspapers daily at your door. the staff is incredible. Friendly, without the tiniest bit of NY attitude. Just really helpful and nice. 

One thing I couldn't stand- there were no full length mirrors in the rooms. Not one! When people leave the hotel for the day, or are getting ready to go out for a nice dinner, they want to see what they look like. It was a tad frustrating to have to go down to the lobby to see yourself in the long mirror.  Other than that, a good stay!

title: Great TriBeCa Hotel
text:
Just finished 4 nights at the Smyth for business. Overall it is a great hotel for those people not looking to stay in the heart of shopping and tourist districts. 

Location wise you are in the heart of TriBeCa with several great restaurants and cafes minutes walk away. Meatpacking and the Financial District are all very close by. Subway directly outside the hotel. The one thing to point out is that it is up to 30mins away from midtown and Central Park by taxi so for anyone looking to shop or see the big touristy sights the location isn't the most convenient.

The rooms are well appointed, modern and spotless. You do get less for your money in terms of size relative to older hotels in mid town but what you get instead is a room with significantly less wear and tear. Service is also very good given the smaller size. 

Food from the restaurant attached to the hotel is very good (the burger is excellent) although on the expensive side. 

The gym was clean and usually empty in the afternoons. Plenty of cardio equipment, bit lacking on the weights side. AC wasn't great, it was like working out in a sauna.

title: Excellent Hotel in an intersting neighbourhood
text: The Smyth is a medium sized hotel in a purpose designed building in Tribeca.  It is within walking distance of the major sites in lower Manhatten (Wall Street, World Trade Center etc).  The hotel is well managed, the rooms spacious and comfortable and the hotel bars and restaurants very welcoming.  Good for both business or tourism visits.

title: Bellman Jacky Chen
text: This hotel is spectacular. I was there for my daughter's wedding reception. The service and hospitality from the moment we arrived to the moment we left was outstanding and topped anything I have experienced and  I have stayed in the top hotel around the world. The rooms are very spacious, spotless clean, the food at the wedding reception was superb. I especially want to single out bellman Jacky Chen. He went above and beyond what is expected to help us with all of the luggage and supplies we had for our event. The best I have ever experienced. He even tried to return a generous tip I gave him upon leaving the hotel. Jacky said it's my job and I love helping people. A treasured employee who should rise up in the management of a hotel or hospitality organization. All around a 5star experience.

title: Another great stay at the Smyth
text: Another great stay at the Smyth. Great location, very friendly staff, comfortable rooms, clean and fresh. Will definitely stay there again. Big shout out to Patrick & Jackie for all your assistance and recommendations.

title: Service, Food, Location - The Best.
text: After a long and early flight from Las Vegas and a challenging taxi ride from JFK, all I wanted to do was crash in my room. Checking in with Diane was a breeze, my bags came with me. Sandy, the bellman, came with extra water and a fruit without waiting to be asked. The room is a good size, comfy beds, large bathroom and nice amenities. Soft and thick bathrobe. I had dinner at the Little Park, and the food was beyond expectation, the service was impeccable, solicitous but discreet. The Smyth is a short walk t to the 1 World Financial Center; the 9/11 Memorial;  the World Trade Center transit hub designed by Calatrava, where the Oculus takes your breath away. If you don't want to go to Soho for shopping, the C21 store and boutiques are a few blocks away. The bellmen, especially, Patrick, can answer your questions about Manhattan, where to go, what to do, etc. This is my second time to stay at the Smyth and will go back again.

title: Buon hotel ma nella media
text: Ho soggiornato per tre notti in questo hotel, le camere sono belle, spaziose, pulite e con un fantastico bagno. I prodotti da bagno molto buoni ma non mi sono stati cambiati tutti i giorni. L'accoglienza del primo giorno è stata fredda e distaccata per migliorare poi nei giorni successivi quando il personale è cambiato ed abbiamo trovato persone gentili e cordiali. Considerando quanto ho pagato mi aspettavo di più

title: Very Cool Hotel
text: Very new and stylish, nice amenities, comfortable bed, great location in Tribeca. Top notch service on all counts. Very friendly staff .. Patrick at the door was always smiling and helpful. We even extended our stay by a few days.

title: awesome stay
text: I recently recommended friends from Toronto to stay here on the second weekend of May.  They booked to rooms and totally fell in love with the hotel and it's surroundings!  They also wanted to acknowledge Adriel-Luis, the hotel engineer who went out of his way to recommend what lower Manhattan has to offer. Thanks for making them feel welcome!

title: BEWARE - This hotel will charge you twice and will not refund you the full amount
text: I had a pleasant enough stay at the Smyth however events after my stay have really overshadowed my experience. I booked through Expedia and paid in full prior to my stay. The Smyth charged me twice at the conclusion of my stay. Having read other reviews, I see I am not the only one. I have sent numerous emails seeking a full refund each of which has gone unanswered. Appalling customer service and I won't be staying there again. I am still waiting for my full refund.

title: Really stylish hotel - great location
text:
Really nice boutique hotel with large stylish rooms
Staff were very helpful and friendly
Metro is literally outside entrance door so perfect ! 
Room was huge with ultra stylish bathroom 
Recommended!!
Even sent up birthday cake and complimentary wine to celebrate 50th
Walkable to Freedom Tower and discount clothes emporium Century 21

title: 4 Splendid Days
text: My son and I stayed for 3 nights, and we were very pleased with the hotel. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was good and the bed linens were fantastic. We didn't eat here, but the bar in the rear of the hotel was nice. Comfy chairs, good service. In general, the staff was pleasant and accommodating. We arrived at 9:00am after an exhausting morning of travel and they checked us in right away. One employee, Patrick, was great. Super friendly and upbeat. Each night he gave us wonderful restaurant recommendations, secured tickets for us, etc.  I would stay here again.

title: What's not to love?!
text: My sister & her now husband were married in the hotel. Many of her friends and family stayed in this hotel during the days around the wedding. Staff were all friendly, accommodating, polite and educated (meaning properly instructed how to treat guests). Rooms were clean and classy with bottled water and chocolates provided for guests. We found the hotel rooms to be very quiet and beds were supportive and comfortable.
