The downstairs lobby was the perfect place to meet friends, have a coffee (Starbucks & other coffee shops just a block away), people watch. The wedding venue was warm & inviting and again, service and food was impeccable-highly recommend if looking for a wedding venue in the city.

title: Charged me twice.
text: The place is nice enough, not the greatest hotel I've ever stayed at but this is New York City so my expectations are pretty low. The desk staff was nice and accommodated my room request, I had a view of the freedom tower instead of a windowless room. The problem was when they double charged me. I paid for the room on priceline then the hotel charged me as well. I would have gladly paid the hotel's rate since it was less than I paid online, but I really only wanted to pay once. When I challenged this charge with American Express the hotel responded with a signed copy of my folio. Yes Smyth, I did stay there and sign the folio, nobody ever challenged that. I did however already pay you too. It took 2 months to straighten that out.

title: Lux Lifesavers!
text:
I can't say enough great things about the Smyth in TriBeCa! I actually arrived for a business trip at a boutique hotel down the street... only to be given a TINY room just over the lobby, where they were hosting a loud restaurant re-opening party... plus the windows were so close to street level and the room so small, I could literally see the meals that folks were eating across the street from the SHOWER. 

Enter Smyth to the rescue -- completely stressed about my huge presentation in the morning (and after that hotel refused to move me to a more private room), I called The Smyth and they seriously saved my life! Not only did they accommodate me right away, I arrived and they gave me a BEAUTIFUL SUITE for the cost of a basic room, simply because they felt so bad about my situation. I was able to work in total privacy (with room to walk around and practice my presentation!), order late-night room service from the delicious restaurant downstairs, and get a great night of sleep. The next day I booked two more nights to give them the rest of my business and again was offered a beautiful king suite at the cost of a basic room. This is the kind of hospitality that makes me a customer for life, which I now definitely am!!

Aside from the amazing customer service and kindness of literally every hotel staff I came into contact with -- from the doormen and front desk staff to the room service deliverers -- the hotel is gorgeous and outrageously comfortable. The furnishing is modern and warm, the beds are luxurious, rooms impeccably clean. It's on the same corner as one of the Chambers subway stops, and I also got taxis easily. As a single woman traveling alone, I felt safe and completely taken care of through my entire experience. 

THANK YOU, Smyth! You seriously have my business for life, and will become my company's recommended spot for all future Manhattan travel!!

title: Amazing stay!
text: We stayed with my husband for 4 nights from the moment we walked in we felt welcomed. The hotel has a cool chic decor . We arrived early and we were waiting for our room. Frank the hotel manager greeted us and upgraded our room to a king suite, free of charge. The room was huge and spotless. In the evening Patrick the doorman was amazing, friendly and very patient while we made a decision what restaurant we wanted to go for dinner. He was able to get us reservation to Vandal apparently an it spot in the area. The last night we went for drinks at the cool lounge in the lobby. We loved our stay this will be our new hotel in the city

title: TOUT SIMPLEMENT PARFAIT // SIMPLY PERFECT
text:
J'ai tout simplement adoré mon séjour (4 nuits) au SMYTH.
Tout y est bien pensé. Déco, aménagement, parties collectives aussi bien que chambre, jusque dans les moindres détails. Génial l'idée du partenariat avec FRED (la bouteille d'eau qu'on n ejette plus) ou encore le Shave Kit HARRY's... plein d'exemples de ce même genre. 
Et, surtout surtout un accueil au top, avec une équipe très "nice, cheerful and extremely helpful", notamment Patrick mais aussi les autres, dont j'ai oublié les prénoms ooops.
BREF : je recommande à fond !! Ph.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Lower Manhattan
text: Spending a night in the city, my girlfriend and I opted for the Smyth Hotel as we never stay downtown and wanted to visit the 9/11 museum which is just down the street from the hotel. We pulled up  on a busy Saturday afternoon and were warmly greeted by Patrick, who made valeting the car and getting our bags a pleasure. Patrick escorted us in and stayed with us until we were given our room keys. He offered tips as to transportation uptown that evening and even suggested a "happening" bar near the theater where our show was playing. When we checked in, we were given a room on the 4th floor. As we rarely stay in NYC, we wanted a higher floor with a view which the front desk staff accommodated immediately, moving us to the 7th flr above the adjoining rooftops. The room was spacious and well appointed with all sorts of cool extras like a Harry's razor and "adult" pleasure pkg for purchase which we didn't buy but had a good laugh about even as it set the right mood for the evening. The A/C wasn't working correctly and Tim, the maintenance man on duty, showed up w/in minutes of being notified with a smile on his face and fixed it quickly (it just needed to be reset.) We had a delicious late night snack in the sophisticated lounge off the lobby and a fabulous brunch at The Little Park Restaurant attached to the hotel. Make a reservation because it draws a good crowd starting at 11am. Gianni and Aissa happily gave us a late checkout and gave us some good tips on visiting the memorial museum. The only criticism of the hotel is that all the seating is low so if you have bad knees, beware! Otherwise, it was a romantic, sophisticated wonderful place to spend a spring weekend in downtown NYC with a particularly pleasant and caring staff.

title: Adresse à retenir absolument
text:
Accueil très chaleureux, chambre assez grande, bien équipée, et déco sobre et agréable.
Un très bon restaurant, salons et bar très cosy, service excellent et très belle situation pour visiter Tribeca et le sud de Manhattan.

title: Wont refund a mistaken charge or respond to emails!
text:
I took my wife to New York as a surprise trip & stayed Smyth Tribeca in January. 

On our return home I found I had been charged an additional $1400.00 even though I had already paid all of our bills. It took me 5 phone calls from the UK & 2 emails before I eventually spoke to a manager who could offer some help, sadly by this point it was April 3 months after I had been over charged! On Speaking to the manager Ean Avilez & after 2 emails I was refunded most of the mistaken charge. Sadly because of the time it took for Smyth to issue the refund I have had some charges applied to my credit card,£64.00, which isn't a huge amount of money but as this was not my mistake I am not prepared to pay it.

I have spoken to my credit card company about refunding the charges but they will not. I have sent several emails to Ean, the manager at Thompson hotels but have not received a single reply so far.

I would save the money & grief & choose a more professional hotel to stay in preferably one who put's their clients first rather than ignoring them. Their is plenty of choice in New York. sadly this has slowly ruined the good memories we made on our holiday.

title: Fantastic Hotel for a weekend getaway.
text:
Husband and My first trip away from baby. Made the quick drive from Newport to watch the Americas Cup. The hotel was just about a 10 minute walk from Brookfield Place and he the most delicious bagel shop on the way called Zuckers. The room was very comfortable. Pillows and bedding was great. (I definitely care about my bedding and this did not let us down.) We he sown friends around to the downstairs lounge for drinks. A fantastic atmosphere. 

We will absolutely be coming back.

title: Great hotel in great neighborhood
text: I stayed at the Smyth last weekend - my second stay there.  I love the minimalist rooms - and the fact that you can open a window! Tribeca is a great neighborhood and the hotel is a great place to come "home" to at the end of a great day in NYC.  The staff is always great especially Patrick the bellman and Gianni.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Retreat @ The Smyth
text: Super chic, boutique hotel in the heart of downtown NYC, sadly my stay was only for 2 nights.  The staff were A+++!! Always makes a difference in your stay! Loved the cleanliness of the rooms too! Will return soon!

title: Great Hotel, Great Staff
text: We stayed here for 2 nights, The staff are friendly, courteous and very professional,  Our room was exceptionally clean, The bed was very comfortable, the pillows were awesome! It was a great location, for what we wanted to do during our stay in NYC.

title: Excellent service
text: The hotel is clean, quiet and the staff were outstanding. Stayed there during a quick weekend trip with the better half. We usually stay in mid town but this time decided to stay closer to SoHo. Glad we did.  Special kudos to Patrick the bellman.

title: Absolutely stunning
text: We stayed at the Smyth as part of a birthday trip to New York and Philadelphia and loved every minute. Everything from the friendly staff to the gorgeous room we were given was ideal. The location couldn't be better for Downtown. Easy access to One WTC, 9/11 Memorial and Museum, Tribeca, and SoHO made for a really convenient base. The bars are cosy and welcoming and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The fact that Chambers Street subway station is outside the front door makes for easy zipping around the City and connections to just about anywhere. Special shout to Gianni and Patrick who added that little extra personal touch and assisted us all through our stay. Would I recommend Smyth Hotel? Absolutely.

title: Think you are saving money? Think again !!!!
text: I travel a lot and usually don't write reviews unless they are super special. In this case it's a complete opposite. This hotel felt old, uncleaned, understaffed, lack of ambiance throughout, poorly cleaned sink in the bathroom, no full size mirror, carpet in the room had stains all throughout what looked like a pet stains, not most pleasant front desk staff.  I am still trying to figure out how it is a five star hotel???? Who certified this hotel five stars? What year? How often does a hotel requires their recertification of rating? Honestly, it is probably the first time that I am seeing such huge inconsistency between star rating and what was represented. I know, each person has their own expectations when in comes to hotel stay. To us it felt more like a 3 star hotel. We have stayed at 5 star hotels in the area and there is no direct comparison to them. Overall, it was a very poor and unexpected experience. Thank G-d it was only for a one night sleep over. When you read this review and still desire to stay at this property you will remember reading this review and will sadly regret it, but it would be just too late. I made s mistake and booked this hotel strictly on hotel star rating without taking any time to read reviews. Chose your hotels wisely!!

title: Stayed in town for TD 5 Boro Bike tour
text:
Contemporary styling and nice lobby.  The hotel room was  large room; somewhat dark.  The bed was very comfortable.  The street noise was minimal and overall quiet.   The staff was very accommodating. 
NYC pricing though

title: Nice location, awful service
text: Stayed in this hotel a couple of months ago: the hotel is located in a great area, has a nice bar and a pleasant vibe. Unfortunately, the service is unimaginably awful: back home - it has appeared that the hotel has overbilled my credit card. Have tried countless times to get into contact with the responsible manager or accounting department via Phone and e-mail, trying to get to a solution. Every time I get a very annoyed manager on the phone, promising me that they will get back to me, but have not heard from them as per today. Absolutely not the service I expected from a four star hotel.

title: Fine location, friendly & efficient staff, intimate boutique style with comfortable bedrooms likely designed by a bloke.
text:
Stayed for 6 nights in a super-king bedroom and this comfortable boutique style hotel served us well. My wife did suggest our bedroom was obviously designed by a talented chap with chaps primarily in mind - having no decent dressing table nor convenient mirror for make-up purposes. Apart from this minor irritation, the average sized bedroom proved comfortable, with a lovely, snuggly bed; contemporary style bathroom with a wet-room/shower (though no bath); sufficient storage (just); and super fast, reliable & free WiFi/Internet. Though other bedrooms seemed to have Nespresso coffee making facilities, we had no in-room tea/coffee provided. However, the helpful front-desk, sensitive to the obvious needs of a couple of Brits abroad, provided us a kettle ensuring we'd always benefit from the all-important early morning cuppa without depending on room-service. This was much appreciated.

We genuinely found all the hotel staff to be professional, efficient, and having a relaxed, informal style seemingly in keeping with general ambiance of this chilled and trendy Smyth Hotel. 

Although the area (Tribeca) is primarily residential and relatively quiet (for Manhattan), it’s an ideal base to explore from and the hotel even benefits from being conveniently only 20m from Chambers Street metro station. There are decent local deli’s (do check out Zuckers Bagels) and a good choice of quality restaurants in the vicinity. A restaurant I’m very happy to recommend is the Smyth hotels very own - Little Park – do make sure you reserve a table as it’s a very popular eatery and understandably so given the quality of its simple menu and relatively reasonable (for Manhattan) prices.

title: Disappointing - on every level.
text:
I'm not sure what disappointed me more - the dishonesty, or the bad service.

Let's start with the dishonesty. Before I checked in I was sent an email detailing all the facilities I would encounter when I arrived. The one that had appealed to me most when I booked was "a complimentary town car service within a 10 block radius", ideal for my meetings, dinners etc. What a great service! Imagine how disappointed I was on arrival when I asked for the aforementioned town car, to be told it didn't exist! Never had done. There is no town car. The email was totally dishonest!

So next - the service. Awful from start to finish. I won't bore you here with all the details, but the following situation summed it up for me. I received an automated email the day I checked out to ask for my feedback. I responded honestly. Within 24 hours I had an email from the assistant manager to ask about my experience, so that they know how to improve and hoping that I would give them another chance. I replied the same day, and took the time to send thorough and constructive feedback.

One month on, and not a single word in response. No 'thanks for taking the time to respond', no 'crikey! Sorry we lied, better get that sorted out', no 'sorry our front of house staff treated you with total disrespect'. Nope, nothing at all. If that's the way the assistant manager behaves, I guess there is no hope for the rest of the staff.

Top tip though - if you do choose to stay here, I suggest you arrive late at night and negotiate the price. On my arrival, having paid full whack up front for my (very basic) room, I had a front row seat to a man waltzing in and negotiating, in front of me (I was totally ignored whilst this discussion was going on) for the Smyth Suite (apparently $3,000 per night), for $515!! Bargain!

title: Great location super staff
text: Stayed a week at the Smyth Hotel with my daughter. Before arriving I asked for a room with a view of Freedom tower for my daughter and told them it was her 50th birthday. Request met and drinks to celebrate her birthday given to us. Fantastic situation in the heart of Tribeca, next to the subway and five minute walk from ground zero. Lovely big room, immaculately clean and the staff are so helpful. Nice bar and communal rooms with a fire to relax by if it is cold. The corridors from the lift to the rooms are a bit dark and dingy and perhaps do spoil the overall ambience. I would have b no hesitiation to stay here again and recommend it. Being in lower Manhattan it is quiet and peaceful after a day up town, but accessible to all parts with no problem.Great restaurants nearby, but you will need to go out early morning for tea/coffee as none in the room, but Starbucks is just about next door.

title: Séjour à New York en Hotel agréable
text: Très belle et grande chambre ! Hotel tres bien placé dans Tribeca et l'équipe d'accueil (Anta,Asia et TK) tres sympa ! Service impeccable.Petit déjeuner très moyen (service long et désagréable,on peut s'en passer!

title: Good location, nice rooms
text:
We were here for 5 nights over the Easter weekend. The Smyth is in a really good location, right next to the subway and within decent walking distance of nice restaurants and not too far from Soho, WTC, Battery Park etc. It was a great base from which to explore Tribeca.

When we checked in, we received a very warm welcome from Anta who was courteous, friendly and helpful throughout our visit. She told us everything we needed to know and always greeted us with a smile. 

On a negative point, we didn't find all the staff to be as friendly as Anta - there was a definite 'heads down' approach from some, which is a shame - and something that surprised us. 

Our room was spacious and well equipped (apart from the glaring omission of tea and coffee facilities). Good water pressure. The bed was really comfortable. The free internet was fine for general browsing. 

We enjoyed our stay. However, I'd agree with other reviewers that this feels more like a 4* than a 5* hotel and for the fees being charged it's just about okay value.

title: Brilliant
text: I had a very good experience. TriBeCa is a great and quiet area close to the subway. Rooms were very clean and well appointed. Breakfast was great and well served with unbelievable coffee. We had a great reception at the start and very friendly service.

title: Really difficult to find faults, excellent hotel, even better team!
text:
Been meaning to leave a review for far too long, the Thompson Insta has me wishing I was back now though!  

I stayed at the smyth for at least 3 months in 2015 (extending my stay twice) and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.  The room was very large by NY standards, the bar and restaurant spoiled you for an in hotel fixture and the staff couldn't do enough to make your stay everything you hoped.  

A special thanks has to go to Patrick, he was always more than happy to help, whether it was to point out the best hairdresser in the area (I almost don't want to share Marc at  Lance Lappin if you get a chance, you won't regret it), the best spots for a drink and recommendations on the rooftops to be seen on.  He was also one of the only New Yorkers to understand what I said first time (Scottish), so either he has Scottish family or he was unbelievably polite!

He hotel were happy to accommodate me when my mum visited and provide a room without a see-through shower (I was as glad as my mum), and although I had to pay for the pleasure, the room was much bigger and it seemed to be busy at the hotel, but it didn't stop them making sure that would go ahead.  Communication in general was brilliant from the front desk even emailing/calling to let me know my 'mom' had checked in okay while I was at work.

If I had to make a criticism (and all be it only because I liked the place so much and would like to return), it would be that there is no loyalty scheme.  I would return gladly on business but it's hard to compete with some hotels that offer free stays, especially when your stays are in excess of 3 months long and it's hard to justify a personal trip at full prices when your company pay for your business trips already.  I'm sure Thompson are on top of this though like everything else and that will change. Despite that I wouldn't hesitate in recommending the smyth to all of my friends, it really is that good.

Again thanks to all of the team, I hope to visit again soon.

title: Girls night out
text: Awesome! The location, the room, the restaurant. The staff was friendly, the establishment was clean, and the room was spacious.  The shower had great water pressure, my favorite part! I highly recommend the Smythe, Boutique hotels are the way to go.

title: Awesome!
text: From the doorman to the maid staff, this hotel rocks! A must stay! Great location too. Everyone was was friendly. You must try the restaurant...it is delicious, yummy. My friends and I are looking forward to another visit as soon as possible.

title: GIRLS NIGHT OUT!!!
text:
We arrived at the hotel around noon, our room was not ready, so we went to Little Park for Lunch. It was Excellent!!! Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu, wine and drinks. Everything was delicious. 
We had spa appointments and left our bags with the hotel. We received a call to let us know our room was ready and the bags were going to be in the room when we returned. We were very happy, considering we were running late for dinner. The room was spacious and very clean. We left the next morning and Patrick the Bellman was very helpful.
We will definitely return to the Smyth Hotel.

title: Amazing!
text:
Absolutely fabulous hotel! Staff were so helpful it was incredible! Room fantastic
and great location! My daughter was sick and they cleaned our room late at night for us without a question! 
Restaurant staff not so good, very rude and unhelpful!

title: Visita 5 días
text:
Hotel estupendo, gran ubicación, restaurante magnífico con gran ambiente y muy animado por la noche.
Habitación no muy grande pero bien distribuida. Baño comodísimo con grandes botes de champú, gel, acondicionador y crema de cuerpo.
Una estancia muy agradable.

title: Great hotel, nice patio, slow room service
text: Stayed for four nights for a short solo trip. The rooms are amazing and the views from the small patio are wonderful (I got a room high up). However, my only complaint was that room service is quite slow - it took an hour to deliver breakfast to my room. I would recommend this hotel, but warn about possibly slow room service.

title: Boutique Choice
text:
Had a day free over the weekend while on business (a matter of flight connections) and instead of spending that one day in a bland Midtown offering, decided to check this option in Tribeca. No regrets! It's conveniently located with the Chambers Street subway (1, 2, 3) right at its door, and it's a good location to wander around Lower Manhattan and its unique neighbourhoods. 

The staff were also pretty commendable and friendly. At check-in, there was some visitor making a bit of a prankish call to the NYPD using the hotel's phone and the staff member checking me in was completely professional (though probably trying his darnedest not to burst into laughter). 

Rooms were good-sized with some interesting purchasable amenities (like a "love" set). Shower compartment does not close fully (very European in design) and so it can get quite cold in the shower (perhaps setting the stage for that "love" set, I don't know, ha).

title: Solid choice for Lower Manhattan
text: Nothing extraordinary here, but everything ably done; very comfortable, and the restaurant and bar -- Little Park -- is outstanding. Near the new Calatrava transit center and World Trade Center, but at a cozy smaller-scale intersection of West Broadway and Chambers Street.

title: Perfect!
text:
We got a great deal on HOTLINE, and it was worth every penny. Beautiful lounge, beautiful spacious room, gorgeous bath room.   Only downside they promised to mail my letter to my son but didn't.  :(  Oh well.

Also, a suggestion, toilet should have a sliding door so one person can be in the toilet, and the other in the sink/shower area.  But overall loved it and will def do it again.

title: Great location, and lovely hotel for those who enjoy the boutique approach
text:
My second stay at this hotel in 2 months, and it is a little like returning home each day! The rooms are large (for NYC) and comfortable, and the doormen and staff and more than welcoming and nothing is too much.
The neighborhood is great for dining out, and there are plenty of hidden gems down the side streets for drinks and dinner.
The subway stop outside the hotel (Chambers) can whisk you uptown on the express train in no time at all! There is a WholeFoods rounds the corner if you don't always want to eat out, or would like fresh fruit and coffee on the way to the office.

title: Bo som The Kardashians
text: Trendy boutique hotel med flotte værelser centralt beliggende i TriBeCa - tæt på de hyggelige shoppegader i SoHo og Ground Zero (Der i øvrigt er nabo til outletbutikken Century 21). Hotellet er spotless, men også dyrt og en anelse snobby.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: I booked this hotel through hotwire and wasn't disappointed! First of all, they allowed me to check-in and 9:30am. The front desk staff was attentive, the room was clean with all the amenities you would expect from a boutique hotel in this area. Speaking of the area, the hotel is located in the perfect area of the city; close to the 9-11 memorial, close to Soho and close to Greenwich Village. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice location. Rooms and service not quite as good
text: Nice TriBeCa location. Convenient to lower Manhattan, the Hudson River Park, 9/11 Memorial and good restaurants. Clean, typically small but comfortable NY rooms. Showers have no doors, which means some water on the floor and a fan that is automatic and comes on and off at odd times. No morning coffee or coffee maker in the room but Starbucks next door

title: Excellent, excellent, excellent!
text:
Beautiful hotel, amazing location, staff were friendly, helpful, a special shoutout to Sandy who really looked after us well!

It was my husbands 40th and we flew in from Australia for a week, we were upgraded, given a quiet corner room and surprised one evening with champagne and chocolates!

Do yourself a favor and enjoy a cocktail by the fire before dinner, the raising Manhattan was my favourite, nibble on some duck rillette and crackers, then their restaurant little park for dinner.

Just can't wait to come back!

title: Excelente!!
text: O hotel é simplesmente ótimo! Limpo, um serviço atencioso e rápido, recepção sempre prestativa, um restaurante maravilhoso ao estilo farm to kitchen, bem localizado. Apesar do preço um pouco salgado, voltarei com certeza.

title: Hip Hotel
text: Great little hotel in Tribeca. Love the location and the lobby bar. One of my favorite places to have a cocktail by the fire. The service is great at the hotel and the rooms are well appointed. Great staff, especially Patrick the bellman. Always happy to help with directions, a reservation or just a smile.

title: Location, location.
text:
So I expected to *love* this hotel from all the other reviews. And oddly, I didn't. The location is excellent - right by the subway, easy access to the financial district and tribeca itself. The rooms are very well designed and beautifully finished. Public spaces are limited to a small lobby, lounge area and Little Park restaurant (with a gym in the basement). The service was good - not outstanding - and generally impersonal, although the housekeeping team on floor six were absolutely lovely. 

For part of our stay, someone staying on the same floor had security permanently stood outside their room. It was kind of off-putting being eyeballed by a security guard every time you left your room. I'm not sure there is much the hotel could have done, but nonetheless it irked. 

Would I stay again? I think yes, because for New York the prices were pretty good. Is this the best place to stay in the city? Absolutely not.

title: Best location in Tribeca!!!
text:
I stayed at the Smyth several times now with my children. We visit New York few times a year and we had stayed in several hotels. Recently we have decided to stick with the Smyth. The location is perfect, in the heart of Tribeca, few steps from the river. 
Staff is very nice and helpful. Patrick has been a great help to us!
The restaurant downstairs is lovely and breakfast is delicious. 
We will definitely stay again.

title: Great location!
text: NYC was the last place we expected to be last week.  We had a nice trip to San Juan planned...unfortunately, due to my wife being pregnant and the Zika virus, we elected to cancel.  I booked the Smyth essentially, at the last minute via priceline.  The lobby is very small but well done.  The staff is extremely courteous, and helpful whenever possible. The room itself was very nice as well.  We were on the fifth floor and had a very nice street view and we could actually see 1 WTC from our room.  We did have some minor issues with the HVAC system, which I understand is very old.  The problem was remedied by opening the window.  This was right across the street from the Chambers St Subway station and so traveling via public transport couldn't have been easier or more convenient.  Would certainly consider staying here again!

title: Eye Opening
text: We were in town for college visits and program auditions. We typically stay SOHO to Uptown, and chose downtown for it's proximity to schools on our schedule. What a great find, we cannot wait to go back. Conveniently located near City Hall, Brooklyn Bridge, and Ground Zero, this TriBeCa location gets you out of the craziness of some of the other nearby locations, such as SOHO and midtown where crowds on the streets can get very old. A relatively low rise building area, you can see sky and cool old school buildings, while out of nowhere rises the Freedom Tower. You get views of the building from many angles. The hotel itself is understated and comfy, with a very attentive staff who appreciates you as a guest. Small enough for them to know your name, and you see the same faces many times even on a short visit. The library bar and Little Park restaurants are top notch for food, conversation and cocktails - and with a subway stop literally outside the hotel front door - you can get everywhere. The rooms are very comfortable, clean lines, beautiful finishes, walk in shower and a separate tub in our King Suite, with a separate sitting room with a pull out sofa for that only child. This is a fabulous find, and i highly recommend this hotel.

title: Very nice hotel
text:
Nice room very large with a very comfy bed, good service and very clean hotel. Location was just perfect for my business trip at the world trade center. They 
Surely coming back on my next business trip in NYC.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in TriBeCa
text:
The Smyth is a fantastic place to stay if you are traveling for business in the financial district. I usually stay at the Roxy, but it wasn't an approved hotel for this trip. The hotel is within short walking distance of many of the banking buildings in lower Manhattan, close to the subway, and there are tons of great restaurants close by. 

The staff is great, very friendly and accommodating and the restaurant and bar are top notch. 

The rooms are very minimalist, but quite luxurious. I like that. I was very comfortable in my suite for the week I was there. I will definitely be staying there again next time I'm in NYC.

title: Perfect balance of location, service and comfort
text: Our second long stay at this great boutique hotel. New lounge bar is like Tribeca's lounge room. New restaurant is first class with an exciting and innovative menu. As we stayed 14 nights we choose a suite. Service from staff was friendly and very attentive. Shame New York is so far from Sydney or I would be there more often. I can't wait  to return to the Smyth Tribeca.

title: Great Location - Friendly Service.
text: We will be back the next time we stay in the area. We had a 2nd floor corner room that had a great view of the streets and people as they passed. Did get some road noise but it did not bother us. The room was very clean and comfortable. The Hotel was small but very service oriented. There was always someone at the front desk to help and they were very friendly. The location was in Tribeca so there were lots a great food near by and sites.

title: Nja.. Inte vad jag väntat mig
text: Tycker att de missat det vesäntliga såsom en riktig cocktailbar att hänga i. Fick ett litet rum med iofs både sköna sängar och välintrett. Håller fullkomligt med tidigare skribenter som håller Soho Grand skyhögt bättre mot detta hotel.

title: Great location! Will visit again and again!
text:
My husband and I spent 4 nights here and we absolutely loved this place! The location is perfect - there is an entrance to the Subway right outside the door and you are within walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge, the 9-11 museum, Century 21 (great discount shopping!), and SoHo.  There is a great pizza joint (Palermo's) and a great Mexican restaurant just down the block. There is also a Whole Foods within walking distance. 
We travel to New York City at least once a year and we are definitely going to make this place our "go-to". 
Highly recommended!!!

title: Marvelous
text: Let me start off by saying, this place was the BOMB.COM! Wonderful experience. I was able to get an upgrade where I was able to have a balcony. At first, I felt some type of way because I was not unable to check in at 3pm instead I check in later like an hour later. The hotel did go out their way by making sure my stay was comfortable, that was a plus. Make sure you stay in a room where there is a good view.

title: Great hotel in good location
text:
This was my second night in New york and the night before was in the Gild Hall which only had one night available.
Closer to the center of the city. A very modern hotel with beautiful rooms.
Looking forward to my next stay

title: Quality service
text: Everyone was friendly and welcoming in the entire hotel. Some of the staff even remembered our name. The hotel never felt crowded. The bar was a very well done and comfortable.  Not a gathering spot for the locals which we liked. We had breakfast in at Little Park on morning and it was very good. I like the hotel use of technology. We did a pre check in where they asked for some preference and did messaged us thru out our stay with offers of assistance. We will definitely stay there again.

title: Das Personal am Empfang waren immer sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.
text: Wir können das Hotel nur weiterempfehlen. Die Zimmer waren groß und Sauber, Bad sehr sauber und immer jeden Tag frische Handtücher bekommen. Das Frühstück war gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber sehr lecker. Die U-Bahn Station war direkt vor dem Hotel und wir waren in ein paar Minuten auf dem Time Square. Also Lage des Hotel ideal. Danke für die nette und freundliche Bewirtung in Ihrem Hotel. Wenn wir mal wieder nach New York kommen sollten, werden wir auf alle Fälle Ihr Hotel aufsuchen.

title: Went for a weekend. Great time!
text: My room was perfect, hotel was very nice, and hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating... Especially! Sandy! The door man. Everyone was very nice and knew me after check in.  That doesn't happen often in NYC.

title: Cool look and relaxed vibe, but ultimately not great.
text: This was my first time at this boutique hotel in Tribeca. It has a nice look, a nice sense of style in both the public spaces and the rooms. They very kindly upgraded me to a King Suite, which I enjoyed of course. I ordered room service for dinner, and it was a nice meal. Not amazing, but pretty good. The bathroom looked nice, but the handle for the cold water on the sink was loose, and the sink was very slow to drain. The water pressure in the shower was quite low, which made for a longer, much less enjoyable shower. The room was pretty quiet until I heard a dog barking somewhere on the floor above me. It wasn't crazy loud, just annoying. I put in my earplugs and that solved the problem. The next morning I ordered room service for breakfast, but the meal did not measure up to the dinner I'd had the night before. The waffles seemed like they were pre-made and came with a crazy amount of whipped cream on top, which the menu hadn't mentioned. I removed as much of it as I could. They just didn't taste great, and I usually find room service waffles to be quite tasty. The chicken sausage was okay for the first few bites, but after it had cooled a bit it tasted kind of gross to me. The waiters were all very nice. Like most hotels, they hand you the room service check to sign. There's a place for a tip, but I noticed a large service charge on the bill already and asked the waiter if that charge was in fact the tip. They said that it was. It annoyed me that the check just said "Tip" and not "Additional Tip". I gave them a little extra anyway. My favorite situation is when a hotel (like The Mercer) includes a nice tip on the bill, and the waiter just leaves it on the table without asking you to sign it. But that's extremely rare. I was hoping that I'd found a reasonably priced, comfortable, stylish boutique hotel in a cool neighborhood that I'd want to stay at again, but that was not the case. Look, it's not a bad place, and it's not a bad price, but given the hotel selection that Manhattan has to offer, I'll try something else next time.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in a great location
text: We stayed for seven nights over the New Year. The location in TriBeCa is perfect and the subway is right outside the hotel providing fast access all over the city. The staff were super friendly including Patrick who recommended restaurants and Diana who upgraded our room to a junior suite on the first night upon our request and providing a complimentary bottle of wine on my wife's birthday. The Little Park restaurant was also excellent as was the room service. I preferred Downtown location as it's less busy and touristy than Midtown. Ideal for boutiques, One World Trade Centre, shopping in SOHO and Downtown Brooklyn. I would definitely recommend staying at The Smyth in future.

title: Lovely hotel in a great area!
text:
I've traveled to New York quite a few times and this was the first time staying outside of Mid-Town. 

I would thoroughly recommend the hotel and the area. The staff were always helpful and courteous. We were upgraded to a King Deluxe which was a spacious room with a good sized bathroom and rain shower. The mini bar was well equipped and they had other little 'treats' in the room that you could also have. My only negative would be a lack of hooks/hanging in the room (v. minor point but easily fixed) so you could hang your towels/coats up.  

We didn't eat in the restaurant but did sit in the bar/lounge which was lovely, especially next to the fire. 

The area has lots and lots of places to eat, drink and shop and you are a stone's throw from One World Trade, Wall Street etc. 

Would definitely recommend and will look to stay at other hotels they have in different locations.

title: Good hotel - outstanding staff
text:
Added on a few days onto a work trip.  I was based in Mid-Town for work and wanted to have a break from the hustle and bustle.  The hotel staff were incredibly welcoming.  I got an upgrade on arrival and the room was fantastic; big bed, walk-in shower and great view of the World Trade Tower.  Hard to find fault with the hotel, the bar was a little expensive to drink in but I would expect the same of a similar standard London hotel.  

Excellent staff, great location and one I would definitely recommend!

title: Good location
text:
We stayed in this hotel for a week. All in all it was ok. 

The size of the room was quite generous, the bathroom was quite ok, nothing to complain about, the location was great, the metro entrance was right in front of the hotel.
Nevertheless the hotel is more of what 4 stars hotels look like. It is not a 5. The carpeting on the floor looked pretty bad, worn out, and there were stains all over it. The furniture wasn´t too good looking either. But the room was generally clean and the staff were nice (especially Asia). 
The breakfast was good indeed, the only thing was that we had 60 dollars between the both of us and it wasn´t enough,  especially counting the tips for the waiters and all. There was not much variety either. But, of course, we stayed there for a week and I suppose it is normal to grow tired of the same food. 
I really appreciated that, one morning when we came back from breakfast, the housekeeping lady, who was just coming out of our room, wanted to check our key to see if we really lived there. I really liked that, makes you feel safe.
I would probably come back here.

title: Pleasant stay
text: I stayed here for a weekend right before the Christmas holiday, and really enjoyed the hotel.  Both the affiliated restaurant and bar/lounge were stylish, with good service and well tailored menu and drink offerings.  Though the rooms felt a little sterile and masculine, they were comfortable, spacious, and clean.  The location was really convenient -- a subway was literally right out the door and for those who enjoy strolling through NYC neighborhoods, there are so many good ones in walking distance.

title: Great stay over New Year
text:
I stayed with my wife for a week over New Year. Whilst the immediate area is a little 'run down' we loved this boutique hotel and the friendly and helpful staff, particularly Patrick who even recommended (2x) excellent restaurants for us to eat at in the evening.
Our room was comfy and quiet and the Subway station is just a few yards from the hotel. 
We will certainly stay here again.

title: Mi aspettavo di più
text: Ho trascorso una notte in questo lussuoso hotel. Si: location,camera, minibar, Wi-Fi, prodotti da bagno, auto di cortesia. No: hall troppo buia,la camera allestita solo per una persona e la colazione inclusa nel prezzo ma solo fino a 30€ a testa.

title: Great Find!
text:
I have nothing but good comments about this hotel.  

The Smyth hotel is located right next to Metro which gave easy access to the sites.  The hotels staff were extremely helpful from checkin to checkout. The restaurant and bar were great and offered a good selection of meals and snacks.    The room was simply decorated and had a super comfy bed!!! 

I also liked the neighbourhood the hotel was in.  There was plenty of restaurants and bars which is not like other parts of the city I've stayed in.

title: Best hotel in Manhatten
text: Bigest rooms. Cleaner, nicer, best staff...if you interested in the best accomodation on down town NY and you mind the looks, style and service this is the place for you and your family it worth the extra bucks plus they have complimatary taxi service from morning to noon.

title: MAGIC
text:
We had the best time! Stayed in so many NYC hotels, and this was by far the best! The entire staff was amazing, our room was perfect and the food was excellent! 
One word so summen our trip is:MAGIC!!!

title: Fabulous Christmas in New York
text:
The Smyth Hotel more than lived up to our expectations of Christmas in New York, starting with the reception staff who were incredibly welcoming and helpful. We were given a comfortable room of generous proportions with a large and well appointed bathroom, there was an evening turn down service which was lovely and overall during our five days' stay we enjoyed faultless hospitality from a young crew who just wanted to do their best for us - and who took our various British eccentricities completely in their stride. 

Just a small criticism on housekeeping - furniture does need to be moved from time to time to vacuum behind it : I dropped something behind a bedside table and it was covered in dust and gunk when I retrieved it. Also the room safe was situated in the bottom of the wardrobe which would have been tricky for anyone who finds bending (kneeling, crouching) difficult. But otherwise, we had a fabulous time and would like to thank and acknowledge the front of house team in particular.

title: Consigliato se trovate l' offerta giusta
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 11 notti presso questo hotel di alto livello nel quartiere di tribeca, vicino a wall street. 
Se trovate un' offerta a meno di 200$ a notte a testa è un affare. Si consideri che una cifra del genere la chiedono tranquillamente alberghi di categoria inferiore (anche i 3 stelle a midtown).
Il quartiere è tranquillo ed elegante.
La fermata della metro che vi porta in 10 minuti a times square è a 5 metri dalla porta di ingresso dell' hotel.
Il personale è gentile e ti fanno sentire a tuo agio.
C'è un ristorante (little park) molto bello ed elegante all'interno dell'hotel in cui viene servita la colazione e si può pranzare o cenare.
Attenzione: se nell' offerta che trovate è inclusa la colazione questo significa che avrete 30$ a testa da spendere scegliendo a la carte dal menu del little park. Tenete presente che un piatto mediamente sta sui 16$ e il caffè sui 5$. Questi prezzi non includono tasse e tips (20%). Se in due prendete due piatti e due caffè non sforate. Se invece avete fame e prendete tante cose non vi dicono niente ovviamente. Semplicemente vi verrà addebitata la differenza.
La camera (king superior) era molto spaziosa, pulita e collocata al 7 piano (su 12). Il letto era stupendo e comodissimo.
Bagno pazzesco e voluminoso.
Molto bella anche la palestra accessibile 24/24.
Servizio in camera 24/24.
Decisamente consigliato!

title: Great location and staff; OK room with poor bathroom
text:
Really great location in the heart of Tribeca - the subway was right outside the hotel and super easy to get cabs and Ubers.  The staff was very kind and accommodating and all our interactions with them were fantastic. The lobby was cozy and great for gathering and the Little Park restaurant was delicious.  Maid service was prompt and never disturbed us.  

The bathroom was sub-par for a four star hotel.  The bathroom door was a sliding one that didn't close completely (3 inch gap), providing little privacy for using the toliet.  The shower wall was frosted and exterior facing into the room, and thus when you went into the bathroom and turned on the light, it illuminated the whole room (not great for the other person sleeping).  The heat fan in our bathroom wouldn't turn off and was so loud that engineering had to come (they couldn't turn it off either- just had to wait until the timer ran down).  The pillows were flat/uncomfortable (but the mattress was comfy).  The fire alarm went off at 3:30 a.m. one night (it was a false alarm), which was frightening.  The cleanliness overall was ok, not excellent - the corners and edges of the carpet in our room were dirty and the paint in the room chipped and overall just a little run down. It wasn't dire by any means, but I wouldn't consider it 4 stars.

title: Not what it used to be.......
text:
We have stayed at the Smyth before and in fact Thompson properties in London and Toronto as well. We like small hotels as they make you feel at home especially when you are a returning guest.
This trip was a one nighter as we were on route to Europe. We booked a few months in advance and dealt direct with a back office senior manager. We mentioned what our plans were in the email and even mentioned that it was our anniversary that night.
In most hotels where we are returning guests we normally get a welcome note, some fruit or a bottle of wine. Just a nice gesture. This time around Nothing ! Small gestures , especially when paying nearly 500$ for the night make one feel more welcome. While the staff and especially the door men are most helpful we could not help but be disappointed in our stay this time at the Smyth. Perhaps it is time to move on to a chain that is a bit more appreciative to return guests.

title: Gem in TriBeCa
text: The Smyth Thompson Hotel is fabulous in every way! Leading up to our trip we had read many stellar reviews and this hotel lived up to our expectations and beyond! Upon arrival we were warmly greeted getting out of our cab by the doorman who took our luggage and led us to the front desk where we were graciously treated by two lovely young ladies. We arrived before check in but luckily they had a room ready for us. We had a superior king room on the third floor. As soon as we opened the door, the room had a great vibe. A modern room with beautiful linens on the bed, a wonderfully designed bathroom with all the little amenities we could hope for. Our street view was awesome, we could see One World Trade Center which was a nice surprise. As far as location goes The Smyth Thompson was perfectly located for us. We absolutely loved being in TriBeCa as it has cool, calm and safe feel to the community. On top of that the subway is literally steps from the front door of the hotel which made getting around Manhattan a breeze. The evening bar/lounge was a warm and cozy place to come back to after a long day of touring around the city for a cocktail and some munchies. The staff in every area of this hotel was friendly, warm and professional. We can't say enough good things about this hotel. When we come back to NYC we will without a doubt stay at the Smyth Thompson!

title: Helpful young staff
text: Probably best for the young. Hip, stylish, dark. Not so great for the middle aged. We don't mind spending a lot-but the $7 cup of coffee in the morning was irritating.  Hotels should provide free coffee for their guests. Similarly, the dark lounging areas and hallways not so great for middle-aged eyes. Carpet in room was worn. Super helpful young staff. Tom at the front desk was especially accommodating--giving me several maps (because I kept misplacing them) and offering me recompense when our TV was not working properly. (Apparently someone removed the cable)! Location leaves a bit to be desired. Very helpful with transportation--was able to use town car. Young man at door extremely pleasant and friendly. Nice gym!

title: Very nice hotel - definitely not 5 star
text:
Stayed at Smyth Hotel mid December of 2015 at the 'Deluxe double room with 2 double beds' room. 
Hotel is very welcoming, staff is extremely courteous and hotel is located right on top of Chambers st. Subway station - super convenient.

Our room was spacious but beds were awfully short! We're not unusually tall people, but we slept with our feet hanging out of the bed.

Overall, it's a nice hotel but far from being a NYC 5 star hotel; services and room amenities simply do not justify its rating.

title: Midcentury Design - sehr gute Lage - gutes Restaurant
text:
Das Smyth ist anders. Das Hotel ist im 60th Stil gestaltet. Die grosszügigen Zimmer bieten für NY Verhältnisse sehr viel Platz und sind gut ausgestattet. Und sehr ruhig. Zimmer und Flure schienen frisch gestrichen zu sein. Alles war sehr gepflegt, lediglich die (günstig reproduzierten) Möbel zeigten Abnutzungspuren. Das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis passt bei diesem Hotel!

Ein Tipp: Bei der Buchung um ein Zimmer mit Blick bitten. Wir zogen um, nachdem wir zunächst auf eine nahe, gegenüberliegende Wand schauen mussten. Der Bitte wurde problemlos entsprochen. 
Die schnörkellose Freundlichkeit an der Rezeption schwankt, je nachdem wer dort gerade anzutreffen ist. Im Umfeld findet man zahlreiche nette Lokale und das Smyth ist ein wunderbarer Startpunkt für Unternehmungen in der Stadt!

Das dem Hotel angeschlossene Restaurant Little Park ist sehr gut. Das sollte man sich  nicht entgehen lassen. 

Ich kann das Smyth empfehlen!

title: Wonderful stay
text: Had the pleasure of staying here last weekend with my husband and young daughter.  From the moment we arrived, everyone was so helpful and pleasant.  They arrranged to have a crib and warm kettle in our crib to accommodate our baby.  The rooms are huge by NY standards.  We stayed in the Thompson SoBe over the summer and i think the room was bigger here.  The downstairs bar has fabulous cocktails that we enjoyed nightly by the fireplace.  Already planning our next trip to NYC and won't stay anywhere other than here.

title: Not acceptable
text:
We came for a 2 nights stay in a Delux Double suite. The reception people, the suite and the accommodations for our requests were all nicely handled. We were told, and it's written in their papers, that for the night time, they re-do the beds, change towels and bring in more water. We had an event that night. When we came back, late at night we found out that none of these was done in the room. We called to complain. They offered to send someone in, which obviously we refused since it was already late at night.
Next day we had breakfast, not included in the stay. The breakfast was really good.
We were busy the whole morning and had an important event in the evening. We came back to the room, after 2 pm, to rest a little before the evening event. The room was not done!!! we called, they apologized and brought in the cleaning people.
We had to wait while they were cleaning, instead of resting. Even in a 2 stars hotel, this is not happening! Based on the noises we heard later on, they did a late cleaning of the next door rooms too.
They compensated us by paying for the breakfast we had in the morning.

title: Hotel mit besonderem Stil
text: Wir haben eine Woche in dem Hotel verbracht. Zimmer haben eine ordentliche Größe für New York. Lage direkt an der U Bahn und wenige Schritte zum World One ist in Ordnung. Die Gegend entwickelt sich stark. Zum Shoppen muss man allerdings immer ein fahren. Das Interieur ist im Stil der 60er Jahre. ( War nicht unser Fall - aber Geschmacksache !). Zu bemängeln hatten wir die Sauberkeit der Zimmer ! Für ein fünf Sterne Hotel nicht in Ordnung ! Frühstück sollte man in der Umgebung einnehmen ( Günstiger und Besser ) ! Abendessen allerdings wieder sehr zu empfehlen !

title: Great service and lovely accommodations
text: We spent one night at the Smyth and enjoyed it immensely. Terrific location; comfortable bed; nice bathroom; cozy lounge with two roaring fires (perfect on a cold night). Service was excellent - any request was met courteously and didn't bat an eyelash. Will definitely go back when staying downtown.

title: Smyth Hotel is a gem
text: My family and I travel extensively and I would never normally write a review on TripAdvisor simply because I don't use it to figure out my travel.  However, I am compelled to rave about this hotel because it so far exceeded my expectations.  We have stayed in numerous NYC hotels on overnights in the city and I am always underwhelmed.  At the rudeness, the blandness, the lack of real service or anything resembling what you find in great hotels in other cities in the world.  The Smyth, however, has you at hello.  The rooms are just fine (clean and a nice size, with modern design and comfortable beds), but it is the service from the staff that takes it to the next level.  Sandy welcomed us, and ushered us in, working to alter our reservation so that we were in a room next to our children.  Then he brought them extra peppermint candy when they inhaled the first round.  Patrick ran into traffic to get us taxis and just generally made sure we got our car, our luggage and all of our things together (there were a lot of things).  They were friendly and worked to make sure all of our needs were attended to, without being over the top.  The rest of the front desk staff were equally helpful and friendly.  The food from room service was very good, and room service was quick to fix a mistake they made on our order.  The only service lapse I will note is in the bar, where the server had to be chased down multiple times before our whole party (we were three) could order their drinks, and she seemed less than thrilled to actually take drink and food orders.

title: Agradable estancia
text:
Nos hemos alojado en este hotel por 7 noches durante el mes de diciembre. Perfectamente ubicado en el barrio de Tribeca, con paradas de metro cercanas, la más próxima en la misma puerta, que te permite movilizarte con total soltura por la gran manzana. Habitación amplia, con baño cómodo y preciosas vistas, si es que tu reserva la incluye... Detalles de agua mineral y chocolates todas las noches, adecuada limpieza. Muy buen room service!! Personal distante pero muy atento.
Altamente recomendable!

title: Nice hotel in great location but should be listed as a 4-star hotel, not 5-star
text:
My wife and I visited the Smyth for the first time for a weekend away. We were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed staying in Tribeca  - great restaurants, fewer holiday tourists than in midtown and easy access to the rest of the city by subway. The staff at the hotel were friendly and the room was clean and bed comfortable.

Our only frustration was the hotel was listed on Tripadvisor as a 5-star luxury hotel however the hotel amenities and room were inline with a 4-star hotel. I'd best describe the Smyth as a nicer boutique version of a W hotel. 

We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant "Little Park" and were disappointed both in terms of menu and service. We did like the hotel gym. 

Overall, we had a nice experience at the Smyth and wouldn't discourage anyone from staying at the hotel but we will try another hotel on our next trip to New York.

title: a big dissapointment
text:
I was traveling with my father. during check in, i  was questioned a bout the relationship with him and how do we think sharing a queen room. I didn't understand the purpose of these questions. it was rude, unpolite and we didn't appreciate it after arriving 13 hours long flight.
our requests for high floor with nice view wasn't in your computer.
complimentary water &chocolate wasn't served everyday and if so it was only for 1 person.
breakfast was included, but when we had difficulty with it we were  told to solve it with the restaurant, which was not apart of the hotel and didn't help us.
reception staff wasn't pleasant.
not at all what I accepted from a 5 star hotel.
a big disappointment.

title: Really Nice
text: Booked on Hot Wire not knowing what to expect. Really nice hotel located close to all transportation and several good bars and restaurants. Will definitely use the hotel again in the future and probably sooner than anticipated.

title: Celebrating our Anniversary
text: My wife and I stayed at the Smyth for one night.  Very courteous staff; Amanda provided great services.  Rooms Clean and cozy room, bed was very comfortable; Would recommend this hotel; great scenery nearby and an excellent place to stay

title: Fabulous!
text:
Came here with my other half for our anniversary and my birthday, it's awesome, if you like cool design great cocktails and food in the best location then this is the place for you!
Really set a bench mark.
The staff especially good.

Can't say enough of a thank you. :) 
But here goes ... THANKYOU!! Xxx
We will be back!

title: Great hotel
text: Did not know this hotel and got it on Priceline.  It has a small entrance but great lounge with fireplaces and also a complimentary black car service up to 10 blocks radius.  Everyone was very friendly and the room was full of amenities that hotels much pricier did not have.  It is eighth next to chambers st subway stop and walking distance to great restaurants.  The one negative was breakfast at the restaurant attached to the hotel.  My wife waited 5 min as the greeter finished her phone call then service twice brought out items without items, like coffee without sugar and my oatmeal without a spoon.  The banana bread was excellent there though...

title: The Smyth is the only place to stay in NYC
text: My boss and I stayed at The Smyth to attend a local convention. Not only were the staff very welcoming and hospitable, but also the property is in immaculate shape; I loved the contemporary design of the guest suites and the chic, comfortable lobby provided a nice respite for pre-dinner cordials. I highly recommend this property and look forward to saying 'hi' to The Smyth's entire staff in the near future!

title: Fantastic stay, but....
text:
Such a great hotel, as defined by great staff, great room, great lounge to have guests to come over and chat before dinner in the neighborhood, great restaurant with great wine list (some are rare to find), in other words, I truly think positively of the hotel and will always come back to.  
The only downside is that cigarette smell in the room.  At first I was checked in to a room with cigarette smell left in the room, so they moved me to a different floor.  It was nice room, untill late at night that slowly cigarette smell started growing stronger.  Apparently it came from the ventilation in the bathroom.  The front desk nicely offered me to move, but I thought it will be senseless and who knows the same ducting problem will occur.  So I stayed, by morning, the room was no longer with cigarette smell.  The same thing occured again in the evening.  And hence, it really was the ducting problem.  Pity.  
But, again, this will not stop me to rate this hotel poorly.  In all honesty, it was a great stay, except the cigarette smell.

title: The Smyth has the best of everything
text: Accommodations, friendly and attentive staff, Little Park restaurant, Library and Living Room bars collectively made for a great stay. Located in a true Tribeca neighborhood there is a comfort and ease that is not easily found in NYC.

title: Love this hotel!!
text:
First off, get a room with a balcony. It's one of the best views in NYC of the Empire St Building and B'way. Such a great place to enjoy champagne or eat breakfast. The rooms are tiny, but that is somewhat to be expected in Manhattan. Shower was fantastic and toiletries were C.O. Bigelow and smelled awesome. The staff is so incredibly accommodating and was able to fulfill (almost) every request as they couldn't get us reservations at 11 Mad during our stay. 

The only gripe that I had with the hotel was that they charged me twice for my hotel room, so do check your CC statement! I am still trying to get that worked out.

title: A great choice!
text:
We stayed there for 5 days in May for our wedding. We were two kids and two adults in a family room. 
I have only positive things to say about the hotel. The size of the rooms is good, compared to other hotels in the area. The staff is friendly and helpful, without being intrusive. The little lobby area is relaxing and cozy. The rooms are clean and well equipped with usb chargers, radio clocks and complimentary water and snacks. If you get a chance, get a room towards the front of the hotel for a great view of the New World Trade Center.

title: Didn't want to leave!
text:
This hotel made our NYC weekend.  We were upgraded to suite 710 (it must be one of the best in the house), we didn't ask, they just did it and did we ever appreciate it, I was very sad indeed to leave after 3 nights there.

Suite 710 has a half bath, just as you enter on the inside of the suite, plus a spacious full bathroom with gigantic shower (master bathroom is the size of some NYC hotel rooms in and of itself)!

Location, location, location, this hotel is in Tribeca within easy walking distance to wonderful restaurants, to the World Trade Center memorial, to the financial district, Battery Park, Soho, and finally, steps away from subway station entrances for the ACE and 123 lines.  

Armed with only our carry-ons, we took in the AirTrain Subway from JFK to the Smyth, then took the AirTrain Subway back to JFK.  Cost effective and environmentally friendly, we just took our time to find the correct subway entrance and then the right train to get us back to JFK, the "Far Rockaway" train.

The subway system was the main transportation for us, the Smyth is surrounded by them.  When we decided late in the day on Friday to go to Times Square half price show tickets booth, we naively thought we would take a taxi there --  boy were we crazy, we were walking faster than the taxis and cars were traveling!  Quickly we located the nearest subway station and that did the trick!  Soon we were in Times Square at the ticket booth with an hour to spare before our show started.

Thereafter, we took the subway everywhere, so convenient and cost effective.  Although the subways are old and in need of some upgrades, they function well.  Be forewarned, if you have a handy subway map bring it, they were nowhere to be found in the subway stations we used and it would have been convenient to have had one on us.

Finally, I've got to mention Little Park, the restaurant in the hotel were we had breakfast three days (our hotel package included breakfast).  Was it ever good, fresh, inventive and creative food.  We were lucky enough to have enjoyed Breakfast Brunch on the one Sunday we were there, what an fantastic experience!

We thoroughly enjoyed our magical week-end in Tribeca, in large part due to the Smyth.

title: Vale cada centavo!
text: O hotel tem todas as qualidades: super bem localizado, numa região muito charmosa; é muito confortável, oferece todos os mimos (roupão, chinelo...) e o atendimento é de primeira. A equipe da recepção é atenciosa e prestativa. Tem várias alternativas interessantes de restaurantes e opções para o café da manhã. Lugar para voltar!

title: Plutôt bien!
text: Hotel très bien placé dans le quartier de Tribeca. Chambres agréables et calmes. Cosy. Rien a dire sur le service. Une bonne option pour aller explorer New York. Petit déjeuner moyen en revanche (salle un peu triste et service très très long).  Salle de gym en bas. Et un petit bar très agréable niché derrière l hôtel.

title: I'll be back
text:
Great location with a nice neighborhood feel and not the "hustle-crowded" feeling when staying midtown.
Each and every staff member had a smile and could not be more pleasant and accommodating.
Hotel extremely clean and housekeeping service excellent and timely.
Nice room amenities

title: Daughters wedding
text: My daughter got married at the end of Sept an my entire family stayed here and Smyth did an excellent job not only putting us all on the same floor but with the above and beyond service they provided, especially Tom at the front desk who ran to buy a belt for me, hours before the wedding and Patrick the Bellmen, who had our cars lined up and waiting for us as we departed. Thank You Smyth.

title: Wonderful stay at the Smyth
text:
I used Priceline Express for my hotel reservation, so my room was pre-paid.The lobby is on the small size, but the hotel is in great condition. My room was clean, spacious for NY standards and had everything that I needed. 

The Smyth staff was extremely welcoming and were very attentive. It was pouring rain on the first day of my stay. Not only was there already an umbrella in my closet, they also had plenty at the door when you were leaving. I needed to print something, so I emailed it downstairs to the front desk. I was planning on grabbing the document on my way out, but before I even headed downstairs, the staff had already slipped it under my door. 

In theory, I love the slippers they had (black, furry, slippers), but they broke within 5 minutes of me wearing them; very comfortable, but not very sturdy. I was also not a huge fan of the open shower. However, those are extremely small issues and did not really affect my stay. 

I love that the subway is literally right outside and other lines are in very close proximity. I do wish Tribeca wasn't quite so far down, but the upside is that it's very quiet and not busy.

I would definitely stay at the Smyth again in a hearbeat!

title: Perfectly chic location
text:
Felt clean, modern, spacious, friendly! Will definitely be recommending and revisiting on my next trip to NYC! Great downtown location just blocks from 1WTC! What a surprise!

Also the restaurant is perfect for breakfast before you start the day!

Lounge in lobby also a great spot to work and between meetings!such a nice change from midtown hotels and other downtown spots!

title: What a View!
text: We visit NYC a lot and we finally had a bad experience and had to switch hotels. We found Smyth on TabletHotels and hoped for the best and they delivered! We needed a room with a window. The room we got had amazing floor to ceiling windows that overlooked W. Broadway. The room was bright and airy. The neighborhood is great and the subway is just down the block so it's very convenient to get uptown. Make sure you book a room facing the street and not the back of the hotel. Also, just know there is street noise but when closed, the windows drown it out very well. We prefer to have the windows open most of the time, weather permitting. The staff are great and very helpful! We loved this hotel and will definitely return.

title: Everything awesome!
text: I felt so well taken care of in this perfectly located, perfectly appointed hotel.From early check in after a red eye cross country flight to impeccable and fast and reasonably priced room service to a very quiet sleep, I can't wait to come back!

title: Manhattan Chic
text: Nice rooms, very chic atmosphere at a very trendy part of manhattan. We were there last summer, and while there were some renovations underway the team still gave us a very professional treatment that made us forget entirely about any potential inconvenience.

title: A great place to stay
text: We stayed in TriBeCa for the first time and this was simply the best hotel to stay in. The service is superb, the hotel is well designed, the rooms are a decent size and the location is ideal. Definitely worth staying there and we will do so again

title: Great location
text: Very good hotel and so conveniently located near the World Trade Center & with the Chambers St subway right outside that conveniently connects to a number of subway routes. The rooms are modern & comfortable. The staff have been very courteous & helpful making us feel like we are home with Patrick the Bellman very helpful & obliging. Also very good facilities nearby with a very good Laundry services opposite the hotel.

title: Fantastic find!
text:
From the minuet my wife and I walked into the Smyth we felt very comfortable. The front desk and house staff were fantastic. They had our room ready for us at 9:30 Am when we arrived . Upon my wife's inspection...LOL ... bathroom was immaculately clean and comfortable. Lots of space to unpack our bags. A quick call to the front desk got us bottles of water, ice and comfy robes. 
Our only compliant was we booked their car service for a 10:30 ride to SOHO that never came. Although the front desk got us a cab out front quickly for us.
After many stays in NYC the Smyth is on the top of our list if staying in the lower Manhattan area.

title: Beautiful Hotel - Great Location - minor issues
text:
This hotel is modern, trendy and comfortable. Very friendly staff from the door service to the front desk to the maids. We were a little let down that there wasn't a concierge to recommend restaurants and things to do in the area, but we had plenty of other sources for that. The restaurants connected to the hotel were upscale without being snooty and the meal we had there (brunch) was delicious. The location is great - you can see Freedom Tower from most rooms and is walkable to Battery Park and the financial district.

The rooms were spacious especially for the city and the bed was very comfortable. My only complaints were the bathroom set up was a little odd - no fan to get rid of steam from the shower, plus there wasn't a latching door to the main room (just a slider) and therefore made the whole room seem very "wet". We called down to try to get the dehumidifier fixed, but nothing changed. Not a huge deal, but as a result it wasn't a great sleep. 

In short: PROS - fantastic location downtown, trendy/urban feel, great staff
CONS - Room felt sticky the whole weekend, not a lot of knowledge about the surrounding area.

Would recommend highly if we had a different room I think

title: Great Place to Stay
text: This was a fantastic hotel to stay during our vacation. The hotel staff was fantastic from the time we arrived until we departed. Jordan and Thomas on Desk and Patrick the Bellman were fantastic, professional and courteous. The ambience of all areas of the location from guest room to bar was very European. Highly recommend!

title: Impeccable Service
text: There are many hotels in NYC, and I have stayed in many of them in this stylish category.  But what sets the Smyth apart as a standout is the staff and the service!  Patrick at the door, all of the front desk staff who went over and above with a baby gift for my new grand daughter's birth.. They have set the bar for me.

title: Wow!Amazing hotel!
text:
From the minute we were greeted by Patrick the bellman and Tom at the front destroy,we were impressed. These 2 young men went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable. They were a delight! And , the staff at the front desk the next day was equally as nice and accommodating.

The room was lovely with great lighting, and terrific amenities.

 This is a wonderful hotel in a great, hip location. Loved it and will return again soon.
 Bravo Tom and Patrick! Thanks for a flawless stay. 

Ann and Michael Gursey, Aspen, Colorado

title: Not the 5 star experience I was expecting
text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in a Superior Queen room and paid 328 USD per night not including taxes. For this amount of money I think the room is fairly small even by NYC standards and definitely for the class of hotel that it is advertised to be. This is especially true when compared to the Refinery hotel that I had stayed in earlier in my trip. The rooms are nicely decorated though and have all the expected amenities and the ever important power outlets by the bed. For me the biggest issues with the room were the very small window which faced an internal courtyard and the lack of cellular reception. The free internet worked well however. The staff were very helpful with suggestions and journey planning and sorted out some billing issues satisfactorily. Be careful with the terms of any inclusive breakfast in the hotel restaurant as this may cause confusion. The food at the restaurant was very nice though. I would consider staying here again but it would be very price and room dependent. I would not recommend booking the superior queen room type as I don't believe this can meet the expectations of a 5 star hotel guest.

title: Muito bom
text: Hotel muito bom, pois possibilita trazer seu animalbde estimaçao, coisa que poucos hoteis permitem. O atendimento foi muito bom. O restaurante do hotelbserve otimas refeiçoes e o quarto em si é muito especoço e aconchegante. Adoreive recomendo.

title: Girls Weekend
text: We stayed here on a girls weekend about a month ago and had an absolutely amazing experience! All of the front desk staff, especially Fabien, were outstanding! He went out of his way to make our stay special. We were also very happy with our terry cloth robes in the rooms.

title: Misleading and Disappointing in Multiple Ways
text:
I had a poor experience at this hotel last week during a one night stay.  The hotel was misleading in many ways, detailed here:
- Location: Despite being advertised as a "Tribeca" hotel, it is clearly south of Chambers Street and technically in the Financial District.  A good example of misleading branding; we were 2 miles further south of where we intended to be.
- Service: The hotel was two hours late to check us in, had us wait in the lobby (which is tiny and cramped) for a long time to get keys, and "valet" parking takes 30 minutes to retrieve your car, which they don't tell you in advance (thanks, I was late to a meeting).  All very underwhelming.
- Quality: For a $550/night hotel, a very disappointing room and lobby experience.  No breakfast or restaurant, the room itself had thin windows (great road noise) and no door for the toilet (so odd).  The bed was sufficiently comfortable, but that's about the only good thing here. Wi-fi does not work. 

Overall, a disappointing experience and I certainly will not return.

title: Homely vibe in the heart of Manhattan
text: This place has similar era decor to our home in London so as soon as I walked in, I felt kind of warm and fuzzy. Tasty crab pasta supper at Little Park to start our stay at The Smyth. Great corner suite on the 5th floor for our first couple of days, which sadly was booked out on our return after a day out of town, but, we managed to find a room we liked after a few trys. Staff are the major asset here, most notably for us in particular, Enoch, Patrick & Sandy and also thanks to Yana for taking great care of us. They were the friendliest folk at any hotel that we've ever stayed at here and that's decidedly un-Manhattan, in our experience at least. Well worth a visit.

title: My favorite staycation hotel
text: My wife and I wanted a special birthday weekend in NYC so we booked the Smyth. From the moment that Patrick met us curbside we knew we had made the right choice. Tom at the front desk greeted us like old friends. Patrick got us settled in, gave us a rundown of the area and booked us into a spectacular restaurant. All seamlessly done. The rooms are much larger than the typical boutique hotel, comfortable and stylish. With Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown and Wall Street right outside your door I cannot think of a better location. If you want to get away, have a pressure free vacation let the people at the Smyth be your hosts.

title: Great Boutique
text: This is a great hotel for its location and price.  The rooms sizes are typical of NYC, but very updated and comfortable.  The staff are always helpful.  The lobby bar isn't the greatest, but sufficient.  The beds are very comfortable and upscale.  I definitely recommend staying here if the location is what you need.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel
text: The Smyth was wonderful.  Our room was quite and spacious for NYC.  We loved the location.  It was very convenient.  Patrick, doorman/bell person was awesome!  Everyone on the staff was welcoming.  Room was clean and in great shape.  I wish there was a coffee maker in the room for morning.  Other than that, it was PERFECT!

title: Amazing service, beautiful views, awesome location.
text: Our stay at the Smyth was comfortable, stylish, and perfect for our one night staycation. The location is unbeatable, and the views of Tribeca from our suite were beautiful. Our before dinner drinks at Evening Bar were  delicious, one of the best cocktails I've had in the city! Dinner at Little Park was also delicious, and we slept very well that night in our huge king bed.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: We spent 3 nights in the Smyth Hotel in Tribeca.  From the moment we arrived the front desk staff couldn't be more welcoming! Efficiency and service is always welcome after a long plane ride.  Patrick the bellman was very helpful and The rooms are large and beds are comfortable.  The hotel has been totally. renovated in the past 5 years.  This location lends itself for touring the 9/11 museum and taking the ferry to Ellis Island.

title: Great hotel and service!
text: We stayed at the Smyth hotel in Tribeca over Labor Day weekend and was very happy with the room and the great service. Our room was comfortable, large enough, and beautiful.
