The hotel's location was great and the staff were very friendly and helpful!! Our bellman, Patrick in particular was great!! We will definitely stay again!

title: Huge room, great boutique feel and superb service
text: Really enjoyed my stay Dec last year. Paid approx $200 p/n which given the quality of experience was well worth it. Location is great if not perfect ... Certainly convenient for subway etc. Service excellent- desk assisted me with everything I needed always in a positively winning attitude. Room is well appointed and HUGE for NY standard. Great bar and vibe for 30/40 something's...

title: Loved the location and the service
text: The service was as good as it gets! Patrick at the door couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Same was true for Tom at the front desk. Loved the location, right in the heart of Tribeca and on the edge of Soho. Rooms were spacious and well air-conditioned. Very nice comfortable lounge. Only complaint was that they did not have a full-length mirror in the bedroom. When you are in NYC for a special occasion, that would have been a welcome feature.

title: A great luxury room in a great location
text:
We stayed for two 'mini-vacation' days away from the kids, during a recent two week trip to NYC.  With limited time to revert to grownups (as opposed to parents), we greatly appreciated the understated sophistication of the Smyth, and the warm professionalism of the staff.  
Our suite was fantastic, the furnishings were mid-century modern, without a hint of pretention or overdesign.  the Kitchenette was well stocked with espresso, demi bottles of wine, all the things that we needed for a great break from our kid-heavy vacation!
We will be returning on future visits.

title: Lovely stay and GREAT location
text:
Spent a few nights at this spot....great experience.

Staff was nice as can be! Loved the thin mint cookie every night!

Location is amazing. The subway is a step away and that Chambers St stop has Local/Express service which is a massive plus.

Room was excellent. Much more spacious than any other room that I had previously stayed in NYC.

Will absolutely stay again. A real treat

PS. The hotel bar is a great spot to grab a drink!

title: Wedding weekend at the Smyth
text: Our daughter got married in Tribeca and we booked a block of rooms for our family and friends. The hotel was very accommodating. They upgraded the groom's parents and us, the brides' parents. The were very attentive and responded to all our needs. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We would highly recommend them to anyone who wants a lovely place to stay in NY.

title: Spectacular, a TriBeCa gem!
text: Loved everything about this hotel, from the moment you walk in you notice the sophistication and elegance of meticulous and crafted design. Staff: Patrick, Lida and Nika were very accommodating and pleasant. Loved the speakeasy bar and their creative cocktails, the gin and tonic it's a must have, awesome! This hotel will be on my list of repeats for business travel to NYC.

title: Quick NYC weekend trip
text: Staff was very friendly, Hotel was quiet with good size rooms for New York City.  Location was easily accessible if you have anything to do in lower Manhattan.  They also offered a hotel car to drop you off, however within a few blocks only..

title: Loved It.
text:
We had a spectacular stay at the Smyth Hotel in Tribeca. I stayed there with 3 other friends and we had nothing but the best service from all staff especially Fabian at the front desk. 
The staff was extremely knowledgable of the surrounding areas and provided great food/sight-seeing recommendations.  I will definitely return!

title: NYC trip with college daughter
text:
Just ask for Patrick ....he knows everything about the city and was wonderful to us.
This is a boutique hotel and was in a great location for Subway access. If you want to be out of the noise and hustle and bustle, yet able to get to Soho, Chelsea, etc....this is the place to stay.

title: Great service
text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Smyth for a quick visit to NYC.  The hotel is in a trendy neighborhood in New York with easy access to subways. The room was typically small but very comfortable.  Furnishings were not impressive for the star rating.  The bathroom was not very private or impressive.  We booked on Priceline and had an exceptional price so the room was worth the money but if I paid the standard rate I would have been disappointed. The service from the front desk as well as at the restaurant made the experience exceptional.

title: Icon in TriBeCa
text:
A business trip to NY implies long days, walking to and from work, eateries and taking in a few minutes of city sights and sounds. 

In terms of location it is perfect. Close to the meetings and near tons of great places to grab a quick bite or to have a unhurried dinner. 

My room had no view but was super quiet. Maybe request a view, I think there should be rooms facing the towards the Hudson. 

Only used the restaurant for breakfast which, was excellent. 

Staff was friendly and attentive. Glad to recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

title: Amazing Hotel and Even More Amazing Staff!
text: I LOVE the Smyth hotel.  It's a gorgeous boutique hotel in Tribeca with unbelievably comfortable beds and a great location (the 1,2,3 is right outside the front door).  The staff at the hotel is also delightful.  I regularly stay at the Smyth while traveling to New York for work, and the last time I was there, it took them a few minutes longer than usual to find my reservation.  I only had to wait about 5 minutes, but Ean apologized for the delay and upgraded me to the nicest hotel suite I have ever seen. It had great bedroom and beautiful bathroom with a giant living room, separate dining room, and --the best part--a spacious private deck overlooking Tribeca.  Everyone was so nice.  Ean and the rest of the staff went out of their way to make me feel appreciated as a guest.  I will be returning to the Smyth for all of my upcoming work trips!

title: Tribeca
text: First time staying in the Tribeca/Downtown/Battery Park area now that our company sold to RBC (by the new WTC).  All other hotels close by were sold out so I picked Smyth due to having a reasonable rate and walking distance to WTC.  I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel.  Very hip hotel in a hip area but with an extremely nice staff - I'm talking every from the person holding the door open to the top management.  Hotel was clean and well appointed for an older building.  The bar made fantastic cocktails (get the Manhattan with rye over one giant ice cube with a twist of lemon...).  I didn't get a chance to eat at the hotel, but it was packed full of people and it smelled delicious.  Smyth is great for personal or business trips.

title: Excellent New York base
text: Very comfortable boutique style hotel in good location. Good modern rooms and bathrooms. Very professional & friendly staff, particularly Enoch Nimene the Assistant Manager who responded immediately when we had a small problem.

title: The Smyth is a phenomenal hotel
text: We booked the Smyth for out of town guests for my son's wedding.  The hotel was amazing!  The staff was extremely accommodating.  Anything we asked of the staff they did.  The hotel graciously gave us room upgrades which they did not have to do.  The hotel is beautifully decorated.  The room sizes are great.  The beds are comfortable and the atmosphere is calm, chic and classy.   The suite on the 8th floor with its unbelievable terrace is worth experiencing.   We cannot say enough positive things about this hotel.  We highly recommend it.  We would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: The Smyth to the rescue!
text: The Smyth was fantastic! By far one of the nicest hotels that I've experienced in New York. I stayed in the corner room with a great view of One World. Additionally, the staff was fantastic. After losing my luggage in a New York cab, Tom came to the rescue and gave me invaluable advice on how to get it back.

title: Classy and gorgeous hotel
text: We haven't even checked out of the hotel yet, but just cannot say enough good things about it! It has been the perfect place to stay. The amenities are luxurious and the robes are fantastic. Convenient location to trains and to get to Brooklyn. By far the best part of the stay is the staff. No NYC sass or pretentious attitudes. Every one was incredibly professional, friendly and helpful, especially Fabien. He is a true asset to the hotel! Thanks for a great stay!

title: A New Favorite in NYC
text:
The Smyth Hotel in TriBeCa quickly became our new favorite in NYC. It has a modern, stylish & clean design yet spacious rooms with NYC views.   The location in TriBeCa is convenient but not overcrowded.

All of the staff, yet Patrick in particular went out of his way to be friendly, helpful and accommodating.  Assisting us with excellent restaurant recommendations and reservations to securing last minute cabs when a car service didn't arrive, as well as all the many details in between.  Each person was happy to make our stay enjoyable.  

The Little Park Restaurant is attached to the hotel with either indoor or outdoor dining.  We enjoyed many delicious breakfasts here always with friendly service.   

We've stayed at many hotels in NYC and this is by far our favorite.

title: Most helpful staff...
text: Whether Patrick and Mo the Bellmen, or the receptionists they were the most helpful staff in NYC. Nice rooms. Loved the first aid kit in the rooms. Tribeca location very arty with proximity to a wide range of delightful restaurants. Abit of a ride -tho' not way too far - for those who love their shopping.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: We were a family of five who had two adjoining rooms at the Smyth. The service was great; we were treated warmly by the friendly staff. The rooms were clean and comfortable. With the subway station right outside the door, and within walking distance of the Freedom Tower, we felt like we were minutes from any site we wanted to see. We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

title: Stylish Stay
text: The Smyth is a great hotel in a great location at TriBeCa. Good connections to explore NYC within walking distance, staff very professional and polite. Patrick and Tom were very helpful throughout stay. It's a good idea to contact the hotel directly for the best rate; this certainly worked for me!

title: Sensational stay at the Smyth
text:
Best Concierge - Can organise anything at any time
Best Bellman - Patrick that is you
Best Location - My favourite part of the city
Best Atmosphere - Very cool atmosphere

I am checking back in on Sunday and I am really looking forward to my stay.

title: Great location & Excellent service!
text: I was traveling on business and stayed at The Smyth. I was WOWED! The hotel is located in such a perfect location. Its not stuffy, its trendy, low key, but has a luxury feel to it. Huge shout out to Moe, Tom, and Fabian for making my stay incredible. They were extremely welcoming, friendly and personable. The food was also excellent... and well presented. Room size was great, clean, and relaxing! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

title: Amazing Stay
text: Diana and Patrick made our stay awesome! Service was great and the staff go out of their way to make your stay memorable. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant, Little Park..... the food was superior. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Good location
text: Nice mid-century modern furnishings, cool style.  We wished that we did not have to hear movements in the room above ours.  We liked the way the bathroom was split by the glass of the shower.  This is a good location, you can step out the door and explore Tribeca.

title: Superb!
text: This hotel is just wonderful! The staff were delightful and gave us a free upgrade to the most incredibly spacious room wit our own large balcony, king bed and huge bathroom! Everything was spotless and so incredibly comfortable! Perfect location... Quiter, away from the tourist and in a really trendy area close to Bubby's pie company which is a superb restaurant! Although the room service here was also great! We especially enjoyed the breakfast sausages and granola! Helpful, polite staff... no hotel has made us feel more looked after! The perfect stay! Worth paying the little bed extra in our opinion! You will not be disappointed if you stay here!

title: Opulent Tribeca Oasis
text:
Tremendous experience from the moment I made my reservation to a few days after I left, leaving me craving more! The personalization that left no detail spared made my weekend getaway one of the best yet (pre-check in and text confirmation…OBSESSED)! The entire staff couldn't have been more genuine and it was blatantly obvious that they were as thrilled to be there as I was. Sandy the bellman was phenomenal and kept me laughing! Staff was professional, knowledgable & impressive with their guest recognition skills of always using my name. The property was the perfect amount of 'Tribeca chic' with spacious immaculate rooms & amenities. Even the gym was always on-point and the cold wash clothes post-workouts were such a refresher. A big kuddo's for Jon Goldberg & his entire team at the Smyth for leaving such an amazing experience and making me feel so welcome- true hospitality at it's finest! It's safe to say that this is the only hotel I ever plan on staying at again in New York!

The only unfortunate part was that I didn't get to spend nearly as much time there as I wanted!

title: Family weekend
text: We received outstanding assistance booking our rooms for the weekend from Daniel Johnson who was friendly and attended to every detail that mattered to us. The rooms were surprisingly spacious and not surprisingly lovely and comfortable. What a great location in NYC with wonderful amenities, super friendly and competent staff and access to cool lobby spaces and food and bar. We didn't get to experience the spa but we look forward to coming back and working again with Daniel Johnson on another fabulous weekend!

title: Great for anniversary
text: Nice and modern hotel. Large rooms, tidy and sleek. Staff was very professional, friendly and service minded. Perfect location. 5 min to One world Trade center. Subway right outside. Safe hoods.Top notch!

title: Location,location,location
text: Mid town is like staying at Disneyworld. Tribeca is like staying with the locals, albeit wealthy locals.  This is a superb modern comfortable hotel it works so well on all levels.  Immaculately maintained and clean. The Deluxe rooms are spacious great see through bathroom with walk in shower. Theres even a car service that doesn't seem to get used often and the restaurant on site is very good.  The location is excellent with subways 1,2,3 outside and ACE just up the road.  You can dine out in this area for a year and not go to the same place twice.  If the rate is right stay here it's great and I can't think of anything negative  They used to charge for wifi but got  smart and built it into the room rate.  I would only stay here in NYC if I had a choice  but not for $500 a night. - that's just too much to put your head on a pillow...anywhere

title: Very Nice - Boutique Hotel in Great Location
text: The Smyth Hotel was almost perfect.  Located in a prime area for restaurants, parks, walking, subway and 9/11 Museum.  The hotel is European style modern with nice rooms, great beds and very quiet.  Priced reasonably, especially for NYC.  They have a lounge area with cocktails and books...nice for waiting, relaxing or working.  Service was a bit spotty.  Doormen were all about helping, front desk staff were mostly helpful.  Lot's of guests were asking for directions and sightseeing tips and all staff seemed helpful.  The front desk is small and can only check in 2 guests at a time.  The staff gets a bit overwhelmed and don't always have the ability to respond to requests.  The hotel also has the Little Park Restaurant which is very nice and the subject of a separate review.  I would stay there again.

title: Great Find in Tribeca
text: We go to NYC every couple of years. Totally loved our first stay in Tribeca. Totally loved The Smyth Hotel (which is actually pronounced Smith -- it has some odd marketing hook that it's located at the intersection of two roads that form a Y, hence the name.) What everyone says about the staff is true. No attitude. Very helpful. Nice people that make your stay enjoyable. The location on West Broadway is ideal -- easy walking to the restaurants. If you want a sushi experience that is amazing, try Nobu Next Door, but take your platinum Visa (delicious food, but holy cow, that's some bill!) The lobby of the hotel is really nice too. Comfortable couches and tables to have a glass of wine or browse their extensive selection of art books. We didn't splurge on the room, and took only the basic size. But we got a lucky bonus: Outdoor space. A little terrace with a couple of chairs. Fabulous. If you want this, you need the 9th floor. The room itself was pretty small, but the terrace really made up for it. The bathroom was large by comparison and had a huge shower. Had breakfast in the restaurant on the last day -- not bad. Overall -- we'd stay here again without a moment's hesitation.

title: Great hotel!!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Smyth Hotel. The employees were extremely helpful and a pleasure to speak with.  The Little Park restaurant was delish!!  It,was a short walk to the 911 museum. A great place!!'

title: Location, location, location - what they say is all true!
text: Perfect getaway weekend to NYC. Walking through Tribeca into Soho and stopping to people watch in Washington Square Park. Food, shops and gallaries along the way make the walk a great urban adventure. Hotel is staffed by young angels in hotel uniforms, warm, helpful and did I mention young. Great place to stay for whatever reason that brings you to the city.

title: Modern and classy hotel in good location
text:
Our visit started with  friendly and service minded greetings by Patrick the Bellman and Fabian at the front desk.
Our room was 32 m2 with large windows and modern designed furniture. The bed was very comfortable and the batroom was clean with lot of towels. Although we missed some hooks. Also, there were no shower splash screen with a constant wet floor as result. Shave mirror missing.
No designated reading lamp by the bed.
The overall experience was very positive, all staff was very professional, friendly and service minded. We would choose to stay at the hotel again in the future.

title: Chic, stylish hotel in the heart of Tribeca
text: I visited the hotel in July for a five day business trip.  The staff were so helpful and helpful without being overwhelming.  My room was large by New York standards, with a very, very comfortable bed, lovely sitting area with view onto the street.  Loved the bathroom especially the shower!  The Little Park restaurant, which is part of the hotel, is lovely with a section on the pavement.  Tribeca area is wonderful,and has the feel of a very stylish neighbourhood.  The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the waterfront and Soho, along with many other attractions .  Great experience all round.

title: Amazing!!!
text: My husband and I visited the hotel on July 4th and absolutely fell in love with it!  From the staff, which was very friendly and helpful, to the hotel suite itself, which was immaculate and absolutely the best hotel suite we have ever stayed at; words cannot begin to express what a wonderful experience it was. If you are ever in the Tribeca area, you definitely have to stay at the Smyth Hotel.  The location is perfect!!  There are many restaurants, landmarks and public transportation near by.  Cannot wait to visit them again!

title: Was there for a stay before we were in The World Cup Champion Parade
text: The room was modern, clean and outstanding!!! The price was very reasonable for my daughter and I. The Staff was beyond helpful, kind and pleasant from the front desk, the staff in the restaurants, valet, and mostly Patrick and Joe the Bellmen!! Being on a tight schedule to get to the signing in for the parade, and leave after with major street blocks, these bellmen went beyond to get us all the info, and help we needed, always pleasant!! The restaurant has amazing food, and we enjoyed this stay, 5 stars!!!

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: We arrived Friday afternoon, we were greeted by Patrick the Bellman, who made us feel immediately welcome. He took care of everything required to get us settled. Check in was smooth and accommodating. We were pleasantly surprised on how spacious and stylish the room was. Overall, we spend a lot of time in the Meat Packing District, we throughly enjoyed the Tribeca and Soho area and scene. Shopping, Dining and Bars (WARD 3 Shout out to the Mixologist) were a blast!!! Highly recommend this Hotel and Area..:) Enjoy!!!

title: Smyth a Winner!
text: My second visit to Smyth.  First was a business trip two years ago; this time a weekend trip with my wife.  Came back because first experience good.  Since then, the lobby has been remodeled (beautifully), and other changes made to improve the hotel.  Excellent place to stay "downtown," with a very helpful staff (especially Fabien at the front desk and Patrick the bellman).  Restaurant in the hotel is also superb.  Stylish but not stuffy.  Highly recommended.

title: Great stay at the Smyth
text: Great location!  Very friendly, helpful employees  (especially Sandy)!  Rooms are very clean and the beds are very comfortable with crisp white sheets and comforters. They also have a very nice bar.  I did not try the restaurant .Go for it!

title: Tribecca Getaway
text: My recent stay at Smyth was flawless. Everyone was so helpful and the room super cozy. I will definitely be back! Make sure you check out Little Park while you are there. The food was amazing. The bath products were also wonderful.

title: Amazing Experience!
text:
We have visited NYC a number of times and this was by far, the best hotel we have stayed at. The staff were incredibly helpful and everyone went above and beyond. What makes this boutique and swanky hotel even better--was the fact they allow dogs! It was so nice to bring our Frenchie (whom everyone fell in love with) and have her and us so welcomed. 

From the moment the bellman, Patrick met us at the door and handled all our luggage and pup amenities--to the surprise birthday flower bouquet they left in my room--everything was perfection. Even the rain didn't stop us and they were great about providing transport service and umbrellas!

The decor is cozy and lots of little nooks to relax. Make sure to grab a drink late night in their bar!

I would 100% recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a great location, intimate and personalized stay.

title: Lovely hotel -Will definitely return!
text: We stayed 8 days in this wonderful hotel. It was our first trip to New York so we were not familiar with the city (apart from guide books etc). The staff was very helpful. They arranged with reservations, recommendations and much more . The hotel was centrally located, especially in terms of transport. It's also quiet and nice neighborhood. We were several pairs of friends who stayed at the hotel during the same stay and we were all mighty happy. Will definitely return!

title: Best NYC experience ever!
text:
We've came to NYC to get married.
Due to last minutes change, we had the reservation set only 1 day before we came to the city, and we choose the Smyth because of its location and overall rating.
When they have heard we were getting married that week, we were upgraded us to the king suite and made our 4 nights stay absolutely amazing, it is huge, with a great decor, very quiet and with a fantastic salon and bathroom.
The services was just unbelievable, friendly and even more important professional and personal!. We felt they really care and they did all they could to make our stay superb! 
They even helped our family to "spoil us " with an amazing fruit bouquet delivery on our special day.
The location itself, was just perfect. So many attractions and places to hang/eat/drink at a walking distance, and those which aren't, can be reached so easily by the subway located just next to the hotel (at the same block).

Patrick the concierge and the front desk people as well as the driver gave the best service we've ever got in a NYC hotel.
we'll definitely want to get there back on our next NYC stay

title: Wonderful stay in the perfect hotel
text: Thank you for making my stay perfect at Smyth Thompson. Great room, awesome food and location. Enjoyed the wonderful breakfast menu at Little Park the restaurant. The hotel staff were fantastic especially Patrick the bellman and Antu at the front desk. Thank you to Franck the concierge who organized flowers for my clients, great restaurant bookings and a wonderful salon.

title: Great !
text:
If you are looking for a small boutique hotel, friendly and helpful staff THIS IS THE PLACE.
TriBeca is a fun place to stay and explore. The Smyth is a fabulous jump off point for this activity. The Hotel staff from the doorman to the bellhop to the concierge to the front desk staff and even to senior management , they were all most helpful and listened to your wants when making suggestions. Room was minimalistic BUT most comfortable and a great nights sleep after a full day in NYC. Hotel restaurant was excellent .
Will certainly return to enjoy the Smyth's hospitality again.

title: Great little boutique hotel in NYC
text: Smyth is a great little boutique hotel in the TriBeCa area of Manhattan. The lobby seemed quite small at first, but that is actually just the check in area. There is a funky, retro-modern but comfortable lounge on one side with lounge seating and cocktail seating, and a small restaurant and bar on the other. The rooms are well appointed and the beds are comfortable. My only issue with the room was the poor and uneven bathroom lighting - as a female, that makes makeup application a little tricky. But honestly, what stands out above all to me is the wonderful hotel staff. They were friendly and helpful throughout our stay, and made efforts to be of assistance beyond anything that is expected. I think they brought our level of satisfaction with the hotel up a notch just being who they are. And a special shout out to Sandy who really went the extra mile to get us some particular information we asked about AFTER our return home. Kudos!

title: A great place to stay with an excellent staff!
text: We spent Memorial Day weekend at the Smyth. They were very responsive to our requests and were very helpful. Natasha was our server at the cafe and she was wonderful! We ended up sitting outside with some wine for a long, long time after lunch and she couldn't have been nicer. Lida, at the front desk, helped us switch to a room more suited to us and Patrick, our bellman, was really friendly and had some great suggestions about things to do. He also helped us figure out some of the logistics for the things we wanted to do. I'd definitely go back!!

title: Return to Tribeca
text: This is our fourth time back to the Smyth Hotel. We were warningly greeted by the doorman Patrick, and equally greeted by Tom and Dan at the front desk. The room was clean and well presented. The hotel is close to the metro and an easy walk to sites nearby. A must stay when in NYC!

title: Amazing boutique hotel!
text: Absolutely loved this hotel!!  5 star luxury boutique, with a home-like feel.  Great bar and the restaurant 'Little Park' was superb!  Amazingly fresh food with so much flavour. The staff really do go above and beyond and make you feel very welcome.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!

title: Love the Smyth Hotel in Tribeca
text:
Great hotel!  Very clean, super comfy beds and linens, very nice modern interior finishes.  Plus the staff is great.  Also, very convenient to subway.  Tribeca is also a great relaxed neighborhood with great bars, restaurants, jogging along the Hudson, etc.

Can't go wrong with this hotel!

title: In and out
text:
Into nyc for just one night for an anniversary dinner. Hotel was exactly as advertised and we were treated great.  Patrick was always at hand to attend to all of our needs.
would highly recommend. High floor room was requested and honored. Very quiet and comfortable.

title: Fantastic Staff (particularly Sandy)
text:
I had a fantastic stay in this hotel and will definitely head back soon. The staff are all absolutely fantastic. Tom was great all weekend and Sandy the Bellman was an absolute stand out. 

A great place to stay for sure.

title: Patrick ROCKS
text: great food. top service. in particular, patrick the bellman went beyond the usual. very impressed. keep that boy happy. the hotel is very high calibre. highly recommended for visitors to NY. worth the extra expense.

title: Great location in TriBeCa
text:
We stayed at the Smyth for two nights after we moved out from our NY apartment. The hotel is modern and has a great location in TriBeCa - not so much in the thick of things like Soho but definitely a short cab ride or even walk away from Soho and West Village where there are shops and restaurants. There's a Wholefoods about 5 minutes away which is convenient as well.

We booked a standard room - the room had a modern decor, not the most spacious but enough room for two. We did not have any views and there was not a whole lot of natural light. The bed is a king size and very comfortable - the bathroom has most of the usual amenities. 

The staff there were helpful and welcoming, and the food at Little Park was really good - portions for dinner are quite small but if you get multiple dishes to share you can enjoy a bit of everything. Also their bar is quite nice and perhaps it was because it was a weekday but it seemed like a good spot for a quiet drink - I note however that service wasn't at its best.

We definitely enjoyed our stay and would consider going back on our next trip to NY.

title: Snappy, Fantastic and my Hotel Of Choice
text:
I stayed here with my wife back in December and somehow forgot to write this review.  
TriBeCa is a fantastic area of town. The hotel has super easy access to the Subway across the street. The neighborhood has the little things you would expect to be able to walk out the front door and find a coffee and bagel or breakfast sandwich.

Service:
Outstanding. Little things made the trip. Like umbrellas when it rained, or forgot to put something in my room, so they ran it up for me. Espresso while we waiting for our room to be ready, or Champagne and chocolates for our anniversary. For me, a hotel is make or break 5 stars based on these little things.  

Room: We stayed in a deluxe king if I remember correctly. Lots of space. Two TV's, couch, Rain Shower, Bath Tub, comfortable bed. View was nothing to call home about, but really not a big deal. Shower was fantastic with awesome soaps.  Plenty of storage space. News paper delivered in the AM.

Bar: We had a few drinks and really enjoyed everything we had. It's kinda hidden and makes it feel special. 

This no attitude, helpful staff is exactly what I want when in NYC.

title: Hôtel très agréable et bien situé dans TRIBECA
text: Nous avons passé, ma sœur et moi, une semaine dans cet hôtel, du 8 au 13 juin 2015, et avons beaucoup apprécié. Idéalement situé, non loin de SoHo et du Pont de Brooklyn avec également une station de métro toute proche, cet hôtel est très agréable. La chambre que nous avions était spacieuse et confortable. Un grand merci à Patrick le "Bellman" pour sa gentillesse, sa courtoisie et sa disponibilité.

title: Great hotel
text: Great place, amazing service (particularly for NYC).  No attitude at all.  Patrick the Bellman stood out in particular.  Nice, cozy bar downstairs.  Perfect downtown location - walking distance to many awesome restaurants. Subway is right outside the front door, or you can use their complimentary car service. Would definitely stay there again!

title: Warm and welcoming
text: The smythe in TriBeCa is a great hotel to be in while in ny. The staff is welcoming and very helpful. The rooms are clean, beautiful and the bathrooms gorgeous. We ate in the restaurant and the food was great and the service outstanding.....we were in a rush and they were very accommodating. A great place to be away from home.

title: Lovely food, great service
text:
Went here with a work colleague for a social dinner. The food was very tasty and the staff were excellent. I would suggest that the sharing plates were probably a little small for two but the quality is right up there. And the Nebiollo was very good indeed. 

Would very happily eat here again.

title: Great location, but needs more attention to detail
text: I LOVE the location of this hotel and the public spaces downstairs are kind of cool, and the rooms are pretty large for New York, but the place needs some TLC.  Compared to other boutique hotels in the Tribeca (and for the price) it needs doors that don't stick (so you have to shoulder your way into them), better room service (the food was pretty unremarkable), better housekeeping (sometimes it was hard to tell if the bathroom had been tended to or not, very little general straightening up of things -- more like the bare minimum done for housekeeping), and more comfortable beds and bedding...

title: It was okay
text:
I don't often stay downtown, generally midtown hotels, but thought I'd try downtown for a change. The Smyth is a nice, very casual hotel. Hotel lobby is more like a living room . It was clean , staff were super and would do anything. I prefer a more upscale hotel, but this little hotel was nice and comfortable feel. 
The restaurant attached had great breakfast options, excellent service.
Bar closed at 10:30 Sunday night !

title: Lovely hotel in great location!
text:
Really enjoyed our stay at the Smyth in Tribeca.  
This is a very nice boutique hotel with excellent staff.  
Actually the staff made it a better experience.  We didn't get to find out all their names but Patrick is fantastic.  So friendly and helpful.  But all the staff were.

Our room was nice but it was all the extra touches that made it so much better.  
What is required in your room has been thought about so you don't have to ask for it.
Umbrellas (which were used during a huge downpour!), iron and ironing board for example and the bathroom comes with slippers, robes, plenty of towels, luxiourious toiletries and a really good hairdryer!  The pillows were super comfy too, you sunk in to them after a long day out in the city.

The subway station outside the hotel is so convenient, we were on the Upper West Side in 20 minutes!  A few blocks and you are in the Finance District in one direction and Soho in the other direction.  We'd stay here again.

title: Pleasant and personable hotel in a great location
text:
We had a very nice stay at the Smyth Tribeca. Our rooms were comfortable,
quite, clean and to our delight had  beautiful balconies. The staff were friendly
and accommodating. We had a great dinner at the restaurant, excellent service and food.

title: Smyth is Amazing
text: Location, location, location...add a terrific boutique hotel, amazingly attentive staff, excellent restaurant and bar, and you have all the ingredients for a delightful stay in TriBeCa . Cannot say enough about the staff...from Patrick the bellman, Tom at the front desk, concierge Franck, Ariel the bartender, to Natasha the ever smiling hostess, server, or whatever was needed at the moment. My new "go to" hotel in New York!

title: Relaxed hotel in Tribeca
text:
Prettig verblijf van 7 dagen gehad. Het is sfeervol ingericht hotel op een toplocatie.
Mooi uitzicht op One World en goede voorzieningen (koffie, broodje, bar, parkje, metro) op loopafstand. Oprecht vriendelijk en geïnteresseerd personeel, begint met goede deurservices door Patrick.
Zeker een aanrader voor een rustig verblijf in Tribeca.

title: Great Tribeca Hotel
text: Everything about this hotel is great - location, remodeled rooms, delicious food, a friendly and very helpful doorman, Patrick, welcoming front desk staff like Anta, a subway stop right out the front door…what's not to like?!  I will return often.

title: Weekend stay for daughter's welcome
text: We found the Smyth so welcoming and excited about our daughter's wedding.  The accomodations were first rate.  Our son's dog was there and the staff were delighted to walk him.  Patrick was amazingly helpful. Overall a great experience. The Smyth is a beautiful boutique hotel.

title: Great hotel in TriBeca
text: Really enjoyed my stay here, modern hotel room with very comfortable bed. Relaxed environment in the lobby. I can recommend eating at Little Park. Close to subway. Friendly staff and pleasant environment.

title: Never joined a friendlier Hotel in New York
text:
Since Years I am travelling to New York, this time was my first stay in Smyth Tribeca and I will never change! Never had such a great and friendly team in a Hotel in New York! Starting with Patrick the bellman followed by Anita at the front desk... well the whole team where amazing!
Can't wait to be back and feeling like coming home.

title: The small annoyances/issues add up...
text:
My wife and I just got home from an overnight in NYC to celebrate our 20th anniversary.  We used to live there for about a decade, and love the culture and food scene. 

I had picked the Smyth from a few swankier/boutiquey options and was really looking forward to our stay.

Things started out well enough, with Anta (front desk) giving us an upgrade to a King Deluxe instead of the King Superior we had booked directly from the hotel website.  TK(sp?) the doorman/bellhop was nice and friendly as well.

So when we get to the room, everything is pretty much in order.  It's on the West Broadway side of things, so there are nice, open views...you can even see Freedom Tower if you stand in the right place. There was some wear and tear on things (did someone try to light the TV on fire at some point?)...like evidence of water damage in a corner near the ceiling (window), etc.

But where things really started to go south was when I went to use the bathroom...I noticed a stain (propriety prevents me from mentioning what kind) on the seat.  Sort as if someone had wiped sloppily, if you get my drift.  Further inspection revealed dried urine near the hinge...it was as if the cleaning person had cleaned the toilet with the seat up, so that the dried urine and other stains were not visible.  I quickly tidied things up so my wife wouldn't notice. A clean bathroom is truly a necessity at really any level of hotel, so it was surprising to get one that wasn't.

Another annoyance: the hotel advertises complimentary bottled water with evening turndown service.  Upon returning to the hotel after dinner, our bed was neither turned down nor was their any complimentary water...only two bottles labeled for sale ($6 each).  I also noted that the air in the room was kind of muggy, as if the AC could not dehumidify things.  This persisted the entire night.

The next morning, we were unceremoniously woken up at 6 AM by our neighbors, who sounded like they had younger kids in the room with them.  While I understand the hotel can't really control things like this, I think they CAN control the soundproofing.  I didn't call the front desk to report it, and looking back I probably should have.  The noise went on for about 30 minutes.  I have kids of my own, so I know what it's like, but when one is trying to enjoy a getaway for a wedding anniversary, it's not that pleasant to be woken up by the sounds of kids.

Breakfast at Little Park, the Andrew Carmellini restaurant attached to the hotel was great.   Nice room, friendly and attentive staff, great food, reasonable cost, and perfect portions.  After breakfast checked out and checked our bag...which we told the front desk we'd pick up when we came back to get our car (which we had valeted for the night).  We were going to the new Whitney on the West Side...highly recommended, btw.  But buy your tickets in advance or face a long line.  One more word of advice might be to start on the 5th floor and work your way up.  We had tickets for the 10:30 entry and the density of people who went straight to the 8th floor was unappealing.  Happy to report that things thinned out as we made our way through lower floors. If you like art/architecture, definitely pay the new Whitney a visit.

After lunch and some shopping in Chelsea, we went back to the hotel to get our bag and our car.  I gave the doorman/bellhop our claim stubs and he guided us into the elegantly appointed lounge area to wait. 

In that same lounge area (which is fairly large) a woman appeared to be sleeping on one of the sofas.  Shoes off (at least) and feet up, with a pillow over her legs like a blanket.  I mentioned this to the doorman, and he said "Oh, she's not sleeping." as if that made things any better.  Here's my beef with this: A HOTEL LOBBY IS NOT YOUR LIVING ROOM...and seeing someone treat it that way truly impacts the ambiance of the hotel.

If you're thinking "Well, what did you expect them to do, you intolerant jerk?", allow me to relay a story from my teen years.  Once, my parents had booked a few rooms at the Waldorf Astoria...I think they had some out of town guests that we were entertaining. We had arrived early, and our rooms were not yet ready.  So we waited in the lobby.  I guess I had fallen sleep (shoes on and not on a couch, mind you)...because the next thing I knew, I was being awoken by a lobby attendant who merely had to say "I'm sorry, there's no sleeping in the lobby, sir." for me to sit up straighter and NOT fall asleep again for the rest of our time in the lobby. Yet the Smyth's hotel staff walked by several times and never asked this woman to put her shoes on and please refrain from lying down.

My final take on the Smyth is that it could be a nice place to stay in NYC, but that their attention to detail has to get turned up a bit. We've stayed at the James, the Americano, the Soho Grand, the Andaz (multiple times, and yes, I know, it's part of Hyatt) and the Roger Williams over the years...and NEVER run into the sorts of things we experienced at the Smyth.  It's too bad really.  Hoping our stay was an anomaly.

title: Simply Fabulous!
text: I visited New York City recently for the Memorial Day Weekend, along with my whole family consisting of 4 kids and my husband and my father. I have to say the service was simply amazing, so seamless and smooth. When we left the hotel to tour the city and came back at nighttime, it was delightful to see that our rooms have been cleaned and prepared for our return. And the people there was so nice, especially the bellman Patrick and the front desk lady, Lida. Since our family is deaf and use sign language, Patrick noticed and tried his best to learn some signs in a couple of hours, which was truly very touching. I would totally recommend this hotel for anyone visiting NYC, it's near to everything. It's also very beautiful.

title: Thanks to Frank and Tom
text:
Excellent location and services from Frank and Tom
enjoyed the balcony and room as well as restaurant.
Heve restaurant open longer. Also newspapers were available on time.
recommend regular chocolates in the evening and less sweet
Guy and Nadia Rabbat

title: Best hotel in TriBeCa
text: We were just there again after a lapse of a few years. Lapse, only because we enjoy the Meatpacking District and West Village more than stroller-ville (aka Tribeca). That said, Smyth is an awesome hotel, located near tons of excellent restaurants and the Hudson river. We scored a a great room, #814 with a big terrace looking north. And the people at Smyth are super friendly and helpful in all ways. Plus, Patrick (bellman) is awesome, basically risked his life to get us a taxi :) and was just fun and friendly and great. And, they were very kind to our pup, Dwight.

title: Hotel très cool + accueil extremement sympatique
text:
Nous avons beaucoup aimé ce style retro/scandinave qui mettent bien à l'aise tout en étant chic.
L'accueil est fantastiqe : que ce soit le concierge français qui nous ont mis sur la guest liste du club le plus branché de NY ou la gentilesse et l'efficacité des "bellman" Patrick et TK. La chambre était un peu petit mais les lits très comfortables. On a bcp apprecié les petits gateaux au chocolat qui nous attendait tous les après midis.
Bien situé au coeur de Tribeca.Je reviendrai!!!

title: Nice little boutique in TriBeCa
text: We were very happy to receive an upgrade without asking on arrival! Unfortunate the couple we were travelling with did not and their room was quite small. Service was excellent however. Great location in TriBeCa right by the canal St subway stop. I would stay here again.

title: Quiet Oasis in an excellent location.
text: I was very impressed with friendliness (which was genuine) of all staff at the property- especially the bellmen (Patrick and Tom).  I was also amazed, compared to other hotels in NYC, how quick is was to go from the street to the incredibly quiet room we had.  The subways stops nearby were a definite bonus.

title: My Stay at The Smyth Hotel
text: Very warm and exceptional service.  Patrick the bellman went a block and a half to a catch a cab for me, versus staying in front of the hotel and waiting for one to arrive.  That is a great example of someone going the extra mile!

title: Great Hotel in Tribeca
text: We had 5 nights at this hotel.    The room we had was a  good size, we even shared the room with our daughter and did not feel cramped.  The people who work there are very helpful.   Thank you Patrick for all your help.  The location was very convenient to the subway.

title: Mother's Day Trip
text: Stayed at the Smyth for a solo Mother’s Day weekend vacation. The hotel location in Tribeca is convenient and a short distance to the Financial District, Soho, and the Brooklyn Bridge. It’s just a few steps to the nearby subway station and a short ride to upper Manhattan. Being a Californian I was quite intimidated by the subway system, but Monique at the front desk was very helpful and alleviated my anxiety. The bellman, Patrick, and the entire staff were awesome, and I was even provided with complimentary water and a snack once I returned to my room after a day of sightseeing!  The room was gorgeous and swank without a cramped feeling. If you’re looking for a nice hotel away from the noise and traffic this is the place for you. I’m already planning my next stay in early September!

title: Little Gem in Tribeca
text: We recently stayed at The Smyth for our wedding trip to NY and it was a fantastic hotel. The staff really made our stay special - Lida and Enoch in the concierge made us feel welcome and were so helpful through our entire stay. we were always greeted with a smile in the door by either Patrick or Tom. The entire staff at Smyth truely created a welcoming atmosphere and provided outstanding service. The hotel has a cool and laid-back lobby bar, it was a great place to meet up with friends and family for drinks. The room was furnitured cool and the bed was comfortable, and the cleaning was excellent. We loved the location of the hotel - we had view of The One World Trade Center from our room. There were great restaurants close by, such as SaraBeths, Tribeca Grill and Locanada Verde and good shopping places just a short stroll from the hotel. The subway was just outside the hotel and provided easy access to Central Park, Times Square and Brooklyn. We will definitely stay at The Smyth again.

title: Perfect TriBeCa experience
text:
Everything was perfect in this modern and comfortable hotel.
The location: beautiful in TriBeCa, just in front of Chamber St. station.
The room: quite spacious, clean, with a big window on W Broadway.
The staff: fantastic! Lida and Tom warmly welcomed us at the check-in and were always helpful and kind, and in general all the people of the staff were courteous and attentive. People make the difference!

title: Très bien en tous points !
text:
Mon ami et moi, habitué des hôtels dits de luxe, avons séjourné au Smyth du 1er mai au 5 mai 2015. Nous avions réservé une King Suite.

Idéalement situé entre le Financial district et les quartiers de Soho et Tribeca, l'hôtel est situé au pied des lignes de métro 1,2 et 3 tandis que les lignes A,C et E se trouvent à une centaine de mètres plus haut.

L'accueil est très professionnel et sympathique, à l'américaine, et ce depuis l'arrivée du taxi. Les bagages sont pris en charge et le check se déroule assez rapidement.

La chambre : points positifs

 - bonne literie, 
 - produits cosmétiques de qualité
 - spacieuse avec un coin living room
 - baignoire et douche

La chambre : points négatifs

 - Pas une vue "woow" puisque sur une sorte de cours intérieure (mais au calme au moins)
 - Pas de station d'iPod (c'est devenu un standard ...)
 - La coin salon ne peut pas être isolé de la chambre
 - Les portes claques et on entend celles des voisins

Restaurant (petit déjeuner et repas)

Il n'y a que des points positifs, on ne s'étonne pas que les locaux s'y retrouvent le midi et le soir. Donc, peu de monde pour le petit déjeuner qui est servi à la carte, pas de buffet, tout est fait minute par un chef dont la cuisine nous a émerveillé tant au petit déjeuner que le midi ou le soir. 
Le restaurant est vraiment le "plus" du séjour. Une équipe toujours jeune, dynamique et professionnelle.

Enfin, deux petites mésaventures mineures : le premier jour, le ménage de la chambre à été fait à moitié (oubli de mettre du gel de douche, etc.) et à 14h00 ... Au moment du régler, nous nous sommes aperçus que des mini bar nous avaient été imputés alors que nous n'avions rien pris et que la note d'un déjeuner avait été comptée deux fois. Rien de grave, tout a été corrigé en quelques clics. :)

A votre dispo si besoin !

Thomas.

title: Business and Pleasure
text: Was in NY for business and was able to spend a long weekend at the Smyth which enjoyed very much.  Great location and very comfortable & relaxing vibe.  Lida and Asia were very helpful on check in and Patrick the Bellman was simply a good guy and ready with answers and help.  Will be back soon.

title: Great service in a cozy hotel
text: The staff here was what made our stay. We were welcomed warmly every time we arrived be either Tom or Patrick. Our room was on the 2nd floor so if you are used to sleeping in quiet this could have been an issue. I slept well, my husband did not. Also our room while very clean & comfortable had a few issues. The shower drain was very slow so we wound up standing in water as we showered, the room phone did not work when we arrived & I had trouble getting wifi on my Mac in our room. The location was great & we were able to overlook the small issues & would stay here again....on a higher floor. Also you definitely need reservations if your going to eat at the restaurant in the hotel.

title: Really Cool Hotel
text:
I was recently in NY for a family function and stayed at The Smyth.  It was my first time and I was blown away.  We were greeted by the "bellman" who had our bags out the the taxi before we even payed the driver and they escorted us to our room...with many suggestons/helpful tips about our stay.  The front desk staff was wonderful and made us feel very welcome.  The room was a decent size, had the largest TV I've ever had in a hotel room and was very quiet as we had an inside room and didn't overlook the street.  The bed was comfy (although, the pillows could probably use an update....they had a little bit of an "old" smell).  The room had a great honor bar with a pretty decent selection too!  

The hotel has a great lobby/lounge with working fireplaces and a nice cozy bar to get a cocktail.  Many people sitting with their laptops or just having coffee in the morning.  ust a really pleasant relaxing atmosphere.  We did not order anything to eat but I believe they offer 24 hour room service and were also getting ready to open their sidewalk patio so that will be nice once the weather cooperates.

All in all a great hotel in a great location (right in the heart of Tribecca and a short walk to the new World Trade Center, shopping and many amazing restaurants).  I highly recommend!!

title: this is a great place in a great neighborhood
text:
Big "shout out" to the hotel SMYTH.  What a great little sanctuary in Tribeca.  Staff awesome, from Patrick and Sandy who meet you at the hotel to the desk agents, professional and courteous all around.
If you are looking for a place in Tribeca, stop by and stay awhile at the Smyth.
Thanks All….

Scott

title: tribeca gem
text: Wonderful brief stay for a friends movie premiere at the film festival. Quick walk to the venue and great location for an warm afternoon stroll north to SoHo. Lunch at Little Park was delicious and Patrick and Tom the bellmen were ever present to assist. Bar area warm and cozy and the room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed!

title: Lovely TriBeCa Stay
text:
Lovely staff, excellent service and a great room with a comfy bed. The restaurant downstairs Little Park, had a unique menu. We had brunch and we loved our choices, the baked eggs with lamb chorizo ragu was delicious and even more so when I dipped the whole grain toast in it as the very attentive server recommended. The herb & goat cheese omelette was delicious too. 

Price was good, great area and a complimentary house car service.

title: outstanding service
text: The best part of our too-brief stay at the Smyth was the staff: all courteous, competent and attentive, from concierge to housekeeping, with special recognition to bellmen Tom and Patrick, who were always helpful and personable.  The cleanlinesss and brightness of the room were also notable.

title: Thanks to our friends at the Smyth
text: The staff at the Smyth made our stay. We are so grateful to everyone, including Patrick and Tom the Bellmen for being warm, welcoming and accommodating at all times during our stay. The hotel recently went through some renovations which were evident in the details of the modern rooms and extremely comfy beds.  Thank you for contributing to a great weekend in NYC!

title: Great neighborhood hotel!
text:
We love being able to stay in Tribeca near our family and The Smyth is always our first choice when we can afford it! They had a great deal and we jumped on it! Everything was perfect from the door man who found us parking on the street, to check in to size of the room!! It felt huge compared to most NYC hotels. We love the new lobby and cozy bar. Staff is ecxcellent. Gym adequate. 
 We're spoiled now for good and really would rather stay here than anywhere else.

title: Small hotel, big rooms, stylish furnishings.
text: This is my go-to hotel in NYC. I love its location in Tribeca. The rooms are big by Manhattan standards, very stylish yet comfortable. The hotel's small size means the halls are generally quiet and you don't feel like one of thousands.

title: Putting on the Ritz at the Smyth: A Hip Experience for All Ages
text: The Tribeca Film Festival recommended the Smyth hotel as the go to place for filmmakers to stay during the festival.   It was an incredible experience.   The staff was amazing, both friendly, personable and went out of their way to make us feel special.  My favorite person is Anta.  Please ask for her if you visit.  Anta made sure my son and I were well taken care of during our stay.  She anticipated our needs and made everything comfortable and easy.   The room we stayed in was lovely, with cozy beds, excellent lighting.  The location is great.  The lounge is a wonderful place to relax and meet new people.  If you eat breakfast at the hotel, I highly recommend the brussel sprouts.   I never thought of it as a breakfast food, but it is so delicious, I could eat them morning, noon and night.   I will definitely go back to the Smyth.   This is a hotel that provides warmth, hospitality and makes you feel special in the Big Apple.  It has a hip Euro vibe and is definitely worth the trip!

title: Nice to be back, pity about the noise!
text:
It was really lovely being in the Tribeca neighbourhood.  I stayed at the Smyth back in 2009 soon after the hotel opened & had fond memories of my stay there with my young daughter on our world travels.
This time it was less personal and the night work on the road directly below my bedroom window drove me nuts!  Very loud night repairs on the road or something went on for a couple of nights - kept me away.
The porter - PATRICK - was very helpful and solutions based and made a positive impact on the experience.  Thank you Patrick.

title: Definitely a recommendation
text:
We were recommended by a friend and will do the same. Did not know this area of town and it's lovely. Brilliant arrival staffer on reception and very brilliant Patrick the bellman to point us in the right direction and generally make us feel very looked after - hurling himself into the middle of the street to get us a cab surely beyond the call of duty. 
Rooms very nice and comfortable - were on the 7th. Great gym. Very nice sitting room and fire.
Good breakfast in the restaurant - did not try dinner but would have been happy to.
Following comments meant to be helpful / no service is perfect........but would in no way prevent me going again:
- The lobby is too dark - can barely see.
- Receptionist on departure charmless and a bit rude - so surprising when all other staff so terrific / nevertheless charming staff is the entry ticket for a hotel.
- Hotel driver system a bit odd.
Overall a very good hotel, scoring 80%.

title: Sophisticated comfort with great location
text: We've been staying at the Smyth when in NYC for a few years now, and it keeps getting better. The recent renovation has made the lobby and bar area very comfortable and inviting, and the addition of the restaurant Little Park is amazing -- worth going to whether you are staying at the Smyth or not (especially if you love farm fresh food and vegetable dishes done with the same care and attention to deliciousness as main course meats, fish, etc. Staff is perfect: attentive without being in your face annoying or putting on airs. (Shout out to Patrick "the bellman" for schlepping our bags and getting a cab at a terrible hour in the time it took me to sit down in the lobby!) Rooms are comfortable, spotless and nicely decorated. Location is hard to beat: in Tribeca right above the Chambers Street 1/2/3 subway station. So two blocks or so to the river and a great walk/part, and minutes to anywhere else in Manhattan.

title: Home away from Home
text: My weekend at Smyth was probably the most memorable ever staying in NYC. This newly renovated property has the most comfortable appearance and accomodations. The lobby looks like a livingroom and the theme of little park really fits today's consumer; healthier options and smaller portions. Any hotel can embody these elements but the staff is what sets it apart from others. Along with the homey feel, the staff is the most relaxed. Tom greeted me upon arrival. I was walking from the subway by the restaurant and he left the door to ask me if he could help me find what I was looking for. The entrance was hidden a little but thinking about the neighborhood, the doors tie into the residential appearance. Walking in, Sandy was holding a door for me and he welcomed me with a smile that I will never forget. Monique checked me in and was most informative. She also enlisted the help of Franck and Enoch for recommendations for things I wanted to do. Since it was two guys and two girls talking we did come to a standstill but the conversation was awesome. Not your typical checkin: what's you last name ID and credit card but just conversation. I was really intrigued by how pleasant everyone was and on my way back in I ran into Lisa and Anta at night. Those two are funny! We laughed for what felt like hours. Settling in a room that is bigger than most NYC hotels was the icing on the cake but I really loved the staff. I know my review is like 5 months late but I think Lida checked me out the next morning and her conversation with Sandy (he seems to work every shift) was a good farewell. Thank you for a wonderful trip I encourage everyone to stay here!

title: Una buona  soluzione..
text: sicuramente la posizione e' eccellente, nel cuore pulsante dalla movida newyorkese ma neache lontano da midtown manhattan . buona accoglienza e disponibilita' alla reception . camere abbastanza spaziose e dall'arredamento pulito e confortevole. il ns pacchetto con colazione prevedeva un credito di 30 USD a testa..un po' strettino ma abbastanza ragionevole . ci siamo trovati bene e sentiti a nostro agio.

title: Family Spring Break
text: We came to NYC with the family for spring break.  We had lots of activities planned and found the location excellent for subway access, points of interest and restaurants within walking distance, friendly staff and spacious rooms. Would definitely stay again.

title: Modern and stylish hotel in fantastic location
text:
I stayed at Smyth for a few nights and couldn't have been happier with the overall stay. The beds were very comfortable, the layout of the room was spacious and open, and the shower (while strange at first, with no door) was terrific. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable about the area, and never hesitated to accommodate in any way they could. 

The restaurant, Little Park, has a great breakfast with strong coffee. The lobby bar is cozy and comfortable, complete with roaring fires, spectacular selection of whiskeys and strong drinks. Will definitely return.

title: Room was 3 stars, but service is 4+ stars, great and friendly
text: I had a room only on the second floor, so the street noise was pretty bad.  I also never understand bathrooms that are designed with open showers which means you're always freezing unless directly under the spray.  On the plus side however, the hotel is priced very reasonably, the front desk and bellstaff are super friendly, and they have a house car that will shuttle you for free around Tribeca.

title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel
text: I love staying at the Smyth.  Comfortable, well designed, great location - calm of Tribeca with a subway right outside.  Last visit Franck the concierge couldn't have been more helpful.  My flight was cancelled and he saved the day.

title: NYC visit
text:
Our Receptionist Anta was very friendly and took good care of us. She was never tired of being courteous making sure to great us with a heartfelt smile.
Rooms are comfortable.The hotel is in a great location in the heart of TriBeCa . Walking distance from ground zero and Brooklyn bridge. We will come back.

title: Fabulous and chic hotel
text: I recommend this hotel as the room is comfortable and chic with exceptional customer service.  Affordable pricing for a new york hotel and central location to other eateries and activities.  I would definitelystay here again.

title: Nice Hotel in Tribeca
text:
First the good things:

1.  The service is excellent....from the doorman to the check in people to the cleaning staff....all are courteous, friendly and helpful.

2.  The room size is huge for NYC, especially the bathrooms.

3.  The room is quiet.  No street noise and nothing from the other rooms or elevator.

4.  The room is immaculate.

5.  The toiletries are nice quality.

6.  Internet is free.

7.  The restaurant has plenty of healthy options.

8.  Shower pressure and hot water are good.

The issues:

1.  My mattress was too soft.

2.  The room decor is somewhat stark....white and grey.  While I am not a big fan of hotel art, something on the walls or a bit of color would be nice.  Without any art or color, the room felt cold.

We stayed at the Smyth to attend an awards ceremony on Wall Street.  The location for this event was good, but the Smyth is pretty far away from things in midtown.  The neighborhood, however, is great....nice to walk around.

The hotel is pricy, even for NYC.

title: The perfect hotel experience!
text: This was my first time staying at the Smyth hotel and first ever trip to NY. The staff made it easy and highly enjoyable from check in to check out. GREAT hospitality! The location was great as well. The hotel is very clean and elegant. My room was very spacious and the beds were amazing! I traveled with a friend so we were ecstatic about the size of the bathroom and the fact that there was a very large mirror with great lighting outside of it. It made it very easy for two girls to get ready everyday! We stayed for 4 nights and housekeeping was magnificent in helping us keep our room in order and made it a pleasure to come back to after long days. The front office employees are a great team and nothing short of amazing. Each and every one of them were very nice and personable. We had the chance to chat with Enoch, the assistant manager who was lovely and Blaise and Sandy, well, we just adored them. They were the first faces we seen when walking in each day. Both gentlemen were very helpful in answering any questions, giving directions, restaurant suggestion, getting us cabs and assisting with our luggage and they were even a pleasure to just chat and laugh with on our way in or out. Seeing Lisa when dragging ourselves in after a very long night was a pleasure as well. The staff alone is our main reason for wanting to return. We can not wait to visit the city again and will definitely be staying at the very impressive and upscale Smyth hotel so they should be expecting to see the two Cali girls who over packed and still forgot everything again! What a phenomenal experience!

title: Stay in Tribeca
text: This was my third trip to the Smyth Hotel in Tribeca – never a disappointment. Tom – the door man from before was spot on an Amanda who check me in was very hospital and professional. The room was spacious – but I am always amazed by the size of the bathroom that impresses me. Too many hotels in NY – just don’t have the space and you feel like you are operating in a small closet. This is the first time I had breakfast at the down stairs restaurant. The services were excellent and the breakfast reminded me of the ones my Dad used to make on Sunday mornings. Good choice!

title: Amazing!
text: We had a fabulous time at this hotel. Front desk was very helpful. I mentioned that it was my daughters sweet 16, and she was surprised with a small cake in our room that night. Really great experience.

title: Стильный Smyth
text: Уже зайдя в лобби, сразу понимаешь, что стиль главная фишка отеля. Залитое солнцем фойе, дружелюбие и лучезарные улыбки девушек на ресепшене заставляют остаться в отеле как можно дольше. Пробыл там 2 замечательных дня. Всем остался доволен, абсолютно. Даже завтраками. Рекомендую!

title: Urban Oasis in Tribecca
text: Loved, loved loved this hotel!  Impeccable, courteous, on the spot class A service from the time one arrives till checkout.  We stayed at the Smyth and loved everything about it!  The entire Smyth staff was over the top amazing!  They couldn't do enough for you without even asking.  And when we did need assistance with car service or any other questions... within a wave of a magic wand it was done!  Beautiful, clean and upscale. Hats off to an amazing Smyth team! The rooms were clean and comfortable... the perfect combination of simplicity and elegance.  Tom, Amanda and her crew were over the top on task and so kind.  Little Park was outstanding... a must do for any meal, dessert or cocktails.  We just wish we had everyones name that made our stay so perfect. Thank you for a wonderful experience!

title: Valentine's Day Retreat
text: I had the pleasure of spending a romantic evening at Smyth for Valentine's Day. I was greeted at the door by Sandy a pleasantly smiling door man. He welcomed me, initiated in conversation and escorted me to the front desk where I was checked in by the very polite, pleasant and knowledgeable Monique. They made such good impressions that I could not forget their names or faces. As I entered the room, I was taken by the rose left on my bed. Usually this is a gesture from your significant other but I soon learned that the hotel actually went ahead and did this, how thoughtful. Nice quiet room, very spacious compared to most NYC hotels. I did leave a note that I was also celebrating a 15 year anniversary with my husband on my reservation and just before night's end I was given a complementary bottle of Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries by Christina the AGM of the restaurant Little Park. All in all the hotel was nice and everything was new but the staff really made my Valentine's Day like no other with the little things!

title: Although entrance improvements are good, rooms and elevators need attention.
text:
Room pass cards were often tricky to work on elevator access and room. Shower in room very slow to drain. Toilette paper holder needed tightening to hold roll. Hall noise very obvious from within the room. Glass room divider between bathroom and bedroom annoying when partner turned light on during the night. Rooms were clean but carpet was stained. 
Had a very disappointing breakfast in the new Little Park Restaurant on the Smyth premises. There were eight of us in our group and no one left praising the food. Probably the worst muffin ever eaten. Waffles were served without syrup or butter. The fruit plate was miniscule and had a sugary syrup over all. Service was inattentive by disinterested waiters. Definitely not the place for breakfast especially at prices like $10.00 for an orange juice.

title: A few glitches...
text:
We needed a quick winter getaway and spent the long weekend at the Smyth. The Smyth overall is a fantastic hotel, my partner and I have stayed at the Thompson in Chicago and Toronto and have had wonderful experiences. 

The Tribeca location is very convenient to downtown manhattan however a bit far south for exploring mid and upper portions of the city depending on what your looking for. 

We were greeted by friendly helpful staff and checked in quickly although we arrived early. Room was clean and spacious with a great bathroom. Be warned thought that the sliding bathroom door doesn't provide complete privacy. 

There were a few drawbacks to our stay however. Each day when we returned to the room neither of our key cards would work. On day two there was a welcome letter addressed to another guest sitting on our nightstand, that same day the hotel ran out of clean towels and they had to go to their sister property to get more for us. 

Overall this is a great hotel but compared to other Thompson property experiences we might choose another when returning to NYC.

title: European Cleanliness and Comfort with excellent customer service!
text:
Loved this hotel!
What else can I say? The great experience started at the door with the warm welcome from the door men, the amazing front desk staff and last but not least (and in my opinion the most important one---Housekeeping). And this is where I want to give a shout out to our great housekeeping lady (we stayed for a few days). We, meaning kids included, and you know how that can be...We saw her one day as we came "home" earlier and she was in the process of cleaning our room. Loved that she accelerated the cleaning-and the room was always impeccable!
"Unfortunately" we stayed one night at the Mondrian, and let me tell you: The Smyth has elegance and class, whereas, in my opinion, the Mondrian tries "too hard"...And even though the Mondrian is located much closer to all kinds of luxury shopping, I would choose the Smyth next time again (btw, Whole Foods is just a block away---another plus point).
If you are used to European sophistication but humbleness at the same time, stay at the Smyth!

title: Great short getaway
text: My wife went into the city for a quick overnight to get a break from Winter boredom. We stayed at the Smyth and it was the perfect getaway. The staff was terrific and our room/suite perfectly suited to relax. We had drinks in the "living room" with our kids who live nearby and everyone was impressed with the "at home" feel helped by the fire on a cold night. The pancakes at Little Park were the best.

title: Great hotel and service
text: We were looking for some place special to stay for Valentine's Day/President's Day Weekend and based on feedback I had heard I thought the Smyth would be the perfect spot - and it was.  Not only was the entire staff courteous and helpful from the second we stepped out of out car, but the completely unexpected upgrade to the penthouse suite on such a busy weekend was beyond generous.  And as if that weren't enough, of course a bottle of champagne showed up to stun us once again as we were also celebrating my wife's birthday.  The room was perfect, our stay was fantastic and even breakfast at Little Park was top notch.  I wanted to specifically mention the concierge Franck who contacted me before our trip in an attempt to assist with our planning of activities and such - his help and thoughtfulness was very much appreciated. Our stay was incredibly special and you can be sure we will be back the next chance we have to get away.

title: Recent Trip - Great Hotel
text:
My wife and I spent 3 great Nights at the hotel last week. The staff were really helpful and friendly on local bars and restaurants. The hotel is in a great location and is really nice and relaxed. The room was ideal for our time there and was very comfortable. We ate in the Little Park restaurant on our first night and it was excellent. The quirky style of the menu seems strange at first but the when the food arrived it was amazing. The food has been carefully thought of and the tastes and textures went so well. We had a great time trying it. 

Would really recommend this hotel if you want a cool and relaxed place to stay when you visit New York. Great find and we will certainly be going back to the hotel when we visit New York again.

title: Awesome!
text: After a complete Fail w an AIrBnb, this was like arriving at an oasis! The hotel is beautiful, modern and well situated in Tribecca.  Can't wait to go back.   I'd like to call out Anita (sp?) on the night shift.  The Senegalese woman was incredibly nice to my girlfriend and I.  Thank you team Smyth!

title: Top notch
text: I enjoy the Smyth every time I stay there. Very attentive staff, comfortable room, and in a great location. I look forward to my next visit! I received a personal note from the director of operations thanking me for my visit. Nice touch!

title: Boutique feel & great NY service
text: I have been staying at the Smyth for awhile now but felt compelled to write a review since they introduced their new lobby bar and restaurant into the mix.  The hotel rooms are modern and beds cozy - and the intro of LIttle Park restaurant and the Lobby Bar give the entire hotel special charm.  When you combine nicely designed rooms,  cozy beds, great service and a place you want to hang out and eat = A+.

title: Design, comfortable and relaxed
text: A wonderful discovery in trendy Tribeca.  A delightful ambience with real fire and design furniture, this hotel should be uptight and super NY pretentious.  Instead, it has a delightful vibe with well-trained staff who don't try too hard and let the guest remain in control. A bonus is the fantastic independent restaurant.  Perfect for financial district, Tribeca and a little walk to Nolita districts... this is a home from home!  Firm recommendation...

title: Excellence at its finest.
text: This was my first time at a Thompson/Smyth property and I was overwhelmingly impressed.  I have stayed at hotels across the world and this hotel rates up there among the highest.  From the second I stepped in the front desk staff were friendly and attentive.  They made my visit very welcoming.  The room was beautiful, spot clean and very comfortable.  I only stayed one night this time, but I will be sure to stay here next time I'm in NY.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Nice boutique hotel
text:
Stayed here for a recent business trip to New York. Check-in was welcoming and efficient even though we arrived late in the evening. Room was, contrary to some prior reviews, a good size (for New York) with a king-sized bed, bathroom with shower, working desk and resting area with arm chair. Loved the bed and duvet, which were warm and comfortable. The Little Park restaurant was great for both lunch and dinner. Location was perfect for anyone having to visit the financial district -- walking distance yet far enough away and in an area with more shops and restaurants. 

A few things that did not make our stay perfect: service provided by concierge was spotty and our request was not responded to until 24 hours later, our hotel room card did not work in the elevator several times and the bar last order being 11PM (which seemed early to us). 

Overall we did have a pleasant stay and would return to this hotel for my next business trip in New York.

title: Lovely hotel in TriBeCa
text: The best hotel in TriBeCa. The staff is super nice. The hotel is hip. Located right in the center of TriBeCa. Very close to the subway station. The service was perfect everyone is amicable. The room has a good size and the bathroom is pretty with a great shower.

title: Perfection found downtown
text:
All was great in this smart downtown hideaway hotel, felt very good with the location etc...
Rooms wee spacious and well equipped for the price it was a great value.  Amenities were first class. The bar and restaurant were a real SURPRISE find, making my stay at the hotel perfect.

title: Semplicemente Fantastico
text:
Hotel in zona Tribeca (bella ma più rilassante rispetto al centro), ma comunque midtown facilmente raggiungibile con la metro che ha fermata direttamente davanti all'hotel. a due passi dal WTC, ponte di Brooklyn, Wall St.
colpisce subito la hall: calda e accogliente con una sala a fianco per eventuali attese o dopo cena.
Personale estremamente cortese e disponibile per ogni richiesta e informazione. Stanze pulite e in ordine dotate di ogni comfort. Wifi gratuito. ben frequentato da altri turisti
da provare il ristorante interno: piatti ottimi e curati nei dettagli.
per la colazione ottimo il vicino bistrot Le pain quotidien.
dal JFK si arriva comodamente in taxi (tariffa fissa 52$).

title: New Year at the Smyth Hotel trebecca
text:
First time doing a trip adviser review. Stayed for a week covering New Year with my wife and 15 year old son. Arrived to a warm welcome but to a very disappointing and underwhelming room. Asked for an upgrade which was an uncomfortable experience. Was shown and also agreed a discounted rate for a suite which was then withdrawn by the general Manager because there was a problem with the room. Given another suite which was fine but my son had to sleep on the couch all week. This is in a room costing all be it discounted 800 dollars per night. Also had to ask for extra pillows and a duvet. Have to say during our weeks stay didn't see any service and at times felt very uncomfortable.
