To top it all when presented with our bill the agreed discount hadn't been applied to the room (we were charged 900 dollars per night) and we had to argue the case with reception who after thought decided to reduce taxes and room service bills to match the agreed discounted rate.
Not great!!
Trebecca is a great location have to say but to the Smyth Hotel sorry never again!

title: A perfect NYC experience - Thank you!
text: We stayed two nights at the Smyth Hotel while being in New York for a Music conference. We were impressed by the amenities and the hotel and room vibe. Great bed, linens, internet, view, showers ... The staff we interacted with (concierge, room service, lobby) was not only professional and precise but, more importantly, very friendly and efficient. We will not hesitate to come back and to refer this TriBeCa gem to our friends.

title: Besviken
text: Lite besviken. Läget är bra, hotell sängarna är jätte sköna men det är allt. Har bott här 2 gånger nu. Dom hade gjort om loungen till  50- tal så det var kul. Men dom har ingen direkt bar, så det blir mer som en mötesplats. Tycker att Soho Grand håller måttet bättre.

title: Great hotel in fantastic location!
text: My husband and I stayed here while he was on a business trip in August 2014. Though the lobby was being renovated, it did not impact our stay at all. Our room (though small like all other NYC rooms) had a gorgeous balcony with views of the Empire State Building and Freedom Tower. My husband had easy walking access to the PATH to New Jersey where his training was held, and I had fantastic and immediate access to 3 major subway lines. I got everywhere I wanted to go in a matter of minutes thanks to this hotel's location. The staff were great, always offering fantastic restaurant recommendations. The room was quiet... it felt as though we were the only folks in the hotel. I would absolutely stay here again!

title: Fantastic Holiday Trip to NYC Thanks to Smyth
text: Yes, the hotel is lovely, the newly renovated lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are clean, comfortable and nicely designed. What really sets the Smyth apart, however, is its amazing service. I've stayed in many hotels, but I have never had such wonderful, personalized service. It seemed like the staff really wanted to be there, were happy to help and excited to share information about New York. It made a family Christmas in the Big Apple a totally wonderful experience. I highly recommend it, particularly if you're looking for a great neighbourhood that's a bit more relaxed than the craziness of Time Square etc.

title: Great, genuinely friendly hotel in Tribeca
text:
A great hotel. Absolutely perfect location, in Tribeca, close to everything Lower Manhattan and much less noise than 5th Ave. The hotel just finished renovation of the lobby, but rooms supposed to start this month. It will be an improvement with new carpets etc. But everything is clean! But the best 2 parts of this hotel are:
1. Crew. Great, smiling people, ready to help. Enthuse and all. No snobbish attitude here, really a genuine smile all the time.
2. View. Book a Studio King junior suite, we had a 270 degree view from the Freedom Tower to the Empire State building. High windows. Just a great combination of good friendly NYC neighborhood and amazing grand views.

Thank you guys for a great stay!
A little tip - contact the hotel directly, they might be able to offer you a better rate ;)

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Stayed here during December. Great hotel with very friendly staff. Had a good room with a massive king size bed that was an upgrade when we checked in. Staff was very good. There is a lovely fireplace downstairs with books to read. Felt like home with the service.
An added benefit is the vehicle available to transport you anywhere in the local area. Great benefit and it was complementary.
The subway is directly outside the hotel along with a Starbucks across the road.
Lots of places to eat within walking distance.
Would definitely stay here again.

title: LOVE THE SMYTH!
text:
I stayed here for New Years Eve with a friend and 2 dogs. I wanted to enjoy a sophisticated NY experience without the headaches of typical touristy midtown during New years. The location was incredible for this - I feel its a hidden gem, even though it's on W Broadway. Doesn't look like a hotel - which makes it more appealing being so understated. The staff is incredible, very personal and friendly. We lost one of our room keys and they replaced it in seconds. They also knew the dogs names within the first hour we were there! The lobby and common areas - Little Park and the Evening bar are so cool, you feel like you are in a friend's lovely home. Love the fireplace on a cold night! Got a coffee and croissant to go New Years day - fast and delicious!
The room was great - medium sized for NY (king superior), the bathroom decadent. Beware the shower wall facing the sleeping area is frosted, so privacy is in question, but for couples this is fine.
I have been in this area before and knew this was the place to be for our getaway, easy access from the Hudson, the street parking on holidays is plentiful and free, and you are walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, and Wall Street. We went to Capital Grille on Wall Street which was a 10 minute walk, and downtown is getting more built up so the nightlight is decent - and obviously great within Tribeca.
Lots to eat nearby for something fast - Pizza, Starbucks etc. Also the train is just outside the door, yet weirdly not noisy.
The hotel is very pet friendly which I really appreciated. There is a house car which apparently runs only before 6pm, which we never made use of, so I can't comment on that. ATT nay gets 2 bars. I had trouble getting on complimentary wifi, but my friend didn't.
Overall a lovely experience and would go back in a heartbeat!

title: Celebracion de aniversario
text: Mi esposo reservo para nuestro aniversario una de las suite en este hotel maravillos todo es hermoso  la pasamos excelente una experiencia divina todo un lujo desde q entras hasta q te vas un servicio al cliente excelente... Nos fuimos muy contentos con nuestra suite la vista de maravilla todo en el cuarto es muy limpio y a gradable volveriamos de nuevo si quieres pasar una noche bella con tu pareja este es el lugar romantico nos tenian unos regalitos muy hermosos gracias a mi esposo y a todo el hotel por esta experiencia vivida en nueva york excelente hotel muy agradable totalmente

title: Fantastic if you need to be near the financial district
text:
I've stayed here several times, the last occasion for almost 2 weeks. That can be a long time in a hotel room, which is why I choose this location when I can. 

Although part of a chain, the Smyth offers a boutique experience, with a cosy and stylish feel. 

There are hotels in the area with larger rooms, but situated at the bottom of TriBeCa it's in a more lively part of town than Wall Street after hours.

Good restaurant and bar, although food is exactly the same as room service - so it's only to get some air you'd eat there.

Staff are generally excellent but I had one issue where I declined the offer of a 'wake up call' only to have them not call my room while my taxi waited outside meaning I missed my early flight.

But I'm still going back. If I had my choice I would not stay in lower Manhattan but since I do, this is as good a place as I've found over several years of travel to NYC.

title: Sparkling clean & great location!
text:
I'll make this short and sweet!  - 

You cannot go wrong staying at Smyth, worth every penny as the service and product are impeccable. I've recommended others and everyone tells me how awesome their stay was. I stayed here because a colleague mentioned it to me! Terrific lobby and restaurant with food to die for! It's hard to find a place you can feel 100% comfortable with their cleanliness, with hotel housekeeping experience... I couldn't find anything that needed attention. Great up keep on the rooms and personable staff! Kudos to Smyth management!

title: The ultimate Manhattan experience
text: Our stay at the Smyth, although brief, was a pefect reminder of what makes New York such an incredible place. We stayed in the understated yet very stylish Thompson Suite, overlooking both Broadway and Chambers Street, with a view of One World Trade Center from the bedroom and living room. After a whole day catching up on everything Manhattan has to offer, watching the bustling streets below that evening, it was a relief to relax in our suite and order room service - great food. In fact the level of service was so high - everyone enthusiastic, polite and attentive - that that alone is enough to make us want to visit again asap. Thanks to the recent refurbishment of the downstairs spaces, which maintain a genuinely New York vibe, cool yet welcoming, the Smyth is right up there with the city's most iconic hotels.

title: Stay in Tribec
text: My wife and I went to visit the grandkids in NYC this weekend and we decided to try out a new place in Tribeca. Excellent choice - tired of the typical chain hotels the Smyth was a welcomed experience. Friendly staff, clean, quiet and a convenient location. An A+ to all. We were taken back on the oversize and cleanliness of our accommodations.

title: Great initial stay w cool TriBeCa Hotel
text: We just stayed at this recently renovated boutique hotel in TriBeCa, the Hotel looks beautiful.  Front Desk Manager (Dan) welcomed us and took great care of us our whole stay - courteous, informative and cheery!  Room was very comfortable and nice.  New restaurant is delicious and chic.  Lobby bar is a cool vibe.   Only good things to say!

title: Good for location, room size
text:
Stayed just one night for a Tribeca meeting and it worked out well.  The 8th floor room was very large by Manhattan standards and it was quiet despite facing the street.  There were a few carpet stains and scuffs, but it was generally clean and the bed comfortable.  My only gripe was the marshmallow-soft pillows - having a blend of soft and hard pillows would have helped.   
Extra points for great front desk service, and I appreciated the email from the concierge before my trip asking if I needed help arranging anything.   Thumbs up.

title: Good location, great staff and super hotel
text:
The location of the hotel is ideal for down town and getting across to Jersey with the Path only a 5 min walk down.

The staff where very friendly and helpful during my second stay at the hotel, each time I have come I have found them to be great.

The hotel itself is having a makeover in the lobby area, but apart from this the rooms are clean, stylish, cosy and to the point with space unlikey many hotels downtown !!!!

I liked the terrace a lot personally 

To the duty manager

Keep up the good work and hopefully see you on my next trip to NYC at start of Dec 

TIP - Rooms on 9th floor have the terrace

title: Amazing experience
text: We were staying on our wedding anniversary and we were very happy in our choice. The service is wonderful and everyone was very kind to us. The room is beautiful and huge for NY, the bathroom is amazing. The hotel has a lovely lounge! We'll be back!

title: Always a Great Experience
text: Our company books many rooms with The Smyth and we are always beyond pleased. Wether booking rooms for clients or employees, the staff at The Smyth is always friendly and helpful. Rooms are gorgeous-- especially after the renovations-- and the location is perfect. Decor is stunning, and the view is beyond. The food for room service is AMAZING and the restaurant in the hotel is a must. I can honestly say I have never had a bad experience at The Smyth and will continue to go to them for all of my hotel needs.

title: Bad customer service
text: We are in the hospitality industry and booked our room thru a consolidator when the room was on sale.  A week before we were to arrive, the hotel sent  a confirmation showing a lower rate than we paid.  We tried everything to get something from the hotel.  The hotel did nothing; wouldn't honor the lower rate, give us an upgrade, room on a higher floor, or even a drink token for their bar.   Not very hospitable.  If you want a great hospitality experience, try the Como Group.

title: True holiday!
text:
It was our first time in NY and we wanted to stay in a truly cool hotel: check! The room was beautiful, clean, enormous, the bed was super comfortable and I really enjoyed the glass wall of the shower. The staff was super nice and friendly. The neighborhood might not be the center of night life, but that's ok since you get to sleep with no street noises and there is plenty of subway stations just ouside the door. 
There was always a bowl of fresh orange flavored water in the hall, which is a touch of great style and kindness.
I just cannot say much about the look of the hotel since the hall was undergoing maintenance, but I hope to be back and see the beautiful fireplace!

title: Un séjour magnifique
text:
Chambre superbe, top service.
Aucun doute : si nous retournons à NY, nous retournerons à cet hôtel.
Personnel incroyablement serviable.
Le soir : excellent restaurant à l'hôtel.
Environnement agréable.
A côté d'un Pain Quotidien : le top pour le petit déjeuner (et plus).

title: Luxury, Cool & Down to Earth!
text: I don't usually write reviews, but I truly enjoyed my trip to NYC this year. I mean, NYC is awesome, and there are tons of hotels but this one really is great. It is near a bunch of train stations so going anywhere is super easy. They apparently just finished renovating so the restaurant wasnt fully open, but dinner there was delish!! The lobby area has a fireplace and lots couches to relax in. It feels like home. The rooms are large and clean. The staff is GREAT; there is something about walking up to the front of the hotel or front desk or even in the hallways and seeing employees laughing and enjoying their time there. I received a note from Amanda, the front office manager, in my room, which was a nice touch. I happen to meet her and she, like many of their staff was laughing and joking around - it made me and my boyfriend feel extremely comfortable so thank you! This hotel is luxury without being stuffy. We will be back

title: Excellent experience!
text: This is the second time that I stayed at this hotel and I am really really happy with the ent to end service. Everything works perfect! all the staff is really nice and the facilities are really comfortable.

title: Amazing Hotel, Better Service
text:
This is easily the nicest New York City hotel that I have stayed in. The room was quite large, especially compared to other hotels in the city and had an outstanding view. The bathroom had a very upscale look and a huge open shower, which was one of my favorite parts of the room. 

I would definitely recommend spending some time in their new bar and lounge area. The bartender made us some great mixed drinks and we spent some time next to one of the fireplaces. It is the perfect place to have a couple drinks before dinner or going out. 

The awesome service began when I first called up to make the reservation. I spoke with Daniel who was extremely helpful. He told me all about the renovated bar and everything else the place had to offer. I was unfamiliar with Tribeca, so I asked if he had any dinner recommendations. It was obvious that he is familiar with the area, as he made sure that I had a few options to choose from and even offered to make a reservation for me. I knew immediately that I made the correct decision to stay there. When I checked in, I was helped by Franck at the front desk, who further enhanced my experience at the Smyth. He answered all my questions and made certain to accommodate me with everything I needed. 

This hotel is undoubtably worth a stay and made my night in the city one to remember. I will surely be staying here again, and I can't wait to check out the restaurant they will be putting in soon.

title: Excellent all around
text: My stay at Smyth was excellent all around. The staff was wonderful and always willing to help or accommodate in any way they could. The new lobby is beautiful. Close to the subway and in a great area of the city. Looking forward to my next stay!

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text:
I'm just back from a 4 night trip to New York with my wife and our stay at The Smyth was everything we could have expected. From the moment we were greeted by the door man to the safe flight home wish when leaving, everything was perfect. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing West Broadway but the noise exclusion was great. The bed (king) was very comfortable and room was a good size(esp. for NY)
The location is what makes it; right above a Subway, walking distance to great bars/restaurants, Century 21 and extensive shopping on Broadway/SOHO. 80's movie buffs - the ghostbusters building is 5 mins walk away.
There's a buzz about the area, with almost constant filming in the area and as the Concierge mentioned will only get better as the new tower in the WTC opens.
For a quiet night there is a movie theater only 10 mins walk away in Battery right next to a Shake Shack for pre-movie sustenance.
All in all, a great hotel, fantastic staff, amazing location....We'll be back and I'll definitely return to the Smyth when work necessitates.

title: Unforgettable experience
text: This has been my favorite hotel stay in NYC. The location is amazing, in one of the best neighborhoods and close to the subway. From the moment you are greeted by the doorman you know you are in for a white glove experience. The front desk staff were superb and the concierge were truly knowledgeable and serviceable. The sleeping room was inviting and impeccably kept. Our room also had a large balcony with breathtaking views. The new lobby bar was about to open when I stayed but seemed to be shaping up to be quite a happening place. I will keep returning to the Smyth!

title: Perfetto
text:
collocato perfettamente (anche se un po fuori downtown), metro con fermata fuori dall hotel sulla linea 1 che ti porta in uno sparo a Times square, personale gentilissimo, quasi imbarazzante nelle attenzioni. 
Vista mozzafiato sul nuovo Numero Uno. 
Noi abbiamo pure avuto la fortuna di acquistare un pacchetto convenientissimo. 
E in più attaccato c'è un locale unico dove mangiare e fare colazione, le pain quotidien. 
Che dire di più?
Consigliatissimo.
